14/10/2021.author: Andrew Webster

14/10/2021.headline: These young Australians have an urgent message for Scott Morrison ahead of COP26
14/10/2021.description: As the global climate conference nears, SBS News speaks to three Australian students who are skipping school on Friday to demand better climate policies from the federal government.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: ACT's COVID-19 lockdown comes to an end
14/10/2021.description: After nine weeks, the ACT's lockdown has lifted as the state approaches 75 per cent double-dose vaccine coverage.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: Afghan evacuees to Australia on temporary visas given pathway to permanent protection
14/10/2021.description: Scores of Afghans who were granted emergency temporary visas during the evacuation process out of Kabul are being told they can apply to stay in Australia permanently, despite their visa conditions stating otherwise.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: One million view NSW COVID-19 vaccine mandate case
14/10/2021.description: A test case on NSW vaccine mandates has been viewed more than one million times on YouTube, according to data from the NSW Supreme Court.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: Army tanks and troops deployed to quell Lebanon's worst street violence in years
14/10/2021.description: At least six people are dead and at least 32 wounded in the violence.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: Norway attack 'likely an act of terror'
14/10/2021.description: Norwegian police say a 37-year-old suspect has acknowledged killing five people in a bow and arrow attack.
14/10/2021.author: Scott Spits

14/10/2021.headline: Australia's public hospitals in crisis, AMA report says
14/10/2021.description: An Australian Medical Association report says public hospitals are in a crisis which needs to be addressed by a new funding formula.
14/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: British Foreign Office responds after High Commissioner to Australia criticised over climate 'lectures'
15/10/2021.description: In an interview with SBS News last week, British High Commissioner Vicki Treadell urged the Morrison government to set a more ambitious 2030 emissions reduction target.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Parents to be classified as ‘immediate family’ for travel to Australia, Scott Morrison confirms
15/10/2021.description: The rule change will allow parents of Australian citizens and permanent residents to return to states and territories that have reached 80 per cent full vaccination targets.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Kristina Keneally calls for post-pandemic overhaul of Australia's migration system
15/10/2021.description: Labor’s Home Affairs spokesperson said a "historic" rise in temporary migration had turned a “successful model of migration on its head” and taken Australia’s migration program in the “wrong direction”.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Scott Morrison confirms he'll attend COP26 climate talks in Glasgow
15/10/2021.description: The international climate talks are widely considered to be the most crucial meeting of their kind since the signing of the Paris Agreement in 2015.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Southern Tasmania to go into snap COVID-19 lockdown tonight
15/10/2021.description: Premier Peter Gutwein blamed the snap lockdown on a 31-year-old COVID-positive man not co-operating with authoritie
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: NSW's international border call may delay domestic travel return
15/10/2021.description: The end to quarantine for international travellers in NSW could delay the resumption of domestic travel ahead of the holiday season.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: School students demand climate action at protests across Australia
15/10/2021.description: The end to quarantine for international travellers in NSW could delay the resumption of domestic travel ahead of the holiday season.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: Victoria to scrap quarantine for fully vaccinated NSW residents amid 2,179 COVID-19 tally
15/10/2021.description: NSW residents who are fully vaccinated will be able to enter Victoria without needing to undergo quarantine upon arrival.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: How to add your COVID-19 vaccine certificate to the Service NSW app
15/10/2021.description: The COVID-19 digital vaccination certificate can now be integrated with the Service NSW app, simplifying the check-in process in NSW.
15/10/2021.author: Damien Woolnough

15/10/2021.headline: At least 41 people killed by suicide blasts at mosque in Afghan city of Kandahar
15/10/2021.description: It comes just a week after a suicide attack on worshippers at a mosque in the northern city of Kunduz.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: British Conservative MP David Amess stabbed to death at meeting with constituents
15/10/2021.description: The MP from Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservative Party was stabbed to death in a church by a man who walked into a meeting with voters from his electoral district.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: Southern Tasmania enters snap three-day coronavirus lockdown
15/10/2021.description: Premier Peter Gutwein blamed the snap lockdown on a 31-year-old COVID-positive man not co-operating with authorities.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: International airfares tipped to increase as demand from Australian travellers soars
15/10/2021.description: Airfare costs on some popular routes could soar due to pent-up demand and pandemic-constrained supply, but should stabilise in the second half of 2022, experts say.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: Parents to be classified as 'immediate family' for travel to Australia
15/10/2021.description: The rule change will allow parents of Australian citizens and permanent residents to return to states and territories that have reached 80 per cent full vaccination targets.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: Thousands of school students demand climate action at protests across Australia
15/10/2021.description: The latest School Strike 4 Climate rallies come two weeks before the United Nations Climate Change Conference in Glasgow.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: Statue of Indigenous woman replaces Columbus monument in Mexico City
15/10/2021.description: Mexico City has removed a monument of Christopher Columbus and will replace it with a statue of a pre-Hispanic Indigenous woman to represent the country's Indigenous history.
15/10/2021.author: Zach Hope

15/10/2021.headline: The federal government is yet to commit to net zero by 2050. What about the states?
15/10/2021.description: As the federal government considers a bolstered climate change policy, Australia's states and territories have forged ahead with their own emissions reductions targets. Here's a breakdown of the commitments.
15/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

15/10/2021.headline: Clinton quit drinking seven years ago and now helps the world celebrate sober
15/10/2021.description: Many First Nations entrepreneurs are struggling due to the impacts of COVID-19, but one non-alcohol beer business is bucking the trend and expanding sales worldwide.
15/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

15/10/2021.headline: Stabbing death of British MP David Amess declared a terrorist incident
15/10/2021.description: The MP from Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservative Party was stabbed to death in a church by a man who walked into a meeting with voters from his electoral district.
15/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

15/10/2021.headline: Jair Bolsonaro accused of misogyny after vetoing free menstrual products law
15/10/2021.description: The bill aimed to benefit five million women, notably students from poor neighbourhoods and prison inmates.
15/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

16/10/2021.headline: Australians with parents overseas welcome changes to family travel exemptions
16/10/2021.description: Parents of Australian citizens and permanent residents will now be allowed into the states and territories that have reached 80 per cent double dose vaccination targets.
16/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

16/10/2021.headline: Celebrations as NSW achieves 80 per cent vaccination target
16/10/2021.description: Eighty per cent of eligible residents in NSW are now fully vaccinated, triggering the next phase in the state's reopening.
16/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

16/10/2021.headline: A 15-year-old girl is among Victoria's latest COVID-19 deaths
16/10/2021.description: It comes as the state government comes under fire over a COVID-19 restriction "anomaly" that will let fully vaccinated people from NSW travel across the state before Melbourne residents.
16/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

16/10/2021.headline: ACT reports 20 new coronavirus cases as southern NSW travel restrictions ease
16/10/2021.description: Travel arrangements with southern NSW locations, including Batemans Bay and Perisher Valley, have now been relaxed.
16/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

16/10/2021.headline: New Zealand reaches single day vaccination target on 'Super Saturday'
16/10/2021.description: More than two per cent of New Zealand has been vaccinated in a single day - Super Saturday - as health officials record 41 new cases of COVID-19.
16/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

16/10/2021.headline: After COVID-19 delays, Australia's new Antarctic icebreaker docks in Hobart
16/10/2021.description: Australia's $529 million icebreaker, the RSV Nuyina, arrived in Hobart with little of the planned fanfare, due to the city's snap lockdown.
16/10/2021.author: Stephanie Darling

16/10/2021.headline: Celebrations as NSW hits 80 per cent double COVID-19 vaccination target
16/10/2021.description: Eighty per cent of eligible residents in NSW are now fully vaccinated, triggering the next phase in the state's reopening.
16/10/2021.author: Jack Latimore

16/10/2021.headline: PNG cricketers band together for T20 World Cup after family tragedies
16/10/2021.description: Papua New Guinea's cricket team will play its first-ever T20 World Cup match against Oman on Sunday, but the road to the tournament has been difficult, with three players affected personally by COVID-19.
16/10/2021.author: Jack Latimore

16/10/2021.headline: Security of British MPs reviewed after David Amess stabbed to death
16/10/2021.description: Police are reviewing the security arrangements for all 650 MPs in Britain after the stabbing death of veteran Conservative Party MP David Amess.
16/10/2021.author: Jack Latimore

16/10/2021.headline: Myanmar's junta chief will be excluded from an upcoming ASEAN summit
16/10/2021.description: The decision taken by foreign ministers from the Association of Southeast Asian Nations marks a rare bold step for the consensus-driven bloc.
16/10/2021.author: Jack Latimore

16/10/2021.headline: US offers to pay relatives of 10 killed in botched Afghan drone strike
16/10/2021.description: The US Defense Department says the offer includes ex-gratia condolence payments as well support for family members who are interested in relocation to the United States.
16/10/2021.author: Jack Latimore

16/10/2021.headline: Suddenly we are in the middle of a global energy crisis. What happened?
16/10/2021.description: ANALYSIS: As the world adjusts to living with COVID-19, there is an energy crisis affecting the global supply of oil, gas and coal - and Australia is not immune to the growing uncertainty.
16/10/2021.author: Jack Latimore

16/10/2021.headline: Women escaping domestic violence to get access to $5,000 payments from this week
16/10/2021.description: The Escaping Violence Payment, which will be available from Tuesday, comes as many states and territories have reported jumps in the number of domestic violence cases during COVID-19 lockdowns.
16/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: As Victoria emerges from COVID-19 lockdown, this is what residents will be able to enjoy
17/10/2021.description: Victorians will farewell lockdown ahead of schedule this week. Here's what residents of Melbourne and regional Victoria will be able to do from this Friday and beyond.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: Fresh mental health funding as NSW reports 10 COVID-19 deaths and 301 local cases
17/10/2021.description: It comes a day after the state reached its 80 per cent double vaccination target, clearing the way for a further easing of restrictions from Monday.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: No new coronavirus cases in Tasmania as southern lockdown continues
17/10/2021.description: Tasmania has again recorded no new COVID-19 cases, but health authorities say it is still too early to tell whether the lockdown in the state's south can be lifted on Monday as planned.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: 'Highly unlikely': Nationals leader says little support for increasing 2030 climate target
17/10/2021.description: The federal government's coalition partner, the Nationals, has yet to reach a consensus position on emission reduction targets with Barnaby Joyce saying he believes there is little support for a steep increase to the 2030 target.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: 'Mr Morrison has a choice': Communities of faith demand climate action at protests around Australia
17/10/2021.description: Australia's diverse faith communities have held protests around the country calling on Prime Minister Scott Morrison to make stronger emissions reduction targets by 2030.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: Three COVID-19 cases among asylum seekers detained in Melbourne detention hotel
17/10/2021.description: Detainees inside a Melbourne hotel used to house asylum seekers say three people have tested positive for COVID-19, fuelling fears of a mass outbreak.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: Former Labor leader Jodi McKay resigns from NSW parliament
17/10/2021.description: Former NSW Labor leader Jodi McKay has announced she will resign from parliament, triggering a fifth by-election in the state.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: Australia purchases supply for additional COVID-19 treatments
17/10/2021.description: Australia has secured two new treatments in its battle with COVID-19, but these will not replace vaccinations Health Minister Greg Hunt says.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: Quarantine-free travel from NZ's South Island to Australia to resume this week
17/10/2021.description: The so-called green lane travel bubble between Australia and New Zealand was halted earlier this year after the Delta variant of COVID-19 hit the southeast of Australia.
17/10/2021.author: Mathew Dunckley

17/10/2021.headline: Three asylum seekers detained in a Melbourne hotel have tested positive to COVID-19
17/10/2021.description: The Australian Border Force says the three asylum seekers who tested positive for COVID-19 were immediately placed in quarantine.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

17/10/2021.headline: Restrictions ease further in NSW after passing 80 per cent double vaccination mark
17/10/2021.description: NSW hit the 80 per cent full vaccination target a week earlier than expected.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

17/10/2021.headline: International travel vaccination certificates will be available on MyGov this week
17/10/2021.description: From Tuesday Australians will be able to apply for an international proof of COVID-19 vaccination, allowing for safe overseas travel.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

17/10/2021.headline: Restrictions in Victoria are changing. Here's what you need to know
17/10/2021.description: Victorians will farewell lockdown ahead of schedule this week. Here's what residents of Melbourne and regional Victoria will be able to do from this Friday and beyond.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

17/10/2021.headline: Communities of faith demand more climate action at protests across Australia
17/10/2021.description: Australia's diverse faith communities have held protests around the country calling on Prime Minister Scott Morrison to make stronger emissions reduction targets by 2030.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

17/10/2021.headline: Family of murdered veteran British MP David Amess 'absolutely broken'
17/10/2021.description: British media has identified the suspect as a British national of Somali descent who had been referred to Prevent, the official counter-terrorist scheme for those thought to be at risk of radicalisation.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

17/10/2021.headline: Spain's Pedro Sanchez has vowed to abolish prostitution in the country
17/10/2021.description: The Spanish PM flagged the move at the end of a three-day congress of his Socialist party on Sunday.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

17/10/2021.headline: 'Highly unlikely' Nationals will back greater 2030 climate target, Barnaby Joyce says
17/10/2021.description: The federal government's coalition partner, the Nationals, has yet to reach a consensus position on emission reduction targets with Barnaby Joyce saying he believes there is little support for a steep increase to the 2030 target.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

17/10/2021.headline: Former NSW Labor leader Jodi McKay resigns from state parliament
17/10/2021.description: Former NSW Labor leader Jodi McKay has announced she will resign from parliament, triggering a fifth by-election in the state.
17/10/2021.author: David Crowe

18/10/2021.headline: Net zero emissions plan at impasse with Nationals still refusing to endorse target
18/10/2021.description: The Coalition is set for a showdown on Tuesday, as Liberals and Nationals tackle the government's proposed climate policy behind closed doors.
18/10/2021.author: Jon Pierik

18/10/2021.headline: Push to ban unnecessary medical procedures performed without consent on intersex Australians grows
18/10/2021.description: Advocacy groups have welcomed an Australian Human Rights Commission report calling for an end to unnecessary medical procedures performed on intersex people without their consent.
18/10/2021.author: Jon Pierik

18/10/2021.headline: Unvaccinated asylum seeker asked for COVID-19 jab before testing positive in detention
18/10/2021.description: Mohammad Sohrabi, detained at the Park Hotel in Melbourne, is fearful for his health after testing positive for COVID-19.
18/10/2021.author: Jon Pierik

18/10/2021.headline: Queensland to reopen by Christmas regardless of population's vaccination rates
18/10/2021.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says the state will fully reopen by mid-December even if it hasn't vaccinated 80 per cent of its population.
18/10/2021.author: Jon Pierik

18/10/2021.headline: ICAC hears evidence of 'unusual' process for funding grant in Gladys Berejiklian investigation
18/10/2021.description: The NSW corruption watchdog has heard of an "extremely unusual" process for a funding grant at an inquiry into whether Gladys Berejiklian breached public trust.
18/10/2021.author: Jon Pierik

18/10/2021.headline: Victoria records 1,903 local COVID-19 cases as state prepares for end of lockdown
18/10/2021.description: The state government on Monday announced businesses and councils can apply for a share in a $54.5 million fund to move towards outdoor trading as Victoria emerges from lockdown.
18/10/2021.author: Jon Pierik

18/10/2021.headline: Southern Tasmania exits COVID-19 lockdown, but some rules remain
18/10/2021.description: The island state's south exited lockdown at 6pm on Monday, though restrictions around mask-wearing and aged care and hospital settings will remain until Friday.
18/10/2021.author: Jon Pierik

18/10/2021.headline: NSW records 265 new local COVID-19 cases as restrictions ease further
18/10/2021.description: Monday also marks the return to school for the first time in months for thousands of children in NSW.
18/10/2021.author: Jon Pierik

18/10/2021.headline: Colin Powell, the first black US secretary of state, dies aged 84
18/10/2021.description: A son of Jamaican immigrants, Mr Powell frequently shattered glass ceilings in a pioneering career that took him from combat in Vietnam to becoming America's first black national security advisor under then-president Ronald Reagan.
18/10/2021.author: Jenna Price

18/10/2021.headline: Myanmar's junta to free more than 5,000 anti-military coup protesters from jail
18/10/2021.description: It comes on the heels of the ASEAN decision to exclude Myanmar's junta from an upcoming summit over its commitment to defusing the country's crisis.
18/10/2021.author: Jenna Price

18/10/2021.headline: The migrant mothers raising their babies alone amid Australia's lockdowns
18/10/2021.description: Navigating parenthood during a pandemic has been difficult for most people, but the hardship for some of those with no family connections in Australia has been amplified.
18/10/2021.author: Jenna Price

18/10/2021.headline: Malala Yousafzai urges the Taliban to let Afghan girls return to school
18/10/2021.description: It's now been a month since the Taliban returned to power in Afghanistan and forbid girls from returning to secondary school.
18/10/2021.author: Jenna Price

18/10/2021.headline: US Justice Department asks Supreme Court to block Texas' 'unconstitutional' abortion law
18/10/2021.description: The filing is the latest legal maneuver in the fight over the controversial Senate Bill 8, which bans abortions after six weeks, before many women even know they are pregnant.
18/10/2021.author: Jenna Price

18/10/2021.headline: The impact of living with a suspected narcissist
18/10/2021.description: The term ‘narcissist’ seems to get thrown around a lot these days as a negative slur. But just how prevalent is narcissism really?
18/10/2021.author: Jenna Price

18/10/2021.headline: Brutal massacre of Algerians in Paris remembered 60 years on
18/10/2021.description: On the 60th anniversary of a bloody massacre in Paris, Algerians reel over the hundreds of lives lost with no accountability from the French government.
18/10/2021.author: Jenna Price

18/10/2021.headline: SIEV X anniversary: Cover-up claims remain 20 years after 353 asylum seekers drowned
18/10/2021.description: This week marks 20 years since a fishing boat sank between Indonesia and Australia with hundreds of asylum seekers on board. Amid disputed claims of a cover-up, a fresh court case may soon shed more light on what happened
18/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

18/10/2021.headline: 'Fab jab' clinics are popping up this week to help LGBTIQ+ Victorians get vaccinated
18/10/2021.description: It comes as another $21 million is pledged towards vaccinating those who have faced barriers in getting their COVID-19 jab, such as people living with disability, culturally diverse communities, and family violence survivors.
18/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: Doctors voice concern for asylum seekers as COVID-19 outbreak at Melbourne detention hotel worsens
19/10/2021.description: Australian doctors say they have serious concerns for the health of asylum seekers as a COVID-19 outbreak at a Melbourne detention hotel grows.
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: Meet Tsehay Hawkins: the teenager taking over as the Yellow Wiggle
19/10/2021.description: At 15 years old, world champion dancer and year 10 student Tsehay Hawkins is the youngest Wiggle in the group's 30-year history.
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: Gladys Berejiklian's relationship with MP a 'red flag', ICAC investigation hears
19/10/2021.description: Gladys Berejiklian ensured a funding proposal for a "low priority" shooting facility came before a cabinet committee, a corruption probe has heard.
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: One person is displaced every second by our warming planet. Where will they go?
19/10/2021.description: Rising sea levels, fires, floods and other natural disasters are leaving people with no choice but to move away from their homes.
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: Increase skilled migration to 200,000 per year, says leading business group
19/10/2021.description: The Australian Chamber of Commerce and Industry says migration targets must be set to address “severe” skill shortages to promote post-pandemic recovery.
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: Holocaust survivor Eddie Jaku to be honoured with NSW state memorial service
19/10/2021.description: "When he chose Australia after surviving the Holocaust, our nation gained a remarkable individual", NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet said of Eddie Jaku, who passed away this month at the age of 101.
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: Victoria reports 1,749 local COVID-19 cases amid new push to vaccinate vulnerable
19/10/2021.description: The state government is spending another $21 million to vaccinate those who have faced barriers in getting their COVID-19 jab.
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: NSW unveils almost $500 million in new funding for women escaping domestic violence
19/10/2021.description: The NSW government has announced its single biggest investment in tackling domestic and family violence which will almost double the number of refuges for women and children escaping abuse.
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: ACT to allow travel from Sydney next month, records 24 new COVID-19 cases
19/10/2021.description: The ACT will remove quarantine requirements for residents returning from anywhere in NSW, including Sydney, from 1 Novembe
19/10/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

19/10/2021.headline: Dorinda Cox calls for national inquiry into missing and murdered First Nations women in maiden Senate speech
19/10/2021.description: Western Australia’s first female Aboriginal Senator has been a strong advocate for women’s safety and is herself a survivor of family violence.
19/10/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

19/10/2021.headline: Doctors concerned for asylum seekers in Melbourne hotel as COVID-19 outbreak worsens
19/10/2021.description: Australian doctors say they have serious concerns for the health of asylum seekers as a COVID-19 outbreak at a Melbourne detention hotel grows.
19/10/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

19/10/2021.headline: Police officer charged with murder of Yamatji woman gives evidence in court
19/10/2021.description: A WA police officer charged with murder for fatally shooting an Aboriginal woman two years ago has given evidence during his own tria
19/10/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

19/10/2021.headline: Victoria opens to fully vaccinated from Sydney
19/10/2021.description: Fully vaccinated travellers arriving in Victoria from Sydney will no longer have to quarantine or get tested.
19/10/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

19/10/2021.headline: Deadline looms for the unvaccinated in Queensland
19/10/2021.description: Authorities say unvaccinated Queenslanders must act now if they want to be protected against COVID-19 when borders reopen.
19/10/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

19/10/2021.headline: Don't boost climate deniers: scientist
19/10/2021.description: News media organisations as well as Facebook and Twitter have been urged not to amplify the voices of those opposed to science.
19/10/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

19/10/2021.headline: How to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccinations in Australia
19/10/2021.description: With parts of the country reopening and international travel restrictions set to ease, showing proof of vaccination is mandatory at some venues. Here's how to get your digital certificate and what to do if you're heading overseas.
19/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

19/10/2021.headline: Australia says work continues to save Afghans who helped ADF amid reported execution of interpreter
19/10/2021.description: The immigration minister says work to get Afghan interpreters safely out of the country following the death of a translator is ongoing.
19/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: COVID-19 made life more accessible for people with disability. Will it stay that way?
20/10/2021.description: Measures introduced at the start of the pandemic to reduce the spread of COVID-19 made parts of society more accessible for people in Australia. But as we emerge, there’s concern that accessibility could be taken away again.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: Christian Porter won't be investigated for accepting anonymous legal donations
20/10/2021.description: Labor has failed in its bid to refer former attorney-general Christian Porter to parliament's privileges committee over his use of anonymous donations to fund his defamation action.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: Law to hand the government greater visa cancellation powers blocked by Senate
20/10/2021.description: The Opposition raised concerns over the bill, saying that low-level offending could be caught up in its remit and there was the potential for unintended impacts on domestic violence victims.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: Panic buying during pandemic impacted access to culturally appropriate food, charity says
20/10/2021.description: Foodbank has released a new report that found one in six adults in Australia haven’t had enough to eat in the last year, and 1.2 million children have gone hungry.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: Mike Baird 'incredulous' upon learning of Gladys Berejiklian, Daryl Maguire relationship
20/10/2021.description: Former NSW premier Mike Baird says he was "incredulous" upon learning of the relationship between ex-MP Daryl Maguire and his successor Gladys Berejiklian.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: World on track to blow past 1.5C warming target, pump out double the amount of fossil fuels
20/10/2021.description: The UN's Environment Programme says government fossil fuel production plans this decade are "dangerously out of sync" with the emissions cuts needed.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: WA to enforce COVID-19 vaccinations for most workers by year's end
20/10/2021.description: West Australian Premier Mark McGowan has announced COVID-19 vaccinations will be mandated for most of the state's workers by the end of the year.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: Barnaby Joyce promises Nationals decision on net zero emissions plan by week’s end
20/10/2021.description: The deputy prime minister has set up an advisory group within the Nationals Party to assess concerns about adopting a net zero emissions target by 2050.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: Victoria firm on hospitality vaccination mandate ahead of Friday reopening
20/10/2021.description: The Australian Hotels Association Victoria says the last-minute clarification has made it harder for businesses to be fully prepared for the state's reopening on Friday.
20/10/2021.author: Cameron Houston

20/10/2021.headline: Australia ranked last among developed nations on climate performance and pledges
20/10/2021.description: In the lead up to COP26, the Climate Council has labelled Australia the worst-performing developed country in a report the federal government has called "misleading and complete rubbish".
20/10/2021.author: None found

20/10/2021.headline: Parkland high school shooter pleads guilty, says he's 'very sorry'
20/10/2021.description: The man pleaded guilty to 17 counts of first-degree murder and 17 counts of attempted murder for those wounded during the attack, which sparked a student-led movement for stricter gun laws.
20/10/2021.author: None found

20/10/2021.headline: Australian government condemns Taliban following murder of Afghan interpreter
20/10/2021.description: The family of an Afghan man say he was brutally beaten to death by the Taliban because of his work with Australian troops.
20/10/2021.author: None found

20/10/2021.headline: This regional NSW coal town faces an uncertain future as COP26 approaches
20/10/2021.description: Singleton locals are wary of a "transition" away from coal, the town's mayor says, as the Morrison government formulates its plan for a net zero target ahead of COP26
20/10/2021.author: None found

20/10/2021.headline: Greens push to extend visas for people stuck overseas during pandemic
20/10/2021.description: The legislation would automatically credit a temporary visa holder’s visa with the amount of time Australia’s international border was closed, or with the time they have lost due to the international border closure.
20/10/2021.author: None found

21/10/2021.headline: Asylum seeker hospitalised with COVID-19 following detention hotel outbreak
21/10/2021.description: An asylum seeker has been hospitalised with COVID-19 as fears grow over an outbreak in a Melbourne detention hotel.
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: Balinese restaurant offers free delivery to the immunocompromised as Melbourne reopens
21/10/2021.description: A Balinese restaurant in Melbourne is offering free deliveries to those most vulnerable to COVID-19, in a bid to keep its customers safe as Victoria emerges from lockdown.
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: Eddie and Moses Obeid, Ian Macdonald jailed over conspiracy
21/10/2021.description: Former NSW minister Eddie Obeid, his son Moses and his ex-colleague Ian Macdonald have been jailed over a conspiracy that led to a $30 million windfal
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: Government’s blocking of investigation into Christian Porter raises accountability concerns
21/10/2021.description: Labor has slammed the government for blocking the inquiry into Christian Porter's legal donations as "appalling" and accused Prime Minister Scott Morrison of "protecting his mates".
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: Gladys Berejiklian key to gun club funding, ICAC hears
21/10/2021.description: As NSW premier, Gladys Berejiklian was behind a push to revise analysis of a funding proposal from Wagga Wagga MP Daryl Maguire, a corruption inquiry has heard.
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: New inquiry to probe Christchurch mosque terror attacks
21/10/2021.description: Citing questions and concerns from the families of victims, New Zealand's coroner has opened an inquiry into the 2019 Christchurch mosque terror attacks.
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: Victoria records 2,232 new COVID-19 cases as Melbourne prepares to exit lockdown
21/10/2021.description: A further 2,232 local COVID-19 cases and 12 deaths have been reported in Victoria as Melbourne prepares for the end of its sixth lockdown.
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: Queenslanders urged to 'do much better' in vaccinating as state records one new local COVID-19 case
21/10/2021.description: A new locally acquired case of COVID-19 has emerged on the Gold Coast and Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says it's a wake-up call for the region.
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: Malka Leifer to face sexual abuse trial in 2022
21/10/2021.description: Former ultra-orthodox school principal Malka Leifer will stand trial on child sexual abuse charges next year, Victoria's County Court has confirmed.
21/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Knight

21/10/2021.headline: Sexual assault complaints in Australian Defence Force soar to eight-year high
21/10/2021.description: The Department of Defence says 63 out of the 187 alleged sexual assault incidents reported in 2020-21 remain under active investigation.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: Melbourne has emerged from its sixth lockdown
21/10/2021.description: Lockdown has lifted in Melbourne and Mildura after Victoria reached its 70 per cent double-dose vaccination target this week.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: Murder charge overturned for US cop that killed Australian Justine Damond Ruszczyk
21/10/2021.description: A former Minneapolis police officer who fatally shot US-Australian dual citizen Justine Damond Ruszczyk has been sentenced to 57 months in jail.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: Sexual assault survivors hope NSW consent laws will inspire nationwide reform
21/10/2021.description: Sexual assault survivor Saxon Mullins says the reforms would bring laws "up to the standard that they should be at already".
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: The AFL has mandated COVID-19 vaccinations for all its players
21/10/2021.description: It comes as NRL CEO Andrew Abdo says its players will not be mandated to have a COVID-19 vaccine, but warned unvaccinated players would be subject to more stringent protocols.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: Asylum seeker hospitalised with COVID-19 following Melbourne detention hotel outbreak
21/10/2021.description: An asylum seeker has been hospitalised with COVID-19 as fears grow over an outbreak in a Melbourne detention hotel.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: Five countries that could make or break the planet's future
21/10/2021.description: ANALYSIS: The upcoming COP26 climate summit will feature more than 100 world leaders and it could be the last chance for the world to band together to combat irreversible climate change.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: Why Indigenous people cannot be aliens in their own land
21/10/2021.description: OPINION: A new 'Aboriginal aliens' case has come before the High Court. It is not acceptable for the law to disregard, or further constrain, the reality of First Nations’ prior possession of this country.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: Lawyers make final stand in trial of WA police officer accused of Yamatji woman's murder
21/10/2021.description: Lawyers have delivered their closing arguments in the WA Supreme Court trial of a police officer charged with murder for fatally shooting an Aboriginal woman.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: This Melbourne restaurant is offering free delivery to immunocompromised residents
21/10/2021.description: A Balinese restaurant in Melbourne is offering free deliveries to those most vulnerable to COVID-19 in a bid to keep its customers safe as Victoria emerges from lockdown.
21/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

21/10/2021.headline: Qantas is bringing forward the restart of international flights
21/10/2021.description: The announcements come as Prime Minister Scott Morrison says the government is in the final stages of securing a travel bubble with Singapore.
21/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Victorians rejoice as state reopens, saying goodbye to a world record 263 days in lockdown
22/10/2021.description: The longest lockdown in the world was officially lifted on Friday midnight in Victoria with residents celebrating a return back to normal life.
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Australia rejects leaked claims it lobbied to change major UN climate report
22/10/2021.description: Australia had asked the UN to play down the need to phase out fossil fuels, according to leaked documents obtained by Greenpeace and reported by the BBC.
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Four people died and self-harm incidents rose in immigration detention last year
22/10/2021.description: The figures are contained in the most recent Department of Home Affairs annual report.
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Joe Biden says 'yes' US would defend Taiwan against China
22/10/2021.description: Military tensions between Taiwan and China are at their worst in more than 40 years, Taiwan's defence minister Chiu Kuo-cheng said this month, adding China would be capable of mounting a "full-scale" invasion by 2025.
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Former students call out schools for ‘policing’ the length of school skirts
22/10/2021.description: Former female students at schools around Australia have slammed skirt length requirements, which they say are sometimes enforced in "embarrassing and degrading ways".
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Grace Tame excluded from drafting of national plan to prevent child sexual abuse
22/10/2021.description: The Australian of the Year found out about the federal government’s national strategy while being interviewed live on the ABC News Channel.
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Victoria to scrap international quarantine as Melbourne emerges from sixth lockdown
22/10/2021.description: The state announced on Friday it had recorded 2,189 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases and a further 16 deaths on the day Melbourne emerged from its sixth lockdown.
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Travel applications open for overseas parents of Australian citizens and residents
22/10/2021.description: Applications opened on Friday for travel to Australia starting 1 November, when various parental relationships will be included in the definition of "immediate family".
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins dead after Alec Baldwin fires prop gun
22/10/2021.description: A police investigation is underway to determine how and what type of projectile was discharged from the prop gun.
22/10/2021.author: None found

22/10/2021.headline: WA police officer not guilty of murder over death of Yamatji woman JC
22/10/2021.description: A Western Australian police officer who fatally shot an Aboriginal woman has been found not guilty of murder.
22/10/2021.author: Broede Carmody

22/10/2021.headline: Former Australian students call out schools for 'policing' the length of skirts
22/10/2021.description: Former female students at schools around Australia have slammed skirt length requirements, which they say are sometimes enforced in "embarrassing and degrading ways".
22/10/2021.author: Broede Carmody

22/10/2021.headline: These three children were killed in the Beirut blast. Their parents want to know why
22/10/2021.description: Political interference is stalling an investigation into last year's explosion at the port of Beirut. The families of those killed - including an Australian toddler - say they won't rest until they get answers.
22/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

22/10/2021.headline: Is this Australia's most optimistic restaurant owner?
22/10/2021.description: Hospitality venues in Sydney and Melbourne are busy again as lockdowns lift, despite many owners carrying big losses. However, one founder is expanding his Turkish restaurants city-wide in anticipation of a spending boom.
22/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: Victoria reports 1,750 COVID-19 cases and nine deaths after emerging from lockdown
23/10/2021.description: Victoria has emerged from lockdown, but authorities have warned daily COVID-19 cases are expected to reach record highs in the coming weeks.
23/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: COVID-19 transmitted in NSW bars and gyms amid reminder on mask use
23/10/2021.description: NSW Health is urging people to wear masks in high-risk indoor venues, saying it is still possible for fully vaccinated people to contract COVID-19.
23/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: National Farmer's Federation supports net zero target by 2050
23/10/2021.description: The National Party has yet to finalise its position on climate policy, even as constituents are calling for a net zero target by 2050.
23/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: Protesters urge release of asylum seekers in Melbourne hotel after COVID-19 outbreak
23/10/2021.description: It is understood 16 refugees inside the hotel have tested positive for COVID-19.
23/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: Hollywood mourns Halyna Hutchins as anger mounts over fatal film set shooting
23/10/2021.description: The 42-year-old cinematographer was filming a movie in New Mexico when she was fatally shot by a prop gun fired by Alec Baldwin.
23/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: Disgraced former NSW Labor minister Eddie Obeid back behind bars
23/10/2021.description: Former NSW Labor minister Eddie Obeid is in prison following a failed bail application after he was sentenced over a rigged coal exploration tender.
23/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: EU again postpones trade talks with Australia after scrapped submarine deal with France
23/10/2021.description: Australia's new round of trade talks with the European Union has been postponed for the second time this month, Trade Minister Dan Tehan says.
23/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: Excitement as Matildas face Brazil in first of two friendly matches in Sydney
23/10/2021.description: The Matildas have not played in Australia since March 2020, but will take on Brazil in the first of two fixtures on Saturday in Parramatta.
23/10/2021.author: Jennifer Duke

23/10/2021.headline: Protests after murder acquittal over death of Yamitji woman JC
23/10/2021.description: Protesters gathered in the WA city of Geraldton after the murder acquittal of a police officer over the death of a 29-year-old Indigenous woman known as JC.
23/10/2021.author: Andrew Taylor

23/10/2021.headline: Australian states almost set for resumption of international travel
23/10/2021.description: Australia's international borders reopen on 1 November as arrangements continue to include Singapore in a quarantine-free travel bubble arrangement.
23/10/2021.author: Andrew Taylor

23/10/2021.headline: National Farmers' Federation supports net zero target by 2050
23/10/2021.description: The National Party has yet to finalise its position on climate policy, even as constituents are calling for a net zero target by 2050.
23/10/2021.author: Andrew Taylor

23/10/2021.headline: US says no change in Taiwan policy after Joe Biden sparks confusion
23/10/2021.description: The White House has clarified there is no change in US policy on Taiwan after President Joe Biden promised to defend the island from Chinese attack, angering China.
23/10/2021.author: Andrew Taylor

23/10/2021.headline: Alec Baldwin was told prop gun was safe, affidavit says
23/10/2021.description: Alec Baldwin has described the fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchin with a prop gun as a "tragic accident".
23/10/2021.author: Andrew Taylor

23/10/2021.headline: Brain control advance in Parkinson's care a huge leap forward, neurologist says
23/10/2021.description: Technology allowing doctors to remotely control brain function in Parkinson's disease patients has been approved for use in Australia, Europe and the US.
23/10/2021.author: Andrew Taylor

23/10/2021.headline: Here in the Pacific, the climate crisis has already arrived
23/10/2021.description: Over decades, we’ve watched with alarm as the intensity of storms increases, writes Oxfam's Ilisapeci Masivesi. We need countries to step up at COP26.
23/10/2021.author: None found

23/10/2021.headline: Nationals to meet to thrash out climate policy ahead of Scott Morrison's COP26 trip
23/10/2021.description: The Nationals will meet on Sunday afternoon to discuss a net zero emissions policy for Prime Minister Scott Morrison to take to the UN climate conference in Glasgow.
23/10/2021.author: None found

23/10/2021.headline: NSW records 296 new COVID-19 cases and four more deaths
23/10/2021.description: NSW has recorded 296 new local COVID-19 infections and a further four deaths.
23/10/2021.author: None found

23/10/2021.headline: Top oil exporter Saudi Arabia targets net zero emissions by 2060
23/10/2021.description: Days before the COP26 global climate summit, the Middle Eastern nation says it aims to tackle climate change while ensuring oil market stability.
23/10/2021.author: None found

23/10/2021.headline: Husband of Halyna Hutchins says her legacy is 'too meaningful to encapsulate in words'
23/10/2021.description: Tributes have flowed for rising cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, as the entertainment industry grapples with the on-set tragedy.
23/10/2021.author: None found

24/10/2021.headline: Government launches campaign to boost Indigenous vaccination rates
24/10/2021.description: Two new vaccination campaigns are being launched, one aimed at getting the final 10-15 per cent Australians jabbed, the other focused on Indigenous people.
24/10/2021.author: None found

24/10/2021.headline: Victoria updates COVID-19 reopening roadmap. What does that mean for you?
24/10/2021.description: Fully vaccinated Victorians will soon be able to attend major events with no restrictions and live life as normal, so what exactly does that mean for you?
24/10/2021.author: None found

24/10/2021.headline: Melbourne detention hotel COVID-19 outbreak worsens as three more asylum seekers test positive
24/10/2021.description: The Australian Border Force has confirmed a cluster of COVID-19 cases among asylum seekers detained at Melbourne's Park Hotel has grown to 20, with refugee advocates pushing for the men to be moved into a better facility.
24/10/2021.author: None found

24/10/2021.headline: The Australian teacher who has been named one of the best in the world
24/10/2021.description: The prestigious Global Teacher Prize has finalised its top ten teachers from across the globe, and one of them is from Australi
24/10/2021.author: None found

24/10/2021.headline: IVF genetic services added to Medicare
24/10/2021.description: The Morrison government has added IVF genetic disorder services to Medicare, as well as including a cancer treatment in the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme.
24/10/2021.author: None found

24/10/2021.headline: Italy's far-right leader Matteo Salvini faces migrants trial, actor Richard Gere to testify
24/10/2021.description: The leader of the far-right League party is facing charges of kidnapping and abuse of office for using his position as interior minister to detain 147 migrants at sea in 201
24/10/2021.author: None found

24/10/2021.headline: Nationals give conditional support for net zero emissions by 2050 target
24/10/2021.description: The Nationals have given Prime Minister Scott Morrison the green light to take a net zero by 2050 target to the UN climate conference in Glasgow.
24/10/2021.author: Sarah Keoghan

24/10/2021.headline: Campaign launched to boost Indigenous vaccination rates
24/10/2021.description: Two new vaccination campaigns are being launched, one aimed at getting the final 10-15 per cent Australians jabbed, the other focused on Indigenous people.
24/10/2021.author: Sarah Keoghan

24/10/2021.headline: 'Champagne day': Business groups in Victoria look forward to eased COVID-19 restrictions
24/10/2021.description: While there's been overwhelming support for Victoria's reopening plan which starts this Friday, Save Victorian Events Inc says there is a lack of clarity around rules for indoor events.
24/10/2021.author: Sarah Keoghan

24/10/2021.headline: What the changes to Victoria's reopening roadmap mean for you
24/10/2021.description: Fully vaccinated Victorians will soon be able to attend major events with no restrictions and live life as normal, so what exactly does that mean for you?
24/10/2021.author: Sarah Keoghan

24/10/2021.headline: Husband of detained British-Iranian Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe begins new hunger strike in London
24/10/2021.description: It comes after Ms Zaghari-Ratcliffe, who has been held in Iran since 2016, lost her appeal on a second jail term.
24/10/2021.author: Sarah Keoghan

24/10/2021.headline: More asylum seekers test positive for COVID-19 in Melbourne hotel
24/10/2021.description: The Australian Border Force has confirmed a cluster of COVID-19 cases among asylum seekers detained at Melbourne's Park Hotel has grown to 20, with refugee advocates pushing for the men to be moved into a better facility.
24/10/2021.author: Sarah Keoghan

24/10/2021.headline: Australians using IVF genetic testing can soon claim Medicare rebate
24/10/2021.description: The Morrison government has added IVF genetic disorder services to Medicare, as well as including a cancer treatment in the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme.
24/10/2021.author: Sarah Keoghan

24/10/2021.headline: NSW records 294 new local COVID-19 cases as all students return to the classroom
24/10/2021.description: There have now been more than 500 COVID-related deaths in the latest NSW outbreak.
24/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Reports of military coup in Sudan as forces arrest prime minister and other leaders
25/10/2021.description: The developments come just two days after a Sudanese faction calling for a transfer of power to civilian rule warned of a "creeping coup".
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Barnaby Joyce and the Nationals stay silent on net zero emissions deal
25/10/2021.description: The Coalition has finally reached an agreed position on combatting climate change after years of intense internal divisions, but details of the plan have yet to be revealed.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Aspects of Gladys Berejiklian grant process unusual, John Barilaro tells ICAC
25/10/2021.description: The former NSW deputy premier has described several aspects of a grant process being probed by the state's corruption watchdog as "unusual".
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Australia's Telstra-Digicel deal about shutting China out of Pacific, analysts say
25/10/2021.description: Telstra has agreed to buy telco Digicel Pacific with the help of almost $1.8 billion - more than the entire Pacific aid program on any given year.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Mixed emotions for regional NSW as it prepares to reopen to tourists
25/10/2021.description: The relaxation of regional travel rules will give businesses a welcome boost, but many are nervous visitors will spread COVID-19 and infect vulnerable populations.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Renewed push to vaccinate Indigenous Victorians as state records 1,461 COVID-19 cases
25/10/2021.description: About 58 per cent of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people in Victoria aged over 12 are fully vaccinated, compared to 91.4 per cent of the wider population.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Prominent Tasmanians call for state to raise age of criminal responsibility to 14
25/10/2021.description: The Tasmanian Legislative Council is scheduled to debate a motion this week to increase the minimum age from 10 to 14.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: ‘We have left it too late’: COP26 unlikely to limit warming to 1.5C, scientists warn
25/10/2021.description: Scientists say a target of 2C of warming will be nearly impossible to reach unless the world commits to reaching net zero emissions even sooner.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Israel announces plan to build 1,300 new West Bank settler homes, drawing fury
25/10/2021.description: The new homes add to the more than 2,000 residences which defence sources have said in August would be authorised for West Bank settlers.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Australian uni students demand greater climate action ahead of COP26
25/10/2021.description: Students say the government shouldn’t expect "pats on the back" for taking the "lower than bare minimum" approach to combatting the climate crisis.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

25/10/2021.headline: Three people killed after Sudan's military seizes power in coup
25/10/2021.description: Sudan's top general has declared a state of emergency after armed forces detained government leaders that have been heading the transition to full civilian rule following the 2019 ouster of Omar al-Bashir.
25/10/2021.author: Chip Le Grand

25/10/2021.headline: More than half of all Afghans are facing an acute food crisis, the UN says
25/10/2021.description: The UN World Food Programme has warned millions of Afghans will face starvation this winter unless urgent action is taken.
25/10/2021.author: Chip Le Grand

25/10/2021.headline: The story behind this intimate and award-winning father-son photo
25/10/2021.description: Mehmet Aslan has taken out top honours at the Siena International Photo Awards after capturing a moment between a father and son without limbs in Turkey. Here, he tells SBS News the story behind the shot.
25/10/2021.author: Chip Le Grand

25/10/2021.headline: What is COP26 and why does it matter for Australia?
25/10/2021.description: It has been described as the 'last best chance to save the planet', but world leaders heading to Glasgow for the November climate summit have very different ideas about what needs to be done.
25/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: Scott Morrison unveils Australia’s plan to achieve net zero emissions by 2050
26/10/2021.description: The prime minister will now take the plan to the United Nations COP26 climate summit in Glasgow.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: 'Release us': Asylum seekers fearful as COVID-19 spreads in Melbourne hotel outbreak
26/10/2021.description: Iraqi asylum seeker Mustafa Salah has been in detention for eight years, and he's worried that he'll be the next to catch COVID-19 inside Melbourne's Park Hotel.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: Victoria posts another 1,510 COVID-19 cases as new pandemic laws are considered
26/10/2021.description: The new laws would give the premier the power to declare a pandemic on the advice of the chief health officer.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: From autocracy to military coup: A timeline of power in Sudan since 2019
26/10/2021.description: Sudan’s military has seized power, throwing the country's transition to democracy into chaos. Here's a look at the events of the past few years.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: As global warming forces millions to flee home, here are the stories of climate refugees
26/10/2021.description: Families in Bangladesh, Peru, Somalia, the United States and beyond are just some of the victims of climate change forced to flee their homes due to natural disasters.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: Tasmanian youth detention centre staff 'covered up abuse', inquiry hears
26/10/2021.description: An inquiry in Tasmania will examine allegations youth detention staff covered up child sexual abuse and failed to report accusations.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: South Australia to open borders to fully vaccinated travellers next month
26/10/2021.description: Premier Steven Marshall has outlined plans for the state to ease some coronavirus restrictions when 80 per cent of South Australian adults are expected to be fully vaccinated.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: Brittany Higgins slams top bureaucrats as security response video goes unwatched
26/10/2021.description: All but one senior bureaucrat in charge of federal parliament have not watched a training video created after the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins in Parliament Hous
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: Crown to keep its Melbourne casino licence despite 'illegal, dishonest' behaviour
26/10/2021.description: Gaming giant Crown will keep its licence to operate its Melbourne casino, following a royal commission.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: NSW records 282 new local COVID-19 cases and one death as eight more schools close
26/10/2021.description: There are 282 new local cases of COVID-19 in NSW and one death, while eight more schools have closed after a person in the school community was diagnosed with COVID-19.
26/10/2021.author: Bianca Hall

26/10/2021.headline: The world is on track for a 'catastrophic' 2.7C temperature rise this century, UN report warns
26/10/2021.description: Current commitments to cut greenhouse gas emissions put the planet on track for an average 2.7-degree Celsius temperature rise this century, a United Nations report said on Tuesday.
26/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

26/10/2021.headline: This is how Scott Morrison plans to reach net zero emissions, but not everyone's convinced
26/10/2021.description: After months of negotiations to secure a final deal ahead of the COP26 summit in Glasgow, the Coalition’s net zero plan has been released for political and scientific scrutiny.
26/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

26/10/2021.headline: Torres Strait Islanders file climate class action against Australian government
26/10/2021.description: The case has been brought on behalf of residents of the remote islands of Boigu and Saibai who allege the government has failed to protect them from climate change.
26/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

26/10/2021.headline: Sudan's army says it ousted the government 'to avoid civil war' as protests continue
26/10/2021.description: Sudan's deposed Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok has been returned to his own home the day after a military coup, a military source said late on Tuesday.
26/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

26/10/2021.headline: Australia to push for G20 to back stronger social media protections for children
26/10/2021.description: Australia wants global action on protecting children on social media platforms, with Scott Morrison expected to raise the issue at the G20 summit.
26/10/2021.author: Tony Moore

26/10/2021.headline: TGA approves Pfizer vaccine booster shot for all Australians aged 18 and over
26/10/2021.description: Aged care residents are expected to be the first people to receive a coronavirus vaccine booster shot after the medical regulator gave the green light.
26/10/2021.author: Daniella White

26/10/2021.headline: Fully vaccinated Australians will soon be able to leave the country without an exemption
26/10/2021.description: Fully vaccinated travellers will no longer need an exemption to leave the country, ahead of the international borders reopening.
26/10/2021.author: Daniella White

26/10/2021.headline: Victoria records 1,534 new cases of COVID-19 and 13 deaths
26/10/2021.description: Seventy-six per cent of the state's adult population has now been fully vaccinated.
26/10/2021.author: Daniella White

26/10/2021.headline: Why these Torres Strait Islanders are filing a class action against the Australian government
26/10/2021.description: The case has been brought on behalf of residents of the remote islands of Boigu and Saibai who allege the government has failed to protect them from climate change.
26/10/2021.author: Daniella White

27/10/2021.headline: Treasury admits it hasn't done any modelling on the cost of getting to net zero by 2050
27/10/2021.description: The Treasury secretary has told Senate estimates his department had not completed any modelling on the economic costs or benefits of reaching net zero by 2050.
27/10/2021.author: Daniella White

27/10/2021.headline: Scott Morrison rejects net zero plan critics as David Attenborough takes aim
27/10/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has defended international criticism of his government's plan to achieve carbon neutrality by 2050.
27/10/2021.author: Daniella White

27/10/2021.headline: Multicultural LGBTIQ+ people face violence in their own communities, survey shows
27/10/2021.description: A new study has found LGBTIQ+ people of diverse cultural and religious backgrounds often experience violence in the communities they’re meant to feel safe in.
27/10/2021.author: Daniella White

27/10/2021.headline: 'I'm gay and I'm a footballer': Adelaide United's Josh Cavallo comes out in emotional video
27/10/2021.description: The Young Socceroo is believed to be the only current, openly gay male professional footballer in the world after he revealed his sexuality in an emotional social media vide
27/10/2021.author: Daniella White

27/10/2021.headline: Government rejects criticism voter ID law would amount to 'Jim Crow' segregation
27/10/2021.description: Finance Minister Simon Birmingham has told a Senate estimates hearing the measure was being considered as a means of improving "public confidence" in the electoral system.
27/10/2021.author: Daniella White

27/10/2021.headline: Only vaccinated players allowed to compete in Australian Open, Daniel Andrews warns
27/10/2021.description: The Victorian premier says unvaccinated tennis players won't be granted an exemption to enter the state from overseas to take part in the Australian Open, even if they spend two weeks in hotel quarantine.
27/10/2021.author: Daniella White

27/10/2021.headline: Brazil senators back laying criminal charges against Jair Bolsonaro for COVID-19 response
27/10/2021.description: A Senate committee has backed a report recommending the president face criminal charges related to his downplaying of COVID-19 and flouting of expert advice.
27/10/2021.author: Daniella White

27/10/2021.headline: 'Connection and trust' key in Victoria's sprint to vaccinate refugee communities
27/10/2021.description: The rollout of the COVID-19 vaccine to asylum seeker and refugee communities is ramping up as Victoria prepares to reopen.
27/10/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

27/10/2021.headline: Julian Assange could serve jail time in Australia if convicted, US lawyer says
27/10/2021.description: A US lawyer has argued that if Julian Assange was convicted of anything, the WikiLeaks founder would be allowed to serve his sentence in Australia.
27/10/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

27/10/2021.headline: 'Utter disgrace': Labor senator likens voter ID bill to Jim Crow segregation laws
27/10/2021.description: Finance Minister Simon Birmingham has defended the proposed measure, telling a Senate estimates hearing it is being considered as a means of improving "public confidence" in the electoral system.
27/10/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

27/10/2021.headline: South African cricketer's refusal to take a knee renews debate about racism and sport
27/10/2021.description: The decision by former South Africa captain Quinton de Kock has opened up wider conversations about the role sport has to play in tackling racism.
27/10/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

27/10/2021.headline: Rapid COVID-19 tests to hit Australian supermarket shelves from next week
27/10/2021.description: Rapid antigen tests for COVID-19 will be available to buy in stores in all states and territories, except South Australia and Western Australia.
27/10/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

28/10/2021.headline: Government accused of importing 'Trump's America' with proposed voter ID laws
28/10/2021.description: The bill introduced to federal parliament is an attempt to crack down on voter fraud, which the Australian electoral commission has described as "vanishingly small".
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: This is what locals in a coal community think about the government's net zero plan
28/10/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison announced the government's 2050 net zero commitment on Tuesday. This is what locals in the industrial Illawarra region think of the plan.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: Anger for WA migrants who remain separated from their families overseas
28/10/2021.description: As Australia prepares to open up to the world and some parents of migrants will soon be welcomed in, those in Western Australia say they feel left out amid tight state border restrictions.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: More than one in two Disability Support Pension applications continue to be rejected
28/10/2021.description: Fifty-nine per cent of claims for the payment were denied over the course of 2020-21 - a figure consistent with rejection rates from the past few years.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: Victoria to tighten vaccine exemption rules as it reports record day of COVID-19 deaths
28/10/2021.description: Twenty-five more people in Victoria have died with COVID-19 - the highest daily increase in fatalities in the current outbreak.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: Gladys Berejiklian told boyfriend she'd 'throw money' at his electorate, secret call reveals
28/10/2021.description: The revelation the former NSW premier told Daryl Maguire she'd "throw money" at his Wagga Wagga electorate was publicly revealed on Thursday when a 2018 phone call was played at a corruption hearing.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: Australia's COVID-19 booster shot program to begin from 8 November
28/10/2021.description: While the general public rollout of boosters will begin next month, aged care residents and people with disability can receive their top-up shot from now.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: Barnaby Joyce adamant methane emissions cuts not included in net zero deal
28/10/2021.description: The deputy prime minister said signing up to the US and EU-backed pledge to cut methane emissions would spell disaster for Australia's agricultural sector.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: 'Indictment on Australia': More than 7,600 cancer patients living in poverty on JobSeeker
28/10/2021.description: There were 7,694 people with cancer in September living on the JobSeeker payment, which is below the poverty line.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: New Zealand reveals plans to tentatively reopen international borders from next month
28/10/2021.description: The country will halve its 14-day hotel quarantine requirement for overseas arrivals and allow quarantine-free travel from several Pacific island nations in November.
28/10/2021.author: Eryk Bagshaw

28/10/2021.headline: COVID-19 death rate twice as high among migrants than people born in Australia
28/10/2021.description: New data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics shows people born overseas had an age-standardised COVID-19 mortality rate of 4.2 deaths per 100,000 people, compared to one of 2.0 for those born locally.
28/10/2021.author: Katina Curtis

28/10/2021.headline: 'I am not a racist': Quinton de Kock apologises for refusing to take knee
28/10/2021.description: The South African cricketer has broken his silence about sitting out his side's second World Cup match, saying he is "deeply sorry for all the hurt, confusion and anger" he has caused.
28/10/2021.author: Katina Curtis

28/10/2021.headline: Nationwide protests after police officer acquitted of murder of Yamatji woman JC
28/10/2021.description: Rallies have been held in Perth, Geraldton, Sydney and Canberra after a Western Australian police officer who fatally shot Aboriginal woman JC in 2019 was found not guilty of murde
28/10/2021.author: Katina Curtis

28/10/2021.headline: Did the government mislead Australia when it said it got the children out of detention?
28/10/2021.description: Members of Brisbane’s Tamil community are calling for an investigation into claims made by Scott Morrison and senior government ministers that it got all the children out of immigration detention while the Murugappan family from Biloela was detained.
28/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

28/10/2021.headline: Emmanuel Macron says Australia 'broke relationship of trust' in call with Scott Morrison
28/10/2021.description: Scott Morrison has spoken with French President Emmanuel Macron for the first time since Australia backed out of a $90 billion submarine deal.
28/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: International travel from Australia is returning. Here's where you can go
29/10/2021.description: The Australian government has lifted its ‘do not travel’ advisory for the first time since the nation’s borders closed more than 18 months ago, with international flights returning from 1 November. Here's the current advice and some of the countries allowing quarantine-free entr
29/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: 'Not all about doom and gloom': Australia urged to adopt health focus in climate policy
29/10/2021.description: As world leaders prepare to meet in Glasgow for COP26, 52 medical and health groups have backed a call for health strategies to be included in Australia's climate policy.
29/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: Fears 'middle-class' electoral ID laws will keep multicultural Australians from voting
29/10/2021.description: FECCA says the proposed changes will create extra burdens for people from CALD and refugee backgrounds, especially women, who can find it difficult to prove their identit
29/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: 'We really miss them': WA children plead for border to reopen so families can reunite
29/10/2021.description: More than 100 families in Western Australia have contributed to a heartrending video of young kids wondering why the government is letting in sporting teams but not their grandparents.
29/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: Daryl Maguire was in Gladys Berejiklian's 'love circle', ICAC hears
29/10/2021.description: Former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian has told an inquiry that even in hindsight she would not have disclosed her relationship with former MP Daryl Maguir
29/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: Restrictions ease further in Victoria as it records 1,656 new COVID-19 cases
29/10/2021.description: Victoria has recorded 1,656 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths, as the state prepares for further restrictions to ease.
29/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: Facebook's 'metaverse' triggers data mining, privacy concerns from experts
29/10/2021.description: Mark Zuckerberg says privacy, safety and governance will be "built into" the metaverse, but academics are not convinced.
29/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: Why LGBTIQ+ advocates want Australia's 'gay blood ban' to end
29/10/2021.description: Just.Equal Australia is pushing for an end to Australia's "gay blood ban" in favour of a "more equitable approach" of individual risk assessments.
29/10/2021.author: Stuart Layt

29/10/2021.headline: Australia plans 'major' COVID-19 vaccine delivery, but the destination is a mystery
29/10/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison is expected to reveal at the G20 summit this weekend where a large delivery of Australia's excess COVID-19 vaccine doses will be donated.
29/10/2021.author: Tom Rabe

29/10/2021.headline: Only half of Australia's Indigenous population is fully vaccinated against COVID-19
29/10/2021.description: Just 50.4 per cent of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people aged 16 and older have received two doses of a COVID-19 vaccine, while 63 per cent have gotten their first jab.
29/10/2021.author: Tom Rabe

29/10/2021.headline: LGBTIQ+ groups welcome Victorian bill aiming to tighten anti-discrimination laws
29/10/2021.description: If the bill is passed, the state’s anti-discrimination laws will be narrowed to ensure religious organisations can’t fire or turn away people who identify as LGBTIQ+.
29/10/2021.author: Tom Rabe

29/10/2021.headline: Australia is putting more people in prison, despite a drop in crime rates
29/10/2021.description: A new Productivity Commission study has found the number of people in prison is rising across all states and territories despite falling criminal behaviour.
29/10/2021.author: Tom Rabe

29/10/2021.headline: Liesl builds robots for NASA but struggles to get financial backing in Australia
29/10/2021.description: Women in science and technology are vastly underpaid and still face a 22 per cent gender pay gap, according to a new report. For one female founder, raising venture capital in Australia remains a struggle.
29/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Scott Morrison says Australia won't be pressured on coal deadline ahead of COP26
30/10/2021.description: As representatives from almost 200 countries gather in Scotland from Sunday to confront the threat posed by climate change, Australia’s position on its future use of coal remains unclear.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Pope calls for 'urgent' response to climate crisis at COP26
30/10/2021.description: Pope Francis has lent his voice to a chorus of people around the world demanding action, not mere words, from leaders at the COP26 meeting this weekend.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: ‘Calls by the minute’: Female MP Fiona Patten facing an avalanche of abuse
30/10/2021.description: The leader of the Reason Party, Fiona Patten, says the abuse directed towards her during the pandemic has gotten so bad she has installed a security system in her home.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Ex-lawyer Georgia Steele to run as independent in Craig Kelly's seat during federal election
30/10/2021.description: Former corporate lawyer Georgia Steele is set to run as an independent at the next federal election in the Sydney seat of Hughes, which is currently held by controversial United Australia Party MP Craig Kelly.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Asylum seekers fear further spread of COVID-19 after cases emerge in another Melbourne detention centre
30/10/2021.description: Cases of coronavirus have been detected in a second immigration detention facility in Melbourne, as the Australian Border Force defends the COVID-19 policies in onshore immigration detention centres.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Nazi flag seized near Brisbane synagogue with politicians condemning 'sickening' act
30/10/2021.description: A Nazi flag seen displayed in a building neighbouring a Brisbane synagogue has prompted the Jewish community to again call for stronger laws banning the symbol.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Tonga faces prospect of lockdown after nation's first ever COVID-19 case
30/10/2021.description: The Pacific island nation had been among only a handful of countries to escape COVID-19 so far.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: New Zealand's first female MƒÅori governor-general vows to honour Indigenous culture and history
30/10/2021.description: New Zealand's incoming governor-general, Dame Cindy Kiro, says she will champion the MƒÅori language and understanding MƒÅori values in the role - adding that Australia too is grappling with its Indigenous culture and past.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Australian cricket great Alan Davidson dies aged 92
30/10/2021.description: Cricket great Alan Davidson, who played 44 Tests for Australia, has died at the age of 92.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Tributes for Australian showbiz icon Bert Newton
30/10/2021.description: Award-winning TV entertainer and presenter Bert Newton has died at the age of 83.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: 'Illusion' of climate action by big emitters clouds outlook for COP26 talks
30/10/2021.description: The COP26 conference in Glasgow has been billed as the last major chance to galvanise the collective effort needed to limit global warming to 1.5C, with scientists calling for emissions to be cut by nearly half by 2030 to achieve tha
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: 'Calls by the minute': Female MP Fiona Patten facing an avalanche of abuse
30/10/2021.description: The leader of the Reason Party, Fiona Patten, says the abuse directed towards her during the pandemic has gotten so bad she has installed a security system in her home.
