30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: New Zealand's first female MƒÅori governor-general vows to honour Indigenous culture
30/10/2021.description: New Zealand's incoming governor-general, Dame Cindy Kiro, says she will champion the MƒÅori language and understanding MƒÅori values in the role - adding that Australia too is grappling with its Indigenous culture and past.
30/10/2021.author: None found

30/10/2021.headline: Scott Morrison and Emmanuel Macron meet on the sidelines of G20 summit
30/10/2021.description: Mr Morrison told reporters in Rome that he approached President Macron at the summit and said "G’day."
30/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

30/10/2021.headline: Parents overseas? Here's how to get them an Australian visa and travel exemption
30/10/2021.description: Overseas-based parents of Australian citizens and permanent residents will now be allowed to enter Australia, bringing relief to many migrants. But they’ll need to be fully vaccinated and have their paperwork in order before their visit.
30/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: Hong Kong nationals in Australia to get new specialised pathways to permanent residency
31/10/2021.description: The Australian government is creating two new visa streams for Hong Kong nationals against the backdrop of concerns over China’s sweeping national security laws.
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: Victoria reaches 80 per cent vaccination target as daily case tally dips
31/10/2021.description: The daily COVID-19 tally of 1,036 is the state's lowest daily case figure since 29 September.
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: 'The memories of a generation': State funeral announced for Bert Newton as tributes flow
31/10/2021.description: Australian entertainment legend and four-time Gold Logie award winner Bert Newton is being honoured with tributes from politicians, entertainers, friends and colleagues.
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: Barnaby Joyce reveals some details of Nationals support for climate deal
31/10/2021.description: Acting Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce has provided some of the detail of the agreement with the Nationals to accept a net zero emissions 2050 target.
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: COVID-19 booster shots for NSW adults available from Monday
31/10/2021.description: From Monday, NSW adults who got their second COVID-19 vaccine more than six months ago will be able to get a booster shot from pharmacies, GP clinics and mass vaccination hubs
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: New Zealand sets 50 per cent emission target for 2030 ahead of COP26
31/10/2021.description: New Zealand has added pressure on its neighbour for a more ambitious climate change agenda, announcing a 50 per cent emissions reduction target by 2030.
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: Victorian Liberal MP Tim Smith resigns after drink driving car crash incident
31/10/2021.description: Victorian Liberal MP Tim Smith has been busted drink-driving after crashing his car, resigning from his post as shadow attorney-general.
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: Fears of post-pandemic skin cancer crisis in Australia
31/10/2021.description: Experts fear COVID lockdowns may have triggered a 12-year low in the number of patients seeking treatment at Australia's world leading melanoma institute.
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: 'Black and proud': Footballer Wilfried Zaha issues challenge to social media companies on racist abuse
31/10/2021.description: Ivory Coast international Wilfried Zaha has called on social media companies to do more to stamp out racist abuse after being on the receiving end of it.
31/10/2021.author: Alice Clarke

31/10/2021.headline: 'I don’t think, I know': Emmanuel Macron accuses Scott Morrison of lying about submarine contract
31/10/2021.description: French president Emmanuel Macron has accused Scott Morrison of lying about the abandoned $90 million submarine contract.
31/10/2021.author: Chris Roots

31/10/2021.headline: 'Our last, best hope': Crucial COP26 climate summit opens with urgent call to action
31/10/2021.description: The UN Climate Change Conference in Glasgow has begun, with about 25,000 people in total expected to attend the summit.
31/10/2021.author: Chris Roots

31/10/2021.headline: 'An explosion of emotions': Australians count down to borders reopening after 20 months
31/10/2021.description: The bustle is set to return to some of Australia's international airport terminals from Monday with fully vaccinated Australians now permitted to travel overseas. Meanwhile citizens, residents and their families flying into Sydney or Melbourne will no longer need to quarantine
31/10/2021.author: Chris Roots

31/10/2021.headline: G20 nations agree on 1.5 degree climate change target, sources say
31/10/2021.description: The Group of 20 major economies emit nearly 80 percent of carbon emissions, and a promise of action on their part would provide a much-needed boost to the make-or-break COP26 summit.
31/10/2021.author: Chris Roots

31/10/2021.headline: Barnaby Joyce details some conditions attached to Nationals climate deal
31/10/2021.description: Acting Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce has provided some of the detail of the agreement with the Nationals to accept a net zero emissions 2050 target.
31/10/2021.author: Chris Roots

31/10/2021.headline: COVID-19 booster shots rolled out for NSW adults
31/10/2021.description: NSW adults who got their second COVID-19 vaccine more than six months ago can get a booster shot from pharmacies, GP clinics and mass vaccination hubs
31/10/2021.author: Chris Roots

31/10/2021.headline: International travellers touch down at Sydney airport as quarantine scrapped
31/10/2021.description: Hundreds of international travellers arriving at Sydney airport are having emotional reunions with family and friends as the border to NSW reopens which the premier says is "a very important milestone".
31/10/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

31/10/2021.headline: Victoria records 1,471 local COVID-19 cases and four deaths
31/10/2021.description: Fully vaccinated international arrivals touching down in Victoria will no longer be required to undergo 14 days in hotel or home quarantine.
31/10/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

31/10/2021.headline: G20 offers little new on climate, leaving unfinished business for COP26
31/10/2021.description: The G20 major economies committed on Sunday to the key goal of limiting global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius, but disappointed leaders warned more was needed to make a success of UN climate talks beginning in Glasgo
31/10/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

01/11/2021.headline: 'It will forever torture me': Mother of refugee who set himself on fire says his death was preventable
01/11/2021.description: The Queensland coroner said doctors on Nauru had made "heroic efforts" to save Omid Masoumali, but had been hampered by a lack of training and a lack of equipment.
01/11/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

01/11/2021.headline: Disability pension applicants must be treated with dignity, rights commissioner says
01/11/2021.description: The Senate inquiry on Monday was also told people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds with disability find it particularly difficult to prove their condition and navigate the system.
01/11/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

01/11/2021.headline: Gladys Berejiklian says she 'trusted' Daryl Maguire and had no reason to report him
01/11/2021.description: Former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian says she trusted former MP Daryl Maguire and did not think she had anything to report to the state's corruption watchdog.
01/11/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

01/11/2021.headline: Australia's medical regulator recognises two more international COVID-19 vaccines
01/11/2021.description: More overseas travellers will be able to visit Australia after the TGA recognised a Chinese and an Indian-made COVID-19 vaccine.
01/11/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

01/11/2021.headline: Queensland court weighs SIEV-X smuggler case
01/11/2021.description: A man accused of involvement in a smuggling operation resulting in hundreds of people drowning en route to Australia is facing a committal hearing in Brisbane.
01/11/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

01/11/2021.headline: Queensland quarantine rules could ease sooner than expected for international travellers
01/11/2021.description: Queensland's health minister says international travellers are only required to quarantine in line with federal guidelines, but those rules could change.
01/11/2021.author: Georgina Mitchell

01/11/2021.headline: 'I'm not going to cop sledging of Australia': Scott Morrison hits back at Emmanuel Macron over submarine row
01/11/2021.description: Australia has rebuffed claims Scott Morrison lied to French President Emmanuel Macron about the torpedoing of a $90 billion submarine contract.
01/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

01/11/2021.headline: Scientists, not politicians, will chart the path to net zero, Scott Morrison tells COP26
01/11/2021.description: Australian scientists and researchers are a "good bet" and will help carve a path to a decarbonised economy, Scott Morrison tells COP26.
01/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

01/11/2021.headline: As Australia reopens, COVID-19 cases will rise. How will we cope?
01/11/2021.description: With Australia's cities all now out of lockdown, we asked two health experts what we can expect as the country shifts away from a COVID-zero approach.
01/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

01/11/2021.headline: Australians stranded overseas rejoice at TGA's new COVID-19 vaccine approvals
01/11/2021.description: As two more COVID-19 vaccines are recognised by the TGA, Australians stranded overseas are booking their tickets to come back home.
01/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

01/11/2021.headline: Proposed voter ID laws a 'solution looking for a problem', Senator Rex Patrick says
01/11/2021.description: The South Australian senator has joined political opponents and human rights advocates in criticising the proposed changes, saying the government should be dealing with "political integrity" over "voter integrity".
01/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

01/11/2021.headline: 'The Earth is speaking': Young Amazonian activist's powerful climate warning at COP26
01/11/2021.description: Two young women - Txai Surui from the Brazilian Amazon and Samoan Brianna Fruean - have delivered striking speeches during the opening of the United Nations' COP26 climate summit.
01/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: Concern as Australia's visa tribunal admits it can't handle backlog of migration, refugee cases
02/11/2021.description: The Administrative Appeals Tribunal’s backlog of asylum seeker cases has now surpassed 32,000, with some applicants waiting years for their cases to be heard.
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: Thousands sign petition against Australia’s ‘discriminatory’ border policies for temporary visa holders
02/11/2021.description: Temporary visa holders have questioned why they've been kept in the dark while tourists from Singapore and New Zealand have been told when they can enter Australia.
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: Beach handball players celebrate end of 'archaic' rule mandating bikini bottoms
02/11/2021.description: The new uniform rules replace previous requirements for female beach handball players to wear bikini bottoms “with a close fit and cut on an upward angle toward the top of the leg".
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: Nearly 5,000 NSW teachers risk being sidelined under looming COVID vaccine mandate
02/11/2021.description: Less than one week before a vaccine mandate kicks in, almost 5,000 NSW teachers haven't told authorities if they're fully vaccinated.
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: High Court examines Zachary Rolfe's 'good faith' ahead of Kumanjayi Walker murder trial
02/11/2021.description: Australia's highest court on Tuesday began considering a challenge to a key pillar of NT police Constable Zachary Rolfe's defence for the alleged murder of Kumanjayi Walker.
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: Global leaders make $25 billion commitment to end deforestation
02/11/2021.description: World leaders have made a multibillion-dollar pledge to end deforestation by 2030 in a bid to "end humanity's long history as nature's conqueror".
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: 'Freedoms' fast-tracked for fully vaccinated in NSW, but unvaccinated to wait
02/11/2021.description: Christmas is coming early for those who are double vaccinated in NSW with some promised "freedoms" being fast-tracked to start on Monday.
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: Israel’s energy minister shut out of COP26 as venue wasn’t wheelchair accessible
02/11/2021.description: Israeli minister Karine Elharrar was forced to go back to her hotel after waiting for two hours to get into the COP26 summit venue in Glasgow.
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: Malcolm Turnbull says Scott Morrison should apologise to France for 'shameful' behaviour
02/11/2021.description: Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull has criticised Scott Morrison for his behaviour with the French government over the scrapped submarine deal, saying he has a reputation for being untrustworthy.
02/11/2021.author: Nathanael Cooper

02/11/2021.headline: Nearly 90 countries join pact to slash methane emission levels by at least 30 per cent this decade
02/11/2021.description: Nearly 90 countries have joined a US and EU-led effort to slash emissions of the potent greenhouse gas methane 30 per cent by 2030, but Australia, China, India and Russia did not sign the pledge.
02/11/2021.author: Sumeyya Ilanbey

02/11/2021.headline: The three climate claims these experts want Scott Morrison to stop making
02/11/2021.description: Rising bills, jobs losses, and "meeting and beating" targets are three of the federal government's oft-repeated reasons why it won't pursue stronger climate action. But some experts and campaigners in the field say the statements don't tell the whole story.
02/11/2021.author: Sumeyya Ilanbey

02/11/2021.headline: At least 25 people killed in attack on Afghanistan's biggest military hospital
02/11/2021.description: At least 25  people were killed and 50 more wounded in an attack on a military hospital in Kabul on Tuesday, the latest atrocity to rock Afghanistan since the Taliban seized power.
02/11/2021.author: Sumeyya Ilanbey

02/11/2021.headline: Facebook to shut down facial recognition system and delete faceprints of one billion users
02/11/2021.description: Facebook is shutting down its facial recognition system and deleting a billion faceprints, in response to serious concerns over privacy at the scandal-hit social media network.
02/11/2021.author: Sumeyya Ilanbey

02/11/2021.headline: 14 million women could lose access to contraception due to climate change in next decade
02/11/2021.description: There are fears more than 14 million women could lose access to contraception as climate change worsens living conditions around the world.
02/11/2021.author: Sumeyya Ilanbey

02/11/2021.headline: Alleged people smugglers 'returned cash' after SIEV-X drownings, court hears
02/11/2021.description: A man accused of involvement in the logistics of a smuggling operation resulting in hundreds of people drowning en route to Australia is facing a committal hearing in Brisbane.
02/11/2021.author: Sumeyya Ilanbey

02/11/2021.headline: Nearly 90 countries join pact to slash methane emission levels by at least 30 per cent
02/11/2021.description: Nearly 90 countries have joined a US and EU-led effort to slash emissions of the potent greenhouse gas methane 30 per cent by 2030, but Australia, China, India and Russia did not sign the pledge.
02/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: 'It was incredible': The moment WA police found missing girl Cleo Smith
03/11/2021.description: WA police have released a video showing the moment four-year-old Cleo Smith was rescued.
03/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: Australia criticised over prominence of fossil fuel company display at COP26 stall
03/11/2021.description: The presence of a fossil fuel giant’s logo next to Australia’s name at the crucial climate summit hasn't gone unnoticed.
03/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: French ambassador savages Australia for ‘stab in the back’ over scuttled submarine deal
03/11/2021.description: Jean-Pierre Thebault accused Australia of deliberately deceiving France over the dumping of a $90 billion submarine deal, and described the government's actions as "a stab in the back&quot
03/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: Calls for mandatory COVID-19 testing of international arrivals in Australia
03/11/2021.description: Concerns have been raised by epidemiologist Mary-Louise McLaws who says "anything can happen" between a traveller's first test and when they touch down in Australia.
03/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: 'Confidence shattered': France fumes over submarine text message leak
03/11/2021.description: The leaking of private text messages between Prime Minister Scott Morrison and the French leader has been described by French officials as "crude" and "inelegant".
03/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: British woman wins High Court discrimination battle over Australia's 'backpacker tax'
03/11/2021.description: The ruling could have consequences for thousands of other backpackers forced to comply with the scheme.
03/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: Protesters rally against Poland's controversial abortion law after woman's death
03/11/2021.description: Vigils have been held for a woman who reproductive rights activists say is the first to have died after restrictions on abortions in Poland were tightened.
03/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: Victoria's daily COVID-19 cases drop below 1,000 for second consecutive day
03/11/2021.description: Victoria has recorded 941 new COVID-19 cases and eight deaths, as the state's daily case numbers trend downwards.
03/11/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

03/11/2021.headline: Why Australia's green energy movement needs to include Aboriginal communities
03/11/2021.description: Norman Frank is the first Aboriginal person in the Northern Territory to try to connect rooftop solar to a prepaid meter - but he still can't access the grid. As COP26 puts climate action on the world stage, those behind the initiative are determined to bring green energy to the region.
03/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

03/11/2021.headline: All sides in Ethiopian war committed crimes against civilians, UN report finds
03/11/2021.description: Some of the alleged acts "may amount to war crimes and crimes against humanity", the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights said.
03/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

03/11/2021.headline: Pioneering COVID-19 sequencer takes out Prime Minister's Prize for Science
03/11/2021.description: Australian virologist Edward Holmes, the first person to share the genome sequence for COVID-19, has taken out this year's Prime Minister's Prize for Science.
03/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

03/11/2021.headline: US approves Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for children aged between five and 11
03/11/2021.description: The vaccine was endorsed by the CDC, clearing the way for the vaccination of up to 28 million childre
03/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

03/11/2021.headline: The Indigenous climate activists making their voices heard at COP26
03/11/2021.description: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander environmental campaigners are calling for greater involvement in the race to net zero
03/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

03/11/2021.headline: Dominic Perrottet to establish inquiry into LGBTIQ+ hate crimes in NSW
03/11/2021.description: NSW will set up a judicial inquiry to investigate unsolved LGBTIQ+ hate crimes committed in Sydney between 1970 and 2010.
03/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: 'We're still in the dark ages': Foreign investment in Australian fossil fuel scrutinised
04/11/2021.description: A new report has revealed overseas public financial institutions have poured $36.7 billion into Australian fossil fuel projects over the past decade.
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: ‘Pathway to justice’: LGBTIQ+ hate crimes inquiry welcomed by survivors and advocates
04/11/2021.description: From the 1970s to 2010s, hundreds of LGBTIQ+ people were documented as having "disappeared" or were known to be killed.
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: 'It’s like our New Year': Australia celebrates an extra special Diwali
04/11/2021.description: This year's Diwali, the festival of lights, symbolically marks the end of a “dark and challenging” two-year period for many communities in Australia.
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: Interactive: How Australia compares to the rest of the world on CO2 emissions
04/11/2021.description: With Australia's climate policies in the international spotlight, the interactive graphic below shows how the country's carbon dioxide output compares with others, and sees it rank as the highest emitter among OECD member countries.
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: Elite Melbourne school a 'bubble to rehearse oppression without consequence'
04/11/2021.description: A former student of one of Melbourne's most prestigious private schools has burnt his blazer to protest against what he says is its toxic culture.
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: 'We got her': Emotional audio of Cleo Smith's rescue released, as charges expected
04/11/2021.description: In the audio recording, you can hear the voices of several police officers remarking "We got her" and telling the four-year-old "You're alright, bubby.&quo
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: Australia criticised for failing to join countries pledging to phase out coal in COP26 agreement
04/11/2021.description: The pledge will force many countries around the world to shift their industries to more sustainable practices, away from coal which remains the most polluting fossil fuel in the world.
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: All farm workers entitled to minimum wage, Fair Work Commission rules
04/11/2021.description: Unions have welcomed the decision to guarantee farm workers a minimum wage, with many of them being temporary migrant workers who are “vulnerable to exploitation”.
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: Country Road Group denies laying fresh manure to stop union protest
04/11/2021.description: Country Road Group has denied the union's claims, saying the manure was laid out due to gardening maintenance work.
04/11/2021.author: Dominic Powell

04/11/2021.headline: The 'absolutely horrifying' story behind fiery Melbourne private school protest
04/11/2021.description: James Robinson has revealed more details of his harrowing experience at St Kevin's College, and explains why he thinks it might be hard to fix the school's "toxic" culture.
04/11/2021.author: None found

04/11/2021.headline: Victoria, NSW open border to 'free travel' allowing families to reunite
04/11/2021.description: The change allows all travellers and workers to enter Victoria without any testing or quarantine requirements, including unvaccinated people, if they apply for a permit.
04/11/2021.author: None found

04/11/2021.headline: NT records first local COVID-19 case, triggering 72-hour lockdown
04/11/2021.description: The Northern Territory regions of Katherine and Greater Darwin are now in lockdown, after the territory recorded its first ever locally acquired case of COVID-19.
04/11/2021.author: None found

04/11/2021.headline: WA man charged with abducting Cleo Smith
04/11/2021.description: Police have charged a man over the alleged abduction of four-year-old Cleo Smith, who went missing from her family's campsite in Western Australia last month.
04/11/2021.author: None found

04/11/2021.headline: Australia criticised for not joining nations pledging to quit coal at COP26
04/11/2021.description: The pledge will force many countries around the world to shift their industries to more sustainable practices, away from coal which remains the most polluting fossil fuel in the world.
04/11/2021.author: None found

04/11/2021.headline: Vaccines and hospitals on leaders' agenda at national cabinet
04/11/2021.description: National cabinet will meet on Friday for the first time in more than a month, after lockdowns were ended across the country.
04/11/2021.author: None found

04/11/2021.headline: West Papuan independence leaders sell their climate vision at COP26
04/11/2021.description: The 'government-in-waiting' hopes to create the world’s first 'green state' if independence is achieved.
04/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: 'A very harsh world': Western Australian families' heartache as borders stay closed
05/11/2021.description: Perth residents with families interstate and overseas are reeling after the announcement that the state's borders could stay closed until as late as February 202
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: Accused Cleo Smith abductor flown to Perth in handcuffs
05/11/2021.description: Terence Darrell Kelly was flown out of Carnarvon on a charter plane to Perth, where he will stand trial for child stealin
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: Drop in international students could have 'long-term impact' on Australia
05/11/2021.description: There are fears international students will continue to look to study elsewhere unless Australia reopens its borders soon.
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: WA to remain closed for holiday season, reopen border at 90 per cent vaccination
05/11/2021.description: Western Australians will be isolated from the rest of the country over the summer holiday period, with the state targeting a late-January or early-February reopenin
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: Zachary Rolfe's murder trial over death of Kumanjayi Walker rescheduled for February
05/11/2021.description: The Northern Territory policeman's murder trial over the death of the Indigenous teenager has been rescheduled for February 2022.
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: Man to stand trial over alleged rape of Brittany Higgins
05/11/2021.description: Prosecutors and the lawyer for the man facing allegations of raping Brittany Higgins have agreed to an expedited path to an ACT Supreme Court trial.
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: High-risk gene common in South Asians doubles the risk of COVID-19 death, study finds
05/11/2021.description: Scientists say the gene is more common among people of South Asian ancestry, which could explain the high number of COVID deaths in some UK communities and also the Indian subcontinent.
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: Foreign Minister Marise Payne begins trip to Southeast Asian nations amid AUKUS fallout
05/11/2021.description: Foreign Minister Marise Payne will use a diplomatic mission to reassure Southeast Asian nations over Australia's decision to acquire nuclear-powered submarines.
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: Despite dropping last year, global emissions are almost back to pre-pandemic levels
05/11/2021.description: ANALYSIS: The effects of COVID-19 lockdowns led to a huge drop in carbon dioxide emissions last year. But, as these experts explain, emissions are rising rapidly again, and the long-term trends are troubling.
05/11/2021.author: Paul Connolly

05/11/2021.headline: COP26 has been a 'failure' and 'greenwashing festival', Greta Thunberg tells mass protest
05/11/2021.description: The Swedish activist said pledges from some nations made during the conference amounted to little more than "a two-week-long celebration of business as usual and blah, blah, blah".
05/11/2021.author: None found

05/11/2021.headline: Dylan Alcott made wheelchair tennis history. Now he's helping other athletes with disability
05/11/2021.description: After a spectacular finish to his Paralympic career, with four gold medals in wheelchair tennis and basketball, Dylan Alcott has turned his attention to new ventures off the court. His goal? To help women with disability transition from high-performance sport to leadership roles.
05/11/2021.author: None found

05/11/2021.headline: China is making supporters of Taiwanese independence criminally liable for life
05/11/2021.description: People deemed by China to be pro-Taiwan independence will not be allowed to enter the mainland, Hong Kong or Macau, among other sanctions.
05/11/2021.author: None found

05/11/2021.headline: Why New Zealand's new Ministry for Disabled People is a watershed moment
05/11/2021.description: ANALYSIS: New Zealand's new Ministry for Disabled People comes at a crucial time as the country emerges from COVID-19 lockdown, which has greatly affected those with a disability.
05/11/2021.author: None found

05/11/2021.headline: Leading LGBTIQ+ rights group in China shuts down amid rising tensions
05/11/2021.description: The LGBT Rights Advocacy China group has announced it is ceasing all activities and shutting down its social media accounts, without giving a reaso
05/11/2021.author: None found

05/11/2021.headline: UN calls for Ethiopia ceasefire as rebel groups forge alliance to bring down government
05/11/2021.description: The United Nations Security Council is calling for an immediate ceasefire in Ethiopia as rebel groups form an alliance to push for a political transition in the country.
05/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Maley

05/11/2021.headline: Victoria reports seven COVID-19 deaths and 1,268 cases as travel across NSW resumes
05/11/2021.description: It comes as New South Wales reports 270 new locally acquired COVID-19 infections and three deaths.
05/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Maley

05/11/2021.headline: Pfizer COVID-19 pill '89 per cent effective against hospitalisation and deaths'
05/11/2021.description: Pfizer says a trial of its paxlovid drug turned up an 89 per cent reduction in risk of hospitalisation or death among adult patients with COVID-19 at high risk of progressing to severe illness.
05/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Maley

05/11/2021.headline: A Chinese journalist jailed over her COVID-19 reporting is now 'close to death'
05/11/2021.description: Zhang Zhan travelled to Wuhan in February 2020 to report on the chaos at the pandemic's epicentre, questioning authorities' handling of the outbreak.
05/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Maley

06/11/2021.headline: 'We are fighting': Thousands rally across Australia on global day of climate action
06/11/2021.description: Protesters are calling for a moratorium on new coal, oil and gas projects, and a transition to 100 per cent renewable energy by the end of the decade.
06/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Maley

06/11/2021.headline: Australia has now hit its 80 per cent double vaccination target
06/11/2021.description: The Prime Minister announced the news on Saturday morning, calling it "another magnificent milestone".
06/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Maley

06/11/2021.headline: Glasgow braces for climate protests on global day of action
06/11/2021.description: From Glasgow to Nairobi and Sydney, more than 200 events are planned worldwide to demand immediate action for communities already affected by climate change.
06/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Maley

06/11/2021.headline: Northern Territory records one new local COVID-19 case, bringing outbreak to three
06/11/2021.description: The new case is a 21-year old woman who arrived in Darwin from Cairns late last month, Chief Minister Michael Gunner said on Saturday.
06/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Maley

06/11/2021.headline: Australia reaches 'magnificent' COVID-19 vaccination milestone, but some states lag behind
06/11/2021.description: Australia's COVID-19 vaccine program has finally reached a crucial milestone but in some states immunisation rates remain worryingly low, particularly among the youn
06/11/2021.author: Melissa Cunningham

06/11/2021.headline: New Zealand's daily COVID-19 cases top 200 for first time amid rush to boost vaccination rates
06/11/2021.description: New Zealand has reported 206 local COVID-19 cases, taking its daily total past 200 for the first time during the pandemi
06/11/2021.author: Melissa Cunningham

06/11/2021.headline: Cattle farmers get blamed for climate change, but this one hopes to be part of the solution
06/11/2021.description: While Australia is not backing a US and EU-led pledge to cut methane emissions by 2030, the livestock industry is embracing innovative solutions to reach carbon neutrality.
06/11/2021.author: None found

06/11/2021.headline: 'More than 100,000' climate protesters march in Glasgow as part of global day of action
06/11/2021.description: Protesters took to the streets in cities across the world on Saturday to demand more radical action to address the climate crisis.
06/11/2021.author: None found

06/11/2021.headline: Images of Tuvalu minister giving COP26 statement in the ocean go viral on social media
06/11/2021.description: Foreign Minister Simon Kofe addressed cameras while knee-deep in the ocean to highlight the sea level rises affecting his nation, drawing plenty of attention and admiration on social media.
06/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: Australia has reached its 80 per cent vaccination milestone but these communities are still at risk
07/11/2021.description: As Australia celebrates a significant COVID-19 vaccine rollout milestone, concern remains over vaccination rates in at-risk communities.
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: COVID-19 restrictions in Darwin and Katherine extended for 24 hours
07/11/2021.description: Residents of Darwin and Katherine will remain under coronavirus restrictions for another 24 hours, as it's revealed the source of the NT's outbreak was a woman who lied on her border declaration form.
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: Argentina Pride march hails progress, calls for more LGBTIQ+ rights laws
07/11/2021.description: "The LGBTI+ flag flies all over the country with great reasons to celebrate. A collective that has our commitment to continue working for a more just, free and equal society," Argentine President Alberto Fernandez said.
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: 'A good day to be a Kiwi': New Zealand legalises assisted dying
07/11/2021.description: Terminally ill patients in New Zealand with less than six months to live can now request assisted dying after new laws came into effect.
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: United States court freezes Joe Biden's COVID-19 vaccine mandate for companies
07/11/2021.description: A US court cited "grave statutory and constitutional" issues with the Biden administration's vaccine rules for companies with at least 100 workers
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: Iraq's PM unharmed following 'failed assassination attempt' with drone attack
07/11/2021.description: It came as several hundred supporters of pro-Iranian groups protested near the entrance of the Green Zone against the results of general elections on 10 October.
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: Victoria reports nine COVID-19 deaths and 1,173 cases a day after pandemic law protests
07/11/2021.description: Meanwhile, New South Wales has reported 244 new local COVID-19 cases and one further death, and the ACT 13 new infections.
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: Women's rights activist among four people found dead in northern Afghanistan
07/11/2021.description: Frozan Safi, an activist and economics lecturer, has been identified as one of the four bodies found at a house in Mazar-i-Sharif.
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: 'New and expectant parents are not alone': Push to tackle perinatal mental health stigmas
07/11/2021.description: Many parents are struggling at the moment, and health experts say Indigenous, multicultural and LGBTIQ+ families are especially at ris
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: Australia reaches vaccination milestone, but these communities are still at risk
07/11/2021.description: As Australia celebrates a significant COVID-19 vaccine rollout milestone, concern remains over vaccination rates in at-risk communities.
07/11/2021.author: None found

07/11/2021.headline: Sudan security forces fire tear gas against anti-coup protests
07/11/2021.description: Sudanese pro-democracy groups have launched two days of civil disobedience and strikes to protest last month's military coup.
07/11/2021.author: None found

08/11/2021.headline: Orphans and widows among those still waiting on Australian visas to escape Afghanistan
08/11/2021.description: There are continued fears for Afghans who did not make it out of Kabul on military evacuation flights, with many facing the expiration of temporary visas within weeks.
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: Former detainees of Darwin youth detention centre share harrowing experiences in court
08/11/2021.description: Darwin’s Supreme Court heard the traumatic experiences of men who survived mistreatment at the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre as part of a class action lawsuit against the NT government.
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: WA nurse to face court for allegedly pretending to give teenager COVID-19 vaccine
08/11/2021.description: Western Australian police allege the 51-year-old registered nurse inserted the needle into the teenager's arm but did not administer the vaccine.
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: States team-up to reach net zero in 'absence of leadership' from federal government
08/11/2021.description: NSW, South Australia and the ACT have launched a net zero emissions policy forum to tackle climate hurdles, with WA saying it has also signed up "in the absence of real leadership from the federal government".
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: A man in his 30s with no significant underlying health conditions has died of COVID-19 in Sydney
08/11/2021.description: NSW recorded 187 new locally-acquired cases detected from 52,939 tests in the 24 hours to 8pm on Sunday.
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: Four Seasons Landscaping back in the spotlight one year on from Donald Trump's loss
08/11/2021.description: One year has passed since the infamous press conference was held by Donald Trump's lawyer outside Four Season's Total Landscapin
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: ‘A great disappointment’: UK climate advisor slams Australia’s emissions targets
08/11/2021.description: The UK climate advisor accused Australia’s prime minister of not understanding the urgency of the climate crisis and says "we can't go on using coal".
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: How Australia can fast-track emissions reductions
08/11/2021.description: ANALYSIS: Australia doesn't need to wait for future technologies to slash carbon emissions — we just need a real plan to achieve reduction targets.
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: Free rapid antigen tests to get COVID-exposed Victorian students back to school
08/11/2021.description: Unvaccinated Victorian students identified as close contacts of positive COVID-19 cases can return to school after seven days under a free testing program.
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: The netball clubs changing their uniforms to be more gender-inclusive and culturally diverse
08/11/2021.description: Netball NSW has upheaved its traditional uniform policy of dresses and skirts in a bid to make the sport more gender-inclusive and culturally diverse.
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Selinger-Morris

08/11/2021.headline: Australian school students have had a tough year, none more so than this Afghan refugee
08/11/2021.description: As the HSC begins on Tuesday, imagine preparing for your exams away from the classroom with English as your second or third language. That has been the reality for many refugee children.
08/11/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/11/2021.headline: Australian bushfire survivors and firefighters plead for urgent climate action at COP26
08/11/2021.description: Australians have called on world leaders to take stronger action in reducing emissions by 2030, with "vague" net-zero by 2050 targets criticised as only bringing "more despair."
08/11/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/11/2021.headline: Poland prevents mass migrant crossing from Belarus and warns of armed escalation
08/11/2021.description: The EU has accused Belarus strongman Alexander Lukashenko of facilitating the wave of migrants, mainly from the Middle East, in retaliation for sanctions.
08/11/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/11/2021.headline: Israel-made spyware used to hack phones of Palestinian rights workers, report says
08/11/2021.description: The revelations around the Pegasus spyware come after Israel's defence ministry last month designated six prominent Palestinian rights groups as "terrorist" organisations.
08/11/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/11/2021.headline: Barack Obama tells COP26 to help poorer nations, slams China and Russia for not attending
08/11/2021.description: The former US president says "we are nowhere near where we need to be".
08/11/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/11/2021.headline: Nicaragua's Daniel Ortega wins 'pantomime election' with 75 per cent of votes
08/11/2021.description: The presidential election had been widely criticised in advance by Western powers as Mr Ortega vigorously set about jailing rivals and criminalising dissent.
08/11/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/11/2021.headline: States team up to reach net zero in 'absence of leadership' from federal government
08/11/2021.description: NSW, South Australia and the ACT have launched a net zero emissions policy forum to tackle climate hurdles, with WA saying it has also signed up "in the absence of real leadership from the federal government".
08/11/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/11/2021.headline: Taken by his grandparents: Why this same-sex Chinese couple aren't allowed to raise their son
08/11/2021.description: In a country where same-sex marriage and surrogacy is banned, this Chinese couple fought to conceive their child. But raising him has presented new obstacles.
08/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: Australia unveiled its new EV policy. Critics say we are still '10 years behind'
09/11/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison declared Labor’s electric vehicle policy would “end the weekend” at the last election in 2019, but his new plan is now facing its own criticism.
09/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: Perth hospital staff 'exhausted and demoralised' before death of Aishwarya Aswath
09/11/2021.description: A report into the death of seven-year-old Aishwarya Aswath has highlighted "demoralising" staffing issues at Perth Children's Hospital.
09/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: NSW's first Indigenous bilingual school is set to open next year
09/11/2021.description: The Gumbaynggirr Giingana Freedom School, based in Coffs Harbour, will teach kindergarten to Year 2 classes in both Gumbaynggirr language and English.
09/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: Queensland to scrap COVID-19 rules for vaccinated once reaching 80 per cent coverage
09/11/2021.description: It comes as Victoria records 1,069 new COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths, and New South Wales 222 cases and four deaths.
09/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: Dylan Alcott to retire from tennis after 2022 Australian Open
09/11/2021.description: Quad tennis star Dylan Alcott has announced he will retire from the game after January's Australian Open.
09/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: Thousands of New Zealanders descend on parliament in protest against COVID-19 measures
09/11/2021.description: All but two entrances to the parliament building were closed off as mostly unmasked protesters marched through central Wellington and congregated outside.
09/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: Australia is rolling out COVID-19 booster shots. Here's when to book yours
09/11/2021.description: People in Australia aged 18 and over can now access a third vaccination - known as a booster shot - to improve their protection against COVID-19. Here's how the rollout will work.
09/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: People unvaccinated 'by choice' in Singapore will no longer get free COVID-19 treatment
09/11/2021.description: The Singaporean government has said unvaccinated people "disproportionately contribute" to the strain on the country's healthcare resources.
09/11/2021.author: Sophie Aubrey

09/11/2021.headline: Australia's climate policies have been ranked last out of 64 countries in a new index
09/11/2021.description: Australia's "technology investment roadmap" has been deemed insufficient to decarbonise the economy, cut fossil fuel use and promote renewables.
09/11/2021.author: None found

09/11/2021.headline: Government looks to invest $500 million in more carbon capture and storage technology
09/11/2021.description: Half a billion dollars in clean energy funding would be used to back carbon capture and storage under a renewed Morrison government proposal.
09/11/2021.author: None found

09/11/2021.headline: Belarus accused of using 'gangster-style' tactics to lure migrants into the EU
09/11/2021.description: Poland and other European states accuse Belarus of encouraging the migrants to cross into the EU in revenge for sanctions over human rights abuses.
09/11/2021.author: None found

09/11/2021.headline: Watch the viral Tuvalu COP26 climate plea recorded from the ocean
09/11/2021.description: Behind-the-scenes images of the pre-recorded address went viral on social media last week.
09/11/2021.author: None found

09/11/2021.headline: The new digital playbook helping organisations better reach multicultural youth
09/11/2021.description: Taking learnings from the COVID-19 pandemic, researchers have developed an online guide to help community organisations work better with culturally and linguistically diverse young people.
09/11/2021.author: None found

09/11/2021.headline: 'Hitting where it hurts': Scammers steal millions from Australia's vulnerable communities
09/11/2021.description: Community groups are calling for a grassroots approach to raise awareness of scams, as bad actors target Indigenous Australians and people who speak English as a second language.
09/11/2021.author: None found

09/11/2021.headline: Singapore further delays intellectually disabled man's execution after he contracts COVID-19
09/11/2021.description: The execution of a Malaysian national in Singapore has been delayed after he tested positive to COVID-19.
09/11/2021.author: None found

09/11/2021.headline: New COP26 climate pledges are unlikely to slow the pace of global warming, UN says
09/11/2021.description: An assessment of new pledges by the UN Environment Programme has found Earth is still on course for a "catastrophic" temperature rise of 2.7C this century, largely because the most ambitious emissions cuts are envisaged after 2030.
09/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

09/11/2021.headline: 'Let's go Brandon': the coded anti-Joe Biden insult now spreading internationally
09/11/2021.description: The slogan has become a right-wing catchcry and also spread beyond US shores, including to Australia.
09/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

10/11/2021.headline: There's a humanitarian crisis unfolding at the Belarus-Poland border. Here's what you need to know
10/11/2021.description: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko has been accused of luring migrants to Belarus with the false promise of safe passage to the European Union.
10/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

10/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison warned against relying on 'unproven' carbon capture and storage technology
10/11/2021.description: Experts say the controversial carbon capture and storage technology has yet to be proven at scale, and question marks remain over whether it can help drive down Australia’s emissions.
10/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

10/11/2021.headline: Queensland's home quarantine program to be expanded once state hits 70 per cent vaccination rate
10/11/2021.description: Health Minister Yvette D'Ath says returning Queenslanders and eligible visitors can home quarantine in the state once they hit the 70 per cent double dose mark.
10/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

10/11/2021.headline: More countries are scrapping the death penalty, but Singapore isn't one of them
10/11/2021.description: Singapore's justice system is under the microscope as campaigners scramble to halt the planned execution of accused Malaysian drug smuggler Nagaenthran K. Dharmalingam.
10/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

10/11/2021.headline: ‘Zoe’s Law’ introduced to NSW Parliament to increase penalties for crimes that kill unborn children
10/11/2021.description: New laws that increase penalties for offenders who kill unborn children have been introduced to the NSW parliament.
10/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

10/11/2021.headline: Why this Bruce Lee film has been dubbed in an Aboriginal language
10/11/2021.description: Bruce Lee’s classic film “Fist of Fury” is the first to ever be dubbed in the Aboriginal language of Noongar Daa, with the hope that it will spark new interest in the endangered language.
10/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

10/11/2021.headline: Australia needs better working conditions, not shaming, for Pacific farm workers
10/11/2021.description: OPINION: Pacific workers in Australia on the Seasonal Worker Programme are subject to stringent conditions and liable to exploitation. A federal government campaign shaming workers who 'abscond' from their jobs is obscuring the real issues.
10/11/2021.author: Rachel Clun

10/11/2021.headline: Poland accuses Belarus of 'state terrorism' over role in escalating migrant crisis
10/11/2021.description: Western governments have been accusing Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko of luring migrants to his country and sending them to cross into Poland in retaliation for sanctions.
10/11/2021.author: Malcolm Conn

10/11/2021.headline: 'Our leaders are failing us': Draft of final COP26 agreement criticised as 'empty words'
10/11/2021.description: It comes a day after analysis of new COP26 pledges are still likely to see Earth warm 2.7C this century.
10/11/2021.author: Malcolm Conn

10/11/2021.headline: China and the US announce surprise agreement to work closer on cutting emissions
10/11/2021.description: Joe Biden last week said Xi Jinping had "walked away" from the climate crisis by skipping the COP26 summit. The countries together account for nearly 40 per cent of all carbon pollution.
10/11/2021.author: Malcolm Conn

10/11/2021.headline: 'Start booking flights': Queensland's home quarantine program expanded
10/11/2021.description: Health Minister Yvette D'Ath says returning Queenslanders and eligible visitors can home quarantine in the state once they hit the 70 per cent double dose mark.
10/11/2021.author: Malcolm Conn

10/11/2021.headline: Judge orders release of Donald Trump's secret documents on US Capitol riot
10/11/2021.description: The district judge said that it is in the public interest to release the documents, despite the former US president arguing he retained executive privilege to keep them under seal.
10/11/2021.author: Malcolm Conn

10/11/2021.headline: Countries hailed as COVID-19 success stories are now reimposing restrictions
10/11/2021.description: A growing number of countries that had lifted COVID-19 restrictions are now reimposing them as cases surge.
10/11/2021.author: Malcolm Conn

10/11/2021.headline: China and the US announce surprise pact to accelerate climate action
10/11/2021.description: Joe Biden last week said Xi Jinping had "walked away" from the climate crisis by skipping the COP26 summit. The countries together account for nearly 40 per cent of all carbon pollution.
10/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

10/11/2021.headline: Interactive: Which countries are leading the way on net zero?
10/11/2021.description: While much of the world has set a date of 2050 to reach net zero emissions, some countries have gone further than others.
10/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

10/11/2021.headline: Net zero modelling to be released in the next fortnight, Scott Morrison says
10/11/2021.description: The prime minister says the government's long-awaited climate modelling will be released before the next parliamentary sitting later this month.
10/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

10/11/2021.headline: Uber sued by US Justice Department for making people with disability pay extra 'wait fees'
10/11/2021.description: The Department of Justice said applying "wait fee" costs to passengers with disability amounts to unlawful discrimination.
10/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

11/11/2021.headline: 'Standards have slipped dramatically': Integrity experts warn of more pork-barrelling
11/11/2021.description: Former New South Wales Supreme Court judge Anthony Whealy says political “standards have slipped dramatically” to a point where the misuse of public funds had become normalise
11/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

11/11/2021.headline: Parents of Aishwarya Aswath say WA premier's comments are 'disrespectful'
11/11/2021.description: The family of Aishwarya Aswath will pursue their own inquiry into the seven-year-old's death from sepsis at Perth Children's Hospital earlier this year.
11/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

11/11/2021.headline: NSW sexual consent reforms move one step closer to becoming law
11/11/2021.description: People in New South Wales could soon have to make sure their sexual partners are consenting or risk committing a crime, with a consent reform bill passing the lower hous
11/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

11/11/2021.headline: Thousands of Australians across the country pause to mark Remembrance Day
11/11/2021.description: Services were held across the country on Thursday, including at the Australian War Memorial in Canberra, where a former ambassador to Afghanistan gave a solemn reflection on the fall of Kabul.
11/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

11/11/2021.headline: Queensland's women rugby league players to be paid the same as men in game-changing move
11/11/2021.description: Queensland women's coach Tahnee Norris says the QRL's decision to provide equal match payments to men's and women's Origin teams is a game-changing move.
11/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

11/11/2021.headline: ‘Failure’ or not at COP26, the world can still hold global warming to 1.5C
11/11/2021.description: OPINION: Take heart at what’s unfolded at COP26 in Glasgow – the world can still hold global heating to 1.5C.
11/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

11/11/2021.headline: Some 826,000 Australians forced to survive on support payments for more than a year
11/11/2021.description: The new ACOSS report also found that there are six people either seeking paid work or more hours for every job vacancy.
11/11/2021.author: Adam Pengilly

11/11/2021.headline: Fossil fuels vs renewables: Where the world's top 20 emitters stand
11/11/2021.description: As countries around the world pledge to shift their industries away from coal, here's where the top 20 CO2 emitting countries stand when it comes to electricity production and why it matters.
11/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

11/11/2021.headline: COP 26 climate pledges remain 'hollow' without fossil fuel phase out, UN chief says
11/11/2021.description: It comes as the crucial climate summit nears its conclusion, with negotiators still wrangling over a range of issues.
11/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

11/11/2021.headline: Chinese leaders approve resolution cementing Xi Jinping's power and status
11/11/2021.description: Experts say the messaging around Mr Xi from the party is assuming "cult-like features".
11/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

11/11/2021.headline: FW de Klerk, South Africa's last apartheid president, dies age 85
11/11/2021.description: His death was accompanied by a posthumous video message in which he apologised for the damage caused by apartheid.
11/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

11/11/2021.headline: Belarus threatens to cut gas to EU amid warning migrant crisis could lead to military clashes
11/11/2021.description: It comes as the crisis deepens and Ukraine says it will deploy thousands more troops to reinforce its frontier.
11/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

11/11/2021.headline: Tamil migrants warn of losing thousands of dollars in internet scam
11/11/2021.description: Culturally and linguistically diverse communities have increasingly fallen victim to scams with new data revealing a sharp rise in the amount of financial losses.
11/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

11/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison says he 'doesn’t believe' he's ever lied in public life
11/11/2021.description: The Prime Minister has refuted accusations he is a liar, saying he doesn’t believe he’s ever told a lie in public life.
11/11/2021.author: None found

11/11/2021.headline: Affirmative sexual consent laws are set to be introduced in Victoria
11/11/2021.description: The government will also amend laws to make it explicit that stealthing is a crime.
11/11/2021.author: None found

12/11/2021.headline: Proposed changes to the NDIS pose an 'enormous risk' to its future
12/11/2021.description: There are widespread concerns that proposed changes to the NDIS would give the head of its agency unprecedented powers to cut funding packages.
12/11/2021.author: None found

12/11/2021.headline: Australia’s deportation policy causes 'discomfort' in relationship with New Zealand
12/11/2021.description: Australia's visa cancellation policy has drawn diplomatic backlash over the high proportion of New Zealanders facing deportation - many of whom have spent the vast majority of their lives in Australia.
12/11/2021.author: None found

12/11/2021.headline: Australians will be financially better off under net zero plan, climate modelling shows
12/11/2021.description: Tens of thousands of new jobs will be created and Australians will be hundreds of dollars better off if the country adopts a 2050 net zero emissions target, a widely-anticipated report show
12/11/2021.author: None found

12/11/2021.headline: Refugee with disability says he's sleeping rough after release from immigration detention
12/11/2021.description: A refugee with a severe spinal disability is now sleeping rough on the streets of Melbourne after being detained for eight years by the Australian government.
12/11/2021.author: None found

12/11/2021.headline: Bob Katter slams Morrison government's 'blatantly racist' proposed voter ID laws
12/11/2021.description: Federal MP Bob Katter has slammed the government's proposed voter ID laws as "racist" and aimed at Indigenous Australian
12/11/2021.author: None found

12/11/2021.headline: Liberal senator pledges not to back government legislation in protest against vaccine mandates
12/11/2021.description: A Coalition senator has threatened to withhold his vote from the government due to his position on COVID-19 vaccine mandates.
12/11/2021.author: None found

12/11/2021.headline: Queensland on alert over mystery COVID cases as Australia records 11 more deaths
12/11/2021.description: Queensland is scrambling to uncover whether two new cases are linked, while the NSW government is cracking down on travel cancellation policies as the state's residents prepare to travel again.
12/11/2021.author: None found

12/11/2021.headline: 'We are stranded in this mess': Migrants at Belarus-Poland border plead for help
12/11/2021.description: Migrants stranded at the Belarusian-Polish border have described the "terrible" conditions they are enduring and urged authorities to help.
12/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

12/11/2021.headline: COP26 draft agreement urges stronger climate action but weakens rhetoric on fossil fuels
12/11/2021.description: A new draft document from the UN climate summit weakens language around the phasing out of fossil fuels in a bid to reach agreement between nearly 200 nation
12/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

12/11/2021.headline: State environment ministers ramp up pressure on federal government to show climate leadership
12/11/2021.description: State environment ministers say there needs to be stronger federal leadership for Australia to tackle climate change.
12/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

12/11/2021.headline: 'Morrison, get out of the way': Bushfire victims' fury over Australia's climate change moves
12/11/2021.description: Bushfire victims are calling on the government to act urgently on climate change and have shared their harrowing stories.
12/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

12/11/2021.headline: How the pandemic has changed the multicultural CBDs of Sydney and Melbourne
12/11/2021.description: Multimillion dollar initiatives are being launched to resuscitate the CBDs in Sydney and Melbourne. But will the multicultural hearts of Australia’s two biggest cities ever be the same again?
12/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

12/11/2021.headline: Luca lost his sight as a child. Now he makes braille greeting cards to help others
12/11/2021.description: More than 575,000 people in Australia are blind or have low vision, and teenager Luca Weber is among them. But fewer than a quarter are in full-time work, so Luca has started his own business.
12/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: 'Comically flawed': Australia slammed for its approach to net zero modelling
13/11/2021.description: Climate analysts criticise the modelling underpinning the Australian government's 2050 emissions reduction target.
13/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: Australia wins unwanted 'colossal fossil' award at COP26
13/11/2021.description: Australia took out the top dishonour at COP26 with the US and UK sharing the podium, as countries continue to negotiate a final agreement in Glasgow.
13/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: Britney Spears hails end of conservatorship as 'best day ever'
13/11/2021.description: Singer Britney Spears has won her freedom after a controversial conservatorship that controlled her life for 13 years was terminated in a Los Angeles court.
13/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: Victoria's proposed pandemic laws trigger Melbourne protest
13/11/2021.description: Large crowds have gathered in the Melbourne CBD to protest against a new vaccine mandate as well as a proposed new pandemic bill by the state government.
13/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: APEC leaders discuss COVID-19 vaccine tariffs and fossil fuel subsidies
13/11/2021.description: US President Joe Biden will hold a hotly anticipated virtual summit with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping on Monday.
13/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: Quarantine scrapped for vaccinated international students returning to NSW
13/11/2021.description: The first chartered plane will touch down in Sydney on 6 December with about 250 students from countries including Indonesia, Singapore, Vietnam, China and Canada.
13/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: Rodrigo Duterte's daughter to run for Philippines vice president
13/11/2021.description: The confirmation came just days before the deadline for candidates to make a late entry into the 2022 elections.
13/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: Beijing Winter Olympics sponsors asked to disclose supply chains
13/11/2021.description: Human Rights Watch has called on Beijing Winter Olympics sponsors to disclose their supply chains in China, particularly for products with the Olympic rings.
13/11/2021.author: Bevan Shields

13/11/2021.headline: COP26 urges coal curbs, faster climate action in third draft text
13/11/2021.description: A number of developed nations had earlier attempted to remove the mention of fossil fuels in the draft text altogether.
13/11/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

13/11/2021.headline: PCR test? Travel insurance? What you might need if you're heading overseas
13/11/2021.description: The Australian government has lifted the international travel ban for the fully vaccinated to certain countries, but there are some additional things to consider before you head to the airport.
13/11/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

13/11/2021.headline: 'Comically flawed': Climate experts criticise Australia's net zero modelling
13/11/2021.description: Climate analysts have questioned the assumptions in the modelling underpinning the Australian government's 2050 emissions reduction target.
13/11/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

13/11/2021.headline: Australia wins climate 'colossal fossil' award at COP26
13/11/2021.description: Australia took out the top dishonour at COP26 with the US and UK sharing the podium, as countries continue to negotiate a final agreement in Glasgow.
13/11/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

13/11/2021.headline: 'Nobody is safe until everyone is safe': APEC leaders agree to share vaccines equitably
13/11/2021.description: The meeting's major outcome was a commitment to slash tariffs on vaccines and other pandemic-related medical supplies to streamline the international response to the deadly health crisis.
13/11/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

13/11/2021.headline: COP26 agrees on global climate action deal but UN says it's 'not enough'
13/11/2021.description: The UN climate summit has wrapped with a global deal by nearly 200 countries aimed at limiting dangerous temperature rises, despite a last-gasp hitch from India and China seeking to water down language on fossil fuel.
13/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

13/11/2021.headline: New prison riot in Ecuador leaves at least 68 inmates dead
13/11/2021.description: It's the latest bout of violence in a jail that was the scene of a September riot that left 119 prisoners dead.
13/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

14/11/2021.headline: Australia urged to ramp up climate action as COP26 ends with deal to 'phase down' coal
14/11/2021.description: The final COP26 agreement requires countries to strengthen their 2030 climate targets by the end of next year. The Morrison government says its 2030 target is "fixed".
14/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

14/11/2021.headline: Pacific Island leaders vow to 'phase up' climate diplomacy after COP26
14/11/2021.description: Pacific Island leaders said they would "phase up" climate diplomacy to ensure there is follow through on the COP26 deal to limit global warming to 1.5C.
14/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

14/11/2021.headline: Indian community 'appalled' after Gandhi's statue was vandalised in Melbourne
14/11/2021.description: An attempt was made to decapitate the statue of Mahatma Gandhi at the Australian Indian Community Centre in Melbourne, a day after it was unveiled by the prime minister.
14/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

14/11/2021.headline: Four detained asylum seekers granted bridging visas in Melbourne
14/11/2021.description: After years of detention in offshore detention centres and immigration facilities in Melbourne, four asylum seekers have been granted bridging visas.
14/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

14/11/2021.headline: Julian Assange receives approval to marry fiancee Stella Moris in London prison
14/11/2021.description: WikiLeaks said the couple had launched legal action against the UK government for initially refusing the marriage.
14/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

14/11/2021.headline: Victoria sees growth of COVID-19 caseload ease slightly, posting 905 new cases
14/11/2021.description: Victoria has recorded 905 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases after reporting 1,221 on Saturday, while NSW has reported 196 new cases.
14/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

14/11/2021.headline: Ben Boyd National Park in NSW to be renamed over slave trade links
14/11/2021.description: The Ben Boyd National Park on the South Coast of NSW is being renamed after the findings of an independent report showed Ben Boyd's links to the slave trade.
14/11/2021.author: Anna Patty

14/11/2021.headline: Boris Johnson says COP26 deal 'tinged with disappointment'
14/11/2021.description: The UN COP26 summit in Glasgow was "tinged with disappointment" because of a failure to secure the agreement of all countries to phase out fossil fuels, UK PM Boris Johnson said
14/11/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

14/11/2021.headline: Austria has ordered a nationwide lockdown for unvaccinated people
14/11/2021.description: Under current rules, unvaccinated are already banned from restaurants, hotels and cultural venues unless they can show they have recently recovered from the disease.
14/11/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

14/11/2021.headline: Poland is accusing Belarus of arming stranded migrants
14/11/2021.description: Poland is accusing Belarus of arming stranded migrants with equipment and tear gas in preparation of a storm on the border fenc
14/11/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

14/11/2021.headline: Indian community 'appalled' after Gandhi statue vandalised in Melbourne
14/11/2021.description: An attempt was made to decapitate the statue of Mahatma Gandhi at the Australian Indian Community Centre in Melbourne, a day after it was unveiled by the prime minister.
14/11/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

14/11/2021.headline: US, China trade Taiwan warnings ahead of Biden-Xi summit
14/11/2021.description: Joe Biden and Xi Jinping have talked by phone twice since the veteran Democrat moved into the White House.
14/11/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

14/11/2021.headline: Australia's new diabetes strategy targets priority groups
14/11/2021.description: The federal government has released a new national diabetes strategy aimed at reducing the incidence and impacts of the disease among priority groups, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders.
14/11/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

14/11/2021.headline: UK's Queen misses Remembrance event due to sprained back
14/11/2021.description: The Remembrance service in London was supposed to be the Queen's first in-person public engagement since she was advised to rest, following a night in hospital last month.
14/11/2021.author: Felicity Caldwell

14/11/2021.headline: Why this Australian wants to launch the World Gay Boxing Championships
14/11/2021.description: Boxing has long had the stereotype of being a rough, macho and abrasive sport. But for members of the LGBTIQ+ community such as Martin Stark, it's something that has the potential to be for everyone, regardless of sexuality or gender identity.
14/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: Australia yet to grant a single humanitarian visa for fleeing Afghans, Senate hears
15/11/2021.description: Australia has been inundated by an estimated 150,000 Afghans applying for 3,000 humanitarian visas since the Taliban rose to power in Afghanistan in August.
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: Coronial inquest begins into COVID-19 deaths at St Basil's aged care home
15/11/2021.description: Counsel assisting has told an inquest into a deadly COVID-19 outbreak at a Melbourne aged care home of warnings that replacing regular staff would be dangerous.
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: Queensland is opening its border to fully vaccinated domestic travellers
15/11/2021.description: Queensland will ramp its home quarantine scheme for domestic travellers, but it's uncertain whether the state will lift caps on international arrivals.
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: William Tyrrell: A 'high intensity' search is being launched after new evidence emerges
15/11/2021.description: Detectives are launching a new search for the remains of missing boy William Tyrrell, seven years after he disappeared on the NSW mid-north coas
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: Amendments likely for Victoria's pandemic laws to improve transparency
15/11/2021.description: Amendments could be made to the Victorian government's controversial pandemic legislation ahead of debate in the upper house.
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison says coal industry will be around for 'decades to come'
15/11/2021.description: Scott Morrison disagrees with UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson's assessment the COP26 climate summit sounds the death knell of coal.
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: First Nations talent set to to take centre stage at Melbourne Fashion Week
15/11/2021.description: This year's Melbourne Fashion Week - which kicked off on Monday - will be a celebration of First Nations designers, models and artists.
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: Maori tribe tells anti-vaccine protesters to stop using haka
15/11/2021.description: The tribe recognised under New Zealand law as the cultural guardian of the Ka Mate haka has condemned the use of the haka to promote anti-vaccination messages.
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: 'Deep concern' for missing Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai as WTA calls for probe into assault claim
15/11/2021.description: The WTA Tour wants the Chinese government to investigate allegations from tennis star Peng Shuai that she was sexually assaulted by a senior official.
15/11/2021.author: None found

15/11/2021.headline: COVID-19 reaches remote Aboriginal community in NT for the first time, triggering lockdown
15/11/2021.description: The Greater Katherine and Robinson River regions have entered into a 72-hour lockdown after authorities confirmed two COVID-19 cases.
15/11/2021.author: Jocelyn Garcia

15/11/2021.headline: Louisa got COVID so can't have her vaccine yet. She's been shocked at the stigma
15/11/2021.description: As the nation reopens, Australians having to wait for vaccine doses because they caught COVID-19 are facing stigma and difficulty integrating into the vaccinated economy.
15/11/2021.author: Jocelyn Garcia

15/11/2021.headline: Freed US journalist Danny Fenster says he was not 'starved or beaten' in Myanmar jail
15/11/2021.description: US journalist Danny Fenster says he is healthy and happy to be heading home after flying to Qatar following his release from prison in Myanmar.
15/11/2021.author: Jocelyn Garcia

15/11/2021.headline: Last month was the warmest October in the northern hemisphere since records began
15/11/2021.description: The US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration agency says last month was the warmest October in the northern hemisphere on record.
15/11/2021.author: Jocelyn Garcia

15/11/2021.headline: Queensland borders reopen for vaccinated domestic travellers as state hits vaccine milestone
15/11/2021.description: Queensland will ramp its home quarantine scheme for domestic travellers, but it's uncertain whether the state will lift caps on international arrivals.
15/11/2021.author: Jocelyn Garcia

15/11/2021.headline: Queensland MP Ali King calls out anti-vaxxers over Nazi symbol graffiti
15/11/2021.description: MP Ali King says she is "disgusted" that someone in her community painted a racist symbol on her office thinking that "public health measures equal Nazism".
15/11/2021.author: Jocelyn Garcia

15/11/2021.headline: Breakthrough in William Tyrrell case as police zero in on single suspect
15/11/2021.description: NSW Police Commissioner Mick Fuller says there has been a significant breakthrough in the William Tyrrell case and he's confident police will solve the mystery.
15/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

15/11/2021.headline: UK raises terror threat level to 'severe' after Liverpool hospital blast
15/11/2021.description: A taxi passenger in Liverpool was carrying an improvised explosive device, police say as they investigate the blast as a "terrorist incident".
15/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

15/11/2021.headline: Freed US journalist says he was not 'starved or beaten' in Myanmar jail
15/11/2021.description: US journalist Danny Fenster says he is healthy and happy to be heading home after flying to Qatar following his release from prison in Myanmar.
15/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

16/11/2021.headline: Aboriginal residents in outback SA are having to choose between food and electricity
16/11/2021.description: Skyrocketing bills. A cash-strapped local council. Unpaid debts. As Coober Pedy's electricity affordability crisis continues, governments have been urged to step in and help fix it.
16/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

16/11/2021.headline: Katherine and Robinson River lockdown extended as NT COVID-19 outbreak grows
16/11/2021.description: All of the nine new cases identify as Aboriginal as state authorities scramble to contain the spread of the virus in Katherine.
16/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

16/11/2021.headline: Victoria's pandemic laws declared 'urgent' as parliament debate continues
16/11/2021.description: The Andrews government's new pandemic laws are on track to pass parliament following a series of amendment
16/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

16/11/2021.headline: US and EU are preparing new sanctions against Belarus over 'inhumane' border crisis
16/11/2021.description: Belarus officials say accusations that it is organising a migrant crisis are "absurd" as the country faces fresh sanctions.
16/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

16/11/2021.headline: Class action investigation launched into police strip searches at Splendour in the Grass
16/11/2021.description: Lawyers have launched a class action investigation into what they believe could be hundreds of "unlawful" strip searches of music festival patrons by NSW Police.
16/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

16/11/2021.headline: Residents in NSW town of Forbes ordered to evacuate as flood warnings intensify
16/11/2021.description: People in parts of the NSW central west town of Forbes have been ordered to evacuate, with major flooding expected to inundate the area overnight.
16/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

16/11/2021.headline: Victoria records 797 new COVID-19 cases as announcement on restrictions looms
16/11/2021.description: An announcement is set to be made later this week on when Victoria's COVID-19 restrictions will ease in line with the state hitting its next vaccination target.
16/11/2021.author: Sandra Hall

16/11/2021.headline: Human rights advocates urge government to lift travel restrictions on temporary migrants and refugees
16/11/2021.description: Almost one million temporary visa holders in Australia and more than 10,000 refugees stuck offshore remain in limbo because of the government’s international travel restrictions.
16/11/2021.author: None found

16/11/2021.headline: Labor pledges faster NBN for 1.5 million homes and businesses
16/11/2021.description: An extra 1.5 million homes and businesses are set to have full-fibre NBN access if Labor wins the next federal election.
16/11/2021.author: None found

16/11/2021.headline: At least three dead in suicide bombings near Uganda's parliament
16/11/2021.description: Two explosions have rocked Uganda's capital Kampala, killing at least three civilians in what police described as a co-ordinated attack by extremists.
16/11/2021.author: None found

16/11/2021.headline: COVID-19 lockdown extended as nine Aboriginal Northern Territorians test positive
