16/11/2021.description: The nine new cases are direct family of Labor Senator Malarndirri McCarthy, who has urged the Aboriginal community to "get tested and get vaccinated".
16/11/2021.author: None found

16/11/2021.headline: ‘I feel unsafe’: Most LGBTIQ+ Victorians don’t trust police, new report finds
16/11/2021.description: One transgender woman said she felt “unsafe and uncomfortable” when interacting with police and LGBTIQ+ liaison officers.
16/11/2021.author: None found

16/11/2021.headline: Joe Biden and China's Xi Jinping trade strong warnings on future of Taiwan
16/11/2021.description: Tension over Taiwan loomed large during a summit between US President Joe Biden and China's Xi Jinping.
16/11/2021.author: None found

16/11/2021.headline: We need to understand how anti-vaxxers feel to make sense of their actions
16/11/2021.description: OPINION: No longer fuelled purely by fears about vaccines and harmful side effects, the anti-vax movement is growing increasingly complex.
16/11/2021.author: None found

16/11/2021.headline: Police seize car linked to William Tyrrell case as investigation gathers pace
16/11/2021.description: A car has been seized in Sydney after NSW police spent the night spraying luminol at the property where three-year-old William Tyrrell went missing seven years ago.
16/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

16/11/2021.headline: Daniel Andrews has slammed the 'small ugly mob' protesting Victoria's pandemic bill
16/11/2021.description: Premier Daniel Andrews has slammed the "small, ugly mob" who continue to gather outside the Victorian parliament to protest against proposed pandemic laws.
16/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

16/11/2021.headline: Tuvalu’s ‘underwater’ COP26 speech caught everyone by surprise, even the country’s PM
16/11/2021.description: The 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP26) address delivered by the foreign minister of Tuvalu, Simon Kofe, went viral. But his creative thinking doesn’t stop there.
16/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

17/11/2021.headline: What it’s like seeking asylum in Australia when you don’t speak English
17/11/2021.description: Refugees who speak little or no English have told SBS News they struggle with isolation, finding employment and navigating their visa conditions.
17/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

17/11/2021.headline: Eight new COVID-19 cases recorded in NT as remote community outbreak grows
17/11/2021.description: Eight new COVID-19 cases have been recorded in the NT, five in the remote community of Robinson River.
17/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

17/11/2021.headline: Tonga's election is this week, but thousands of citizens in Australia can't vote
17/11/2021.description: Tonga heads to the polls on Thursday for its general election, but citizens living abroad, including in Australia, won't be casting their vote.
17/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

17/11/2021.headline: New move by Australian sporting codes to combat spectator racism
17/11/2021.description: Cricket Australia, the NRL and AFL, and Tennis Australia are among 20 signatory bodies that have backed new guidelines released by the Australian Human Rights Commission.
17/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

17/11/2021.headline: Former federal Labor MP Craig Thomson charged over alleged migration fraud
17/11/2021.description: Former federal Labor MP Craig Thomson could face up to 20 years in prison over accusations he was behind a multimillion-dollar migration fraud.
17/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

17/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison warns high-tech race must consider ‘ethical implications’ for human rights
17/11/2021.description: Scott Morrison has unveiled the government’s plan for developing “critical technologies” such as artificial intelligence and quantum computing.
17/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

17/11/2021.headline: Australia records nine new COVID deaths as Queensland reveals long waiting list to enter state
17/11/2021.description: Victoria has reported nine new COVID-19 deaths as NSW records zero deaths and Queensland residents stranded interstate face a long wait to return home.
17/11/2021.author: Peter de Kruijff

17/11/2021.headline: Debate and protests have been raging over Victoria's pandemic powers bill. Here's why
17/11/2021.description: Legal experts say polarisation over Victoria's pandemic powers bill has made it difficult for a sensible and democratic debate about the proposed legislatio
17/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

17/11/2021.headline: Tennis star Peng Shuai is not the first high-profile person to go missing in China
17/11/2021.description: Chinese player Peng Shuai's recent disappearance is not the first nor won’t be the last time a high-profile person in China has gone missing, an expert say
17/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

17/11/2021.headline: US Capitol riots' 'QAnon Shaman' sentenced to 41 months in prison
17/11/2021.description: US Capitol rioter Jacob Chansley has been sentenced to 41 months in prison for his role in the 6 January attac
17/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

17/11/2021.headline: Belarus says European Union talks over migrant crisis agreed
17/11/2021.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko will hold talks with the European Union over a migration crisis, officials sa
17/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

17/11/2021.headline: Indigenous advocates make last-ditch plea for key senators to block voter ID bill
17/11/2021.description: With only days until federal parliament returns for the last sitting weeks of the year, groups representing First Nations Australians have launched a last-ditch plea to sway crucial Senate votes.
17/11/2021.author: Michael Chammas

17/11/2021.headline: Trial date set for man accused of raping Brittany Higgins at Parliament House
17/11/2021.description: The man accused of raping former Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins at federal parliament has been given a tentative trial dat
17/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

17/11/2021.headline: Humanitarian visas for Afghans who helped Australian forces extended
17/11/2021.description: Thousands of Afghans who worked with Australian forces have had their temporary humanitarian visas extended.
17/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: What is the Religious Discrimination Bill and how could it affect Australia?
18/11/2021.description: The government is expected to introduce proposed religious discrimination laws to parliament before the end of the year, with advocates on both sides fiercely debating its merits.
18/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: 'We're not out of the woods': Warning as NT records no new COVID-19 cases
18/11/2021.description: Territorians have been warned the COVID-19 crisis is not over, while test results that will likely reveal the source of the current outbreak are expected to soon arrive.
18/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: Most of Victoria's COVID-19 rules to ease for the fully vaccinated from midnight
18/11/2021.description: Victoria will lift almost all remaining COVID-19 public health restrictions from midnight as the state reaches for 90 per cent double-dose vaccination coverage.
18/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: Talk of war with China over Taiwan could play into Beijing’s unification plan, analysts say
18/11/2021.description: Foreign policy analysts say the government should be "calm and consistent" in its strategy for Taiwan, with the self-ruled island facing increased aggression from China.
18/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: Fears grow over safety and whereabouts of Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai
18/11/2021.description: The chief executive of the Women’s Tennis Association said he had a “hard time” believing Peng Shuai had written an email attributed to her by Chinese state media and said "the WTA and the rest of the world need independent and verifiable proof that she is safe".
18/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: Victorian pandemic bill debate stalls as government scrambles to find support
18/11/2021.description: The debate on Victoria's pandemic laws has been delayed following the return of a former Labor MP, who plans to vote against it.
18/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: French dictionary adds non-binary pronoun, sparking anger from politicians
18/11/2021.description: The debate sparked by the introduction of a non-binary pronoun in a French dictionary is all about “gender politics”, according to Australian lexicographer Sue Butler.
18/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: 'Not here to be a victim': Britney Spears speaks out post-conservatorship
18/11/2021.description: Britney Spears has thanked her fans for "saving her life" after her conservatorship was dissolved by a judge last week.
18/11/2021.author: Toby Crockford

18/11/2021.headline: ‘I’m heartbroken’: Afghan interpreter 'shot by Taliban' forced to leave family in Pakistan
18/11/2021.description: EXCLUSIVE: The former interpreter for the Australian army made the dangerous journey to Pakistan to board a flight to Australia, but was told his family could not join him.
18/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

18/11/2021.headline: Belarus proposes sending thousands of migrants home as stand-off with EU continues
18/11/2021.description: Belarus has proposed returning 5,000 migrants to their countries and asked the European Union to take in 2,000 migrants on the Polish border, officials say.
18/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

18/11/2021.headline: Genomic testing confirms source of NT's COVID-19 outbreak as virus fears persist
18/11/2021.description: Genomic testing has confirmed who triggered the Northern Territory's latest COVID-19 outbreak, while residents have been warned the crisis isn't over.
18/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

18/11/2021.headline: Most of Victoria's COVID-19 rules ease for the fully vaccinated
18/11/2021.description: Victoria has lifted almost all remaining COVID-19 public health restrictions as the state reaches for 90 per cent double-dose vaccination coverage.
18/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

18/11/2021.headline: Death toll from British Columbia floods set to rise as government promises help
18/11/2021.description: Authorities expect more fatalities following flooding and landslides in the Canadian province which have displaced some 18,000 people.
18/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

18/11/2021.headline: Victorian pandemic bill debate set to resume as government scrambles to secure support
18/11/2021.description: The debate on Victoria's pandemic laws is expected to resume on Friday as the government seeks to secure one more vote to ensure it passes.
18/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

18/11/2021.headline: The Lebanese-Australians demanding a voice in the upcoming Lebanon election
18/11/2021.description: Lebanese-Australians are registering to vote in the 2022 Lebanon election, with many blaming the current government for the country's crippling economic crisis.
18/11/2021.author: Karen Martini

18/11/2021.headline: The stories behind these stunning images by First Nations photographers

25/11/2021.author: None found

25/11/2021.headline: Timeline for William Tyrrell search extended after rain thwarts progress
25/11/2021.description: The estimated timeframe for the search has now been extended to six weeks instead of the three weeks initially envisioned.
25/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Kylie Moore-Gilbert says it's her 'duty' to speak out for 'forgotten' political prisoners
26/11/2021.description: EXCLUSIVE: A year since she returned to Australia after spending two years in an Iranian prison, Dr Kylie Moore-Gilbert speaks to SBS News about campaigning for other political prisoners.
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Australia 'prepared' for new COVID-19 variant as other nations impose travel bans to contain risk
26/11/2021.description: The UK and Israel have imposed travel restrictions to contain any risk from the new COVID-19 variant found in South Africa as the Australian government says it is well prepared and is closely monitoring the situation.
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Royal commission into veteran suicides hears of hope for 'fundamental change'
26/11/2021.description: On the opening day of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide, veterans and families have spoken of the need for "fundamental change".
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Solomons police fire warning shots to disperse protesters, as Australian peacekeepers arrive
26/11/2021.description: An Australian peacekeeping mission has landed in Honiara to help quell civil unrest in the Solomon Islands.
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Push to diversify Australia's international student cohort under new government plan
26/11/2021.description: The federal government says its 10-year strategy for international education will help meet skill shortages and create new opportunities for "a more sustainable and diverse sector."
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: 'We were keeping an eye on them': PM confirms China spy ship outside Australian waters
26/11/2021.description: A Chinese spy ship was off Australia's coast in August and was shadowed by HMAS Supply, the federal government and the Department of Defence have confirme
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: EU looks to halt flights from southern Africa amid new COVID-19 variant fears
26/11/2021.description: The European Commission will propose stopping flights from southern Africa in a bid to contain the risk arising from a new COVID-19 variant, with other countries also tightening travel restrictions.
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: Pat Cummins takes the reins as new cricket Test captain
26/11/2021.description: Pat Cummins has been confirmed as Australia's new Test captain, with the paceman to take on a collaborative approach with new deputy Steve Smit
26/11/2021.author: None found

26/11/2021.headline: What you need to know about Omicron, the new COVID-19 'variant of concern'
26/11/2021.description: As the world reels over the discovery of a new COVID-19 'variant of concern', here is what we currently know - and don't know - about Omicron.
26/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

26/11/2021.headline: This homeless charity is changing lives, but can't keep up with surging demand
26/11/2021.description: Kids Under Cover, a charity that installs backyard studios for overcrowded struggling families, has had to pause its program because it can't meet the demand.
26/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Australia imposes travel restrictions, quarantine rules over new Omicron variant
27/11/2021.description: The federal government has announced the country's borders will be shut effective immediately to non-citizens who have been in southern Africa in the past fortnight as the Omicron variant of COVID-19 triggers a new wave of concern.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: 'Draconian': South Africa condemns rush to travel bans over Omicron variant
27/11/2021.description: The list of nations imposing travel restrictions over the new COVID-19 variant now include Australia, the United States, Brazil and Guatemala.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Three killed in Solomon Islands amid political unrest
27/11/2021.description: Police said forensic teams had launched an investigation and were still on the scene but that the cause of the deaths was unclea
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Positive COVID-19 case in NT assessed to rule out Omicron variant
27/11/2021.description: Authorities as yet have no genomic sequencing in relation to a COVID-19 case in a person who arrived on a repatriation flight from South Africa.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Victoria records 1,252 COVID-19 cases as protests continue for third weekend
27/11/2021.description: Thousands have again gathered in Melbourne's CBD to protest vaccine mandates, as Victoria records another 1,252 COVID-19 cases and five deaths.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Australia, others warn on Myanmar violence amid concern for civilians
27/11/2021.description: The governments of seven countries, including Australia, have issued a statement of concern over a military offensive in Myanmar.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Ocean wind farms on horizon for Australia as investment grows
27/11/2021.description: Offshore wind farms could soon be part of the view from some Australian beaches but climate campaigners say people should focus on the greater good.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Tributes flow as revered Broadway composer Stephen Sondheim dies aged 91
27/11/2021.description: Tributes have flowed for iconic Broadway composer and lyricist Stephen Sondheim, who passed away aged 91.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Socceroos' World Cup path now even harder after intercontinental playoff draw
27/11/2021.description: Australia face a tough path to next year's World Cup should they fail to qualify automatically, with a South American powerhouse awaiting them in a playoff.
27/11/2021.author: Vince Rugari

27/11/2021.headline: Food and fuel shortages as calm returns to Solomon Islands after riots
27/11/2021.description: Residents in Honiara say they are concerned about the soaring cost of food and fuel as businesses that weren't burnt down during the riots reopen.
27/11/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

27/11/2021.headline: Josephine Baker: France's adopted black superstar immortalised
27/11/2021.description: Josephine Baker, the French-American dancer and singer who fought in the French Resistance and later battled racism, will become the first black woman to enter the Pantheon on Tuesday.
27/11/2021.author: Sally Rawsthorne

27/11/2021.headline: How a special vaccine program connected with this region's multicultural residents
27/11/2021.description: Vaccination rates in Albury-Wodonga are among the highest in the country, and one of the local multicultural communities has coverage of nearly 100 per cent. It's been put down in no small part to a special outreach program.
27/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

27/11/2021.headline: From darkness into light: Jewish Australians say Hanukkah this year comes at the perfect time
27/11/2021.description: With COVID-19 lockdowns in Australia finally lifted, life is gradually returning to normal. For Jewish people in Australia preparing to celebrate Hanukkah, the Festival of Lights has come at the right time.
27/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

27/11/2021.headline: Residents of NSW Hunter region ordered to evacuate as flood levels rise
27/11/2021.description: Residents of several parts of NSW are on alert as widespread heavy rainfall led to flooding across much of the state.
27/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Meet the man who walked 4,000 km from Perth to Sydney to raise funds for refugees
28/11/2021.description: Ivor Houston wanted to make a difference to the lives of refugees, so he packed some essentials and travelled 4,000 km from Perth to Sydney on foot. After six months, he's now home.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Omicron COVID-19 variant arrives in Australia as two cases confirmed in Sydney
28/11/2021.description: The Omicron COVID-19 variant has arrived in Australia after testing confirmed two overseas travellers who arrived in Sydney were infected with the new strai
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Push to identify migrants killed in English Channel boat tragedy as families mourn
28/11/2021.description: Grief-stricken families are mourning loved ones, and seeking answers, in the wake of a migrant boat tragedy between England and France.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: 'COVID is going nowhere': Northern Territory locks down remote community
28/11/2021.description: A remote community south of Darwin has gone into lockdown after COVID-19 was detected in its wastewater, with four new cases reported in the Northern Territory.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Barbados grapples with legacy of colonial past as it cuts ties with British monarchy
28/11/2021.description: The legacy of a colonial past and the pandemic's impact on tourism pose major challenges for Barbados as it becomes the world's newest republic.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: ‘Unmask these trolls’: Federal government announces new social media anti-bullying laws
28/11/2021.description: In a crackdown against bullying and abuse on social media, the federal government has announced new legislation to combat the anonymity of online trolls.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: Israel closes its borders over Omicron as world races to contain new COVID-19 variant
28/11/2021.description: Countries across Europe have confirmed cases of the new coronavirus strain as governments worldwide began restricting travel from southern Africa.
28/11/2021.author: Zach Hope

28/11/2021.headline: 'Race against time': Omicron COVID-19 variant shuts borders across the globe
28/11/2021.description: South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa has slammed rich Western countries for their knee-jerk imposition of travel bans following the latest Omicron coronavirus outbreak.
28/11/2021.author: Matt Dennien

28/11/2021.headline: 'It's all lies': Migrants stuck at Polish border feel cheated by people smugglers
28/11/2021.description: Migrants stuck in Belarus are finding it harder to reach the European Union, and complain of being fleeced, then abandoned by smugglers
28/11/2021.author: Matt Dennien

28/11/2021.headline: Solomon Islands residents clean riot-hit capital as Australian peacekeepers deployed
28/11/2021.description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison said he was being regularly briefed about the deployment of peacekeepers in the Solomon Islands, and that while "things are very unstable, at this point there are no areas to our knowledge where there has been loss of control"
28/11/2021.author: Matt Dennien

28/11/2021.headline: 'Race against time': Omicron COVID-19 variant shuts borders across the globe
28/11/2021.description: South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa has slammed rich Western countries for their knee-jerk imposition of travel bans following the latest Omicron coronavirus outbreak.
28/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Concerns federal government's social media anti-bullying laws are 'unenforceable'
29/11/2021.description: The federal government's proposed laws have provided a beacon of hope for people who have advocated against online bullying, but experts say it's more complicated than Australians think.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Government asks ATAGI to review COVID-19 vaccine booster time frame in response to Omicron variant
29/11/2021.description: The federal government has called for calm after it was confirmed Omicron, a new and more transmissible COVID-19 strain, has reached Australia.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: NSW confirms four cases of Omicron as new COVID-19 variant arrives in the NT
29/11/2021.description: Two more international arrivals into NSW have been found to be infected with the Omicron COVID-19 variant, which has also been reported in the Northern Territory.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: What we know so far about Omicron, the new COVID-19 'variant of concern'
29/11/2021.description: Scientists are rapidly working to understand Omicron, the new COVID-19 variant. Here’s what we know so far.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Telcos handed stronger powers to block scam text messages
29/11/2021.description: The federal government will give telcos more power to identify and block scam texts, but says unsolicited messages sent from political parties are another matter.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Belgian backpacker's final moments heard at opening day of inquest
29/11/2021.description: Belgian teenager Theo Hayez took a dark and frightening track towards the beach the night he went missing in 2019, an inquest in the northern NSW town has heard.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Veteran suicide inquiry told of 'dark side' to military as government pledges services reform
29/11/2021.description: A royal commission has been told of a culture of torment and marginalisation in the defence forces, as the federal government said the inquiry won't delay reform of support programs for Australian veteran
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: The Omicron COVID-19 variant has sparked travel bans, but they aren't the answer to stopping it
29/11/2021.description: OPINION: Travel bans on countries detecting new variants, and the subsequent economic costs, may act as a disincentive for countries to reveal variants of concern in future.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Malawi president labels Western countries' Omicron travel bans 'Afrophobic'
29/11/2021.description: The restrictions brought in by countries including Australia are uncalled for, the president said.
29/11/2021.author: Penny Flanagan

29/11/2021.headline: Australia's reopening to visa holders delayed by two weeks to wait for more Omicron information
29/11/2021.description: The government says the move "will ensure Australia can gather the information we need to better understand the Omicron variant".
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: Acclaimed actor David Dalaithngu dies aged 68
29/11/2021.description: Actor David Dalaithngu has been hailed as "one of the greatest artists Australia has ever seen".
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: The Omicron variant has been partly blamed on rich countries and vaccine inequality
29/11/2021.description: The discovery of the Omicron variant comes as developed countries such as Australia roll out booster shot programs while vaccination rates and availability in lower socio-economic nations languish.
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: Jack Dorsey to step down as Twitter CEO
29/11/2021.description: Jack Dorsey has resigned as the chief executive of Twitter, posting a message to the platform that it was "finally time for me to leave".
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: Australia's Solomon Islands intervention is defending a 'corrupt' government, premier says
29/11/2021.description: Malaita province premier Daniel Suidani says the presence of Australian troops is helping to protect a prime minister and "corrupt" government that don't represent the people.
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: Japan joins growing list of countries to shut borders as world health ministers to discuss Omicron threat
29/11/2021.description: Japan has become the latest country to reinstate strict border controls barring all new foreign arrivals, while G7 health ministers are set to discuss the Omicron COVID-19 variant.
29/11/2021.author: None found

29/11/2021.headline: 'Standout' rise in number of Australians reporting racism as a 'very big' problem
29/11/2021.description: The latest edition of the Scanlon Foundation's annual Mapping Social Cohesion survey has found Australians continue to be supportive of immigration, but 20 per cent more now see racism as a 'very big' proble
29/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Brittany Higgins calls for 'immediate action' following report into parliamentary culture
30/11/2021.description: Brittany Higgins said she hoped "all sides of politics" would fully implement all recommendations from a damning report into workplace culture at Parliament House.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: One in three parliamentary staffers say they have faced sexual harassment
30/11/2021.description: The report by Sex Discrimination Commissioner Kate Jenkins has recommended greater gender parity and a new code of conduct for MPs and staff to change parliamentary workplace culture.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: 'Completely unacceptable': Outrage over racial profiling at Melbourne supermarket
30/11/2021.description: One of Australia's biggest grocery store chains says it has taken "corrective action" following the furore over racial profiling at a Melbourne supermarket.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Fifth Omicron COVID-19 case in NSW visited venues in Sydney and Central Coast
30/11/2021.description: NSW Health has confirmed a woman in her 30s who spent time in Sydney and the Central Coast has been infected with the new variant.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Senator accused of making 'growling' noises while Jacqui Lambie spoke
30/11/2021.description: Senators have called out another member in parliament for making disrespectful dog noises towards Jacqui Lambie as she asked a question.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: 'We have lost a titan': Tributes are pouring in for actor David Dalaithngu
30/11/2021.description: Actor David Dalaithngu has been hailed as "one of the greatest artists Australia has ever seen".
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Australia can’t keep out Omicron forever, chief medical officer says
30/11/2021.description: It comes as Tasmania announces it is closing its borders to the vast majority of overseas arrivals.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Christian Porter cleared over blind trust, but rules should change, committee says
30/11/2021.description: A parliamentary committee has found Christian Porter did not break any rules by not declaring a blind trust that paid some of his legal bills, but recommended the rules be changed.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Australians on edge as Omicron variant threatens family Christmas reunions
30/11/2021.description: Australians eager to reunite with their families over Christmas are now wracked with anxiety as the emergence of the Omicron COVID-19 variant casts doubts over their travel plans.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Barbados cuts ties to the British monarchy to declare world's newest republic
30/11/2021.description: The move sees the end of centuries of British influence over the island nation, including more than 200 years of slavery until 1834.
30/11/2021.author: Peter Ryan

30/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison says the new Omicron COVID-19 variant won't lead to more lockdowns
30/11/2021.description: It comes as Tasmania announces it is closing its borders to the vast majority of overseas arrivals.
30/11/2021.author: Angus Thompson

30/11/2021.headline: Why West Papuans are raising a banned independence flag across Australia
30/11/2021.description: First raised 60 years ago, the Morning Star flag is a potent symbol of the people of West Papua's long struggle for independence, and people around Australia can expect to see it raised again on 1 December
30/11/2021.author: Angus Thompson

30/11/2021.headline: The Omicron variant was in the Netherlands at least a week before South African scientists raised the alarm
30/11/2021.description: The COVID-19 Omicron variant was detected in the Netherlands before two flights arrived from South Africa last week carrying the virus.
30/11/2021.author: Angus Thompson

30/11/2021.headline: Booze in parliament: 'drinking culture' under microscope in major workplace review
30/11/2021.description: A review by the Sex Discrimination Commissioner Kate Jenkins has taken aim at the drinking culture at Parliament House, joining a chorus of others calling for greater regulation.
30/11/2021.author: Angus Thompson

01/12/2021.headline: Christian Porter is quitting politics and won't recontest the next election
01/12/2021.description: The Liberal MP's announcement comes amid speculation Health Minister Greg Hunt is also planning to quit politics before the next election.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: 40 years since the AIDS epidemic began, HIV rates in Australia are at an all-time low
01/12/2021.description: Four decades since HIV/AIDS was first detected, the number of cases in Australia and outcomes for those diagnosed have drastically improved. But as with the COVID-19 pandemic, it's not the case everywhere.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Australians touch down in Fiji on the first tourist flight in 20 months
01/12/2021.description: A tourist flight from Sydney to Nadi has landed for the first time since Fiji's borders closed in March 2020.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Labor candidate calls out racist messages telling her not to contest election
01/12/2021.description: Sally Sitou says any racist comments that aim to deter her from running are “really damaging” to Chinese-Australians and all migrant communities.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Several asylum seekers have been offered bridging visas and will be released from detention
01/12/2021.description: Several asylum seekers from detention centres in Melbourne and Brisbane have been told they will be freed from detention and offered bridging visas to live in the community.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Harrowing stories lay bare the toxic workplace culture of Parliament House
01/12/2021.description: A sweeping review into parliament’s workplace culture has uncovered horrific stories of sexual harassment, bullying, sexual assault and gender inequality.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Government drops push to pass controversial voter ID bill ahead of next election
01/12/2021.description: It came after Jacqui Lambie revealed she would vote against the government's contentious bill, significantly reducing the chances of it passing the Senate.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: 'A win for reproductive choice': Northern Territory abortion law overhauled
01/12/2021.description: The legislation was passed unanimously and will prevent women from having to travel hundreds of kilometres for treatment.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: Trio who allegedly escaped from the Howard Springs quarantine facility arrested
01/12/2021.description: The trio allegedly jumped the fence at the Howard Springs facility near Darwin early on Wednesda
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: A traveller who arrived in Sydney from Nigeria is 'likely' to have Omicron variant
01/12/2021.description: Initial testing indicates another overseas traveller, who recently arrived in Sydney from Nigeria, has the Omicron variant of COVID-19.
01/12/2021.author: Rachel Eddie

01/12/2021.headline: As Barbados celebrates becoming a republic, this is what it means for Australia
01/12/2021.description: Barbados' decision to cut ties with the British monarchy has "connotations for the rest of the parliamentary monarchies” including Australia, an academic says.
01/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

01/12/2021.headline: IOC has acted irresponsibly in Peng Shuai case, Sport and Rights Alliance says
01/12/2021.description: The Sport and Rights Alliance says the International Olympic Committee has acted irresponsibly and must put athletes' needs first, calling upon the organisation to use its influence to push China to investigate Peng's claims of sexual assault.
01/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

01/12/2021.headline: Australia set to pass new laws that provide powers to sanction human rights abusers
01/12/2021.description: The reforms would allow the Australian government to directly target individuals or entities accused of perpetrating serious human rights violations.
01/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

01/12/2021.headline: Six asylum seekers have been offered bridging visas and will be released from detention
01/12/2021.description: Asylum seekers from detention centres in Melbourne and Brisbane have been told they will be freed from detention and offered bridging visas to live in the community.
01/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

01/12/2021.headline: 'Living in limbo': Exploitation, wage theft rife for temporary visa holders, report says
01/12/2021.description: Workers on temporary visas in Australia are being grossly underpaid and overworked while they struggle to secure permanent residency, according to a new report.
01/12/2021.author: None found

01/12/2021.headline: WTA suspends tennis tournaments in China over Peng Shuai case
01/12/2021.description: The Women's Tennis Association says it's suspending tournaments in China because of its concerns over the safety of Chinese player Peng Shuai.
01/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Alan Tudge stands down amid investigation into claims he was ‘abusive’ during affair
02/12/2021.description: Cabinet minister Alan Tudge says he "completely and utterly" rejects claims of abusive behaviour made by his former media adviser Rachelle Miller.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Health Minister Greg Hunt calls time on parliamentary career
02/12/2021.description: Mr Hunt, who has overseen the country's response to COVID-19, has been in parliament for two decades.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Australian doctors have made a dire prediction on bushfire deaths
02/12/2021.description: A new report, endorsed by some of the country's top medical colleges, warns the effects of climate change will place immense pressure on Australia's hospitals in the next 10 years.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Charities warn new laws will ‘stifle’ their right to political advocacy
02/12/2021.description: Groups including charities will now be forced to reveal their donors if they reach the $250,000 threshold for political spending.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Greens senator apologises over 'disgusting' slur directed at Liberal colleague
02/12/2021.description: Senator Lidia Thorpe has apologised "unreservedly" to a Liberal senator after telling her "at least I keep my legs shut" in the Senate.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: Victoria has become the first state with pandemic-specific laws after controversial bill passes
02/12/2021.description: The new laws mean the premier and health minister, rather than the chief health officer, will have the power to declare a pandemic and enforce restrictions.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: How travel plans for Australian visa holders have changed due to Omicron
02/12/2021.description: Some Australian visa holders were set to arrive in Australia from 1 December, but the emergence of the Omicron COVID-19 variant has pushed that bac
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: ‘Discriminatory’: African-Australian community leaders slam travel bans
02/12/2021.description: African-Australian community leaders have criticised the government’s decision to impose a travel ban on nine African countries after the emergence of the Omicron COVID-19 variant.
02/12/2021.author: None found

02/12/2021.headline: The exposure of people with disability increased in 2021, but there's a long way to go
02/12/2021.description: From recent film releases to sporting triumphs at the Paralympics, there has been more celebrated exposure of people with disability this year, but advocates say misrepresentation remains a problem and outcomes for those in the community are progressing too slowly.
02/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

02/12/2021.headline: European Union imposes new sanctions on Belarus in tandem with US and Britain
02/12/2021.description: Belarus has been hit with further sanctions, with the EU accusing the nation of flying in migrants as a tactic to destabilise European states.
02/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

02/12/2021.headline: This industry is in dire need of workers - yet migrants aren't getting a look-in
02/12/2021.description: It's an industry in serious need of workers as Australia rebounds from the pandemic, yet almost half of migrants qualified in engineering can't find jobs.
02/12/2021.author: Shane Wright

02/12/2021.headline: Why this Iranian asylum seeker burst into tears after being released from detention
02/12/2021.description: Mohammad Kord has been released from immigration detention after more than eight years, but he says he won't be truly happy until his friends are also freed.
02/12/2021.author: None found

03/12/2021.headline: Labor unveils plan to reduce carbon emissions by 43 per cent by 2030
03/12/2021.description: Opposition leader Anthony Albanese says the "comprehensive plan" will take Australia forward by creating 604,000 jobs, with five out of six of those situated in the regions.
03/12/2021.author: None found

03/12/2021.headline: Peter Dutton defends Alan Tudge as an 'honourable man' amid abuse allegations
03/12/2021.description: Defence Minister Peter Dutton has defended his colleague Alan Tudge in the wake of an ex-staffer accusing Mr Tudge of physical and emotional abuse.
03/12/2021.author: None found

03/12/2021.headline: Booster shots timeline unchanged after review prompted by Omicron uncertainty
03/12/2021.description: Chief Medical Officer Paul Kelly has announced booster shots won't be expedited for delivery as health authorities continue to assess the impact of the Omicron variant.
03/12/2021.author: None found

03/12/2021.headline: New disability strategy welcomed by culturally diverse and First Nations advocates
03/12/2021.description: The federal government will invest $250 million towards a new disability strategy that aims to improve the lives of millions of people with disability in Australia over the next decade.
03/12/2021.author: None found

03/12/2021.headline: Scott Morrison is 'disappointed' Liberal senator's vaccination status wasn't made clear to him
03/12/2021.description: A South Australian Liberal senator, who's spoken out against vaccine mandates, has been placed in hotel quarantine in Adelaide.
03/12/2021.author: None found

03/12/2021.headline: Victoria has passed new laws that make it unlawful for schools to sack LGBTIQ+ staff
03/12/2021.description: Victorian Attorney-General Jaclyn Symes has vowed to defend her laws if the federal government's Religious Discrimination Bill, which would override the state's, passes parliament.
03/12/2021.author: None found

03/12/2021.headline: GPs in Victoria experiencing 'abusive behaviour' from people seeking vaccine exemptions
03/12/2021.description: The Royal Australian College of General Practitioners says anti-vaxxer groups have been encouraging people to seek exemptions on grounds that are not listed by ATAGI.
03/12/2021.author: None found

03/12/2021.headline: 'The more you cut, the better': experts measure up Labor's emissions reduction policy
03/12/2021.description: Labor's emission reduction policy of 43 per cent by 2030 is a step in the right direction but falls short of what the science calls for, experts say.
03/12/2021.author: Nicole Lindsay

03/12/2021.headline: 'It's discrimination': African diplomats ask Australia to treat Omicron-hit countries equally
03/12/2021.description: Health Minister Greg Hunt has defended the decision to ban travel from nine nations in southern Africa after the emergence of the Omicron COVID-19 variant, despite calls from diplomats to apply a blanket rul
03/12/2021.author: Nicole Lindsay

03/12/2021.headline: Three Omicron cases confirmed in Sydney school cluster as new COVID-19 variant hits ACT
03/12/2021.description: The Omicron variant has made its way to the nation's capital, as NSW authorities remain on high alert over a cluster at a Sydney school.
03/12/2021.author: Nicole Lindsay

03/12/2021.headline: International students are dumping Australia for the UK and US due to border rules
03/12/2021.description: Many students stuck overseas have chosen to continue their studies in the UK, US and Canada as they have softer border rules compared to Australi
03/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

03/12/2021.headline: WHO chief scientist urges against panic over emergence of Omicron variant
03/12/2021.description: WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan says it is too early to make any conclusions about the Omicron variant of the coronavirus.
03/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: Thousands of 'freedom' marchers rally in Melbourne after passage of pandemic laws
04/12/2021.description: Anti-vaccine and government protesters have once again rallied in Melbourne, taking over various locations including the entrance to the city's ABC studios.
04/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: No changes to SA border but new rules for interstate arrivals amid Omicron concern
04/12/2021.description: It comes as the state records five new cases of COVID-19, Victoria 1,365 cases and nine deaths, NSW 325 cases and one death, Queensland five local cases, and the ACT seven new cases.
04/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: Hunt underway for parents of Michigan school shooting suspect charged with manslaughter
04/12/2021.description: Authorities are searching for the parents of the Michigan teen accused of murdering four students at his high school, as charges are also filed against them.
04/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: An Italian man tried to scam a vaccine certificate by using a silicone arm
04/12/2021.description: The man in Biella tried to play the system by presenting health workers with a fake arm in order to get a COVID-19 vaccine certificate. Authorities weren't buying it.
04/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: Cook Islands records first case of COVID-19 since the pandemic began
04/12/2021.description: A 10-year-old boy quarantining after arriving on a repatriation flight with his family has tested positive to COVID-19, becoming the first-ever case of the virus in the Pacific nation.
04/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: Brazil's Jair Bolsonaro to be investigated for linking COVID-19 vaccine to AIDS
04/12/2021.description: The vaccine sceptic far-right Brazilian president was temporarily suspended from both Facebook and YouTube after his comments.
04/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: Pope Francis condemns 'slavery' and 'torture' in migrant camps on visit to Cyprus
04/12/2021.description: The Pope made the comments at the Church of the Holy Cross in Nicosia.
04/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: Joe Biden vows to make any Russian invasion of Ukraine 'very, very difficult'
04/12/2021.description: More than 94,000 Russian troops are massed near Ukraine's borders, said Ukraine's defense minister, who cited intelligence reports suggesting Moscow may be planning a large-scale military offensive for the end of January.
04/12/2021.author: Chris Roots

04/12/2021.headline: Parents of accused Michigan school shooter arrested a day after going missing
04/12/2021.description: Authorities had been searching for the parents of the Michigan teen accused of murdering four students at his high school.
04/12/2021.author: None found

04/12/2021.headline: Up to 120 arrested after mob lynching of Sri Lankan factory manager in Pakistan
04/12/2021.description: Prime Minister Imran Khan called the vigilante attack a "day of shame for Pakistan".
04/12/2021.author: None found

04/12/2021.headline: European countries looking to set up new diplomatic presence in Afghanistan
04/12/2021.description: French President Emmanuel Macron says several European countries are working toward establishing a joint diplomatic presence in Afghanistan.
04/12/2021.author: None found

04/12/2021.headline: TGA provisionally approves Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for children aged five to 11
04/12/2021.description: Health Minister Greg Hunt says the Pfizer vaccine for children aged five to 11 years old has taken a step closer and could be available from 10 January.
04/12/2021.author: None found

04/12/2021.headline: The female independents vying for the seats of high-profile Liberal men at the next federal election
04/12/2021.description: Concerned by a growing disconnect between the values of their communities - such as gender equality and climate - and how they are dealt with in Canberra, these independent candidates are among those ready to contest the 2022 federal election.
04/12/2021.author: None found

04/12/2021.headline: Parents of accused Michigan school shooter plead not guilty to manslaughter charges
04/12/2021.description: James and Jennifer Crumbley appeared by videolink from jail for their arraignment, after authorities arrested the couple on Saturday following a high-profile manhunt.
04/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: How Australia's Magnitsky-style laws could empower victims of human rights abuses
05/12/2021.description: Australia has passed historic legislation that will ban human rights abusers from entering the country. Here's how the laws would work.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: More Omicron cases detected in NSW and the ACT, taking national total to 18
05/12/2021.description: Both NSW and the ACT reported new cases of the coronavirus variant on Sunday. The Northern Territory is the only other jurisdiction to have reported an Omicron case.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: At least 13 people dead after eruption of Indonesia's Semeru volcano
05/12/2021.description: Semeru, more than 3,600 metres high, is one of Indonesia's nearly 130 active volcanoes.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: Peta Credlin apologises for blaming COVID-19 outbreak on South Sudanese Melburnians
05/12/2021.description: The apology comes around half a year after Sky News Australia released an apology on her behalf for the comments.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: Labor pledges boost in university and TAFE funding to address skills shortages
05/12/2021.description: Labor Leader Anthony Albanese has outlined how his party will provide more than $1 billion for more TAFE and university places.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: Indian security forces kill 13 civilians in Nagaland, sparking investigation
05/12/2021.description: Nagaland's chief minister has appealed for calm and announced an investigation.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: Australia joins US-led group decrying Taliban for 'summary killings' of ex-Afghan forces
05/12/2021.description: It comes on the heels of a report that documents the alleged summary execution or enforced disappearance of 47 former members of the Afghan National Security Forces, other military personnel, police and intelligence agents.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: The defining photos of Angela Merkel's 16-year stint as German chancellor
05/12/2021.description: As Angela Merkel bows out of politics this week, here's a look back at some of the most iconic and career-defining photographs from her 16 years as Germany's "eternal chancellor".
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: Pope calls neglect of migrants 'shipwreck of civilisation' on Lesbos visit
05/12/2021.description: Pope Francis condemned the exploitation of migrants for political purposes on Sunday during a visit to the Greek island of Lesbos.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: Anti-racism activist calls for control of neo-Nazi groups after attack on Sydney home
05/12/2021.description: Paddy Gibson says there will be more attacks "on people of colour, on Aboriginal people, even white people" if far-right groups aren't stopped from organising.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: US congressman posts family Christmas picture with guns, days after deadly school shooting
05/12/2021.description: A US congressman is under fire for posting a picture of his family smiling and holding guns in front of a Christmas tree days after a deadly school shooting rocked the country.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: At least 14 people dead after eruption of Indonesia's Semeru volcano
05/12/2021.description: Semeru, more than 3,600 metres high, is one of Indonesia's nearly 130 active volcanoes.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: Cleo Smith's alleged abductor due before court
05/12/2021.description: Police discovered Cleo Smith at a property in Carnarvon, a coastal town almost 1,000km north of Perth, just minutes from her family home.
05/12/2021.author: None found

05/12/2021.headline: The murky world of politicians' covert social media accounts
05/12/2021.description: As the federal government stamps down on anonymous users who spout hate and defame others online, questions are being raised around the legitimacy of accounts under aliases from politicians and their staffers.
05/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: What we know so far about Australia's COVID-19 vaccines for children aged five to 11
06/12/2021.description: With the Pfizer vaccine provisionally approved for those as young as five and the rollout expected to begin in January, we asked an epidemiologist how the advice about doses and risks differs compared to adults
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: Why Scott Morrison is backing Gladys Berejiklian’s possible tilt at federal politics
06/12/2021.description: The prime minister has thrown his support behind former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian contesting the next federal election in the northern Sydney seat of Warringah.
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: Medevac asylum seekers forced to wait years for medical treatment, report finds
06/12/2021.description: A new report says that one asylum seeker's knee was inoperable by the time he arrived in Australia under the Medevac legislation.
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: Labor rules out boosting 2030 climate target if elected
06/12/2021.description: Labor’s climate change and energy spokesperson Chris Bowen has rejected claims from Prime Minister Scott Morrison its 2030 emissions target amounts to an “opening bid” in negotiations with the Greens.
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: Queensland announces early border reopening as it nears a COVID-19 vaccination milestone
06/12/2021.description: Fully-vaccinated travellers from COVID-19 hotspots will be able to enter Queensland from next Monday as the state closes in on an 80 per cent vaccination rat
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: Aung San Suu Kyi and former Myanmar president Win Myint have been jailed for four years
06/12/2021.description: The 76-year-old Suu Kyi has been detained since the generals ousted her government in the early hours of 1 February, ending Myanmar's brief democratic interlude.
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: NSW records 10 Omicron cases in a single day as authorities continue to investigate source
06/12/2021.description: Victoria has recorded more than 1,000 new COVID-19 cases and six deaths
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: How Fijians who relied on tourism have survived the pandemic
06/12/2021.description: Around 140,000 tourism employees in Fiji lost their job after the border slammed shut in March 2020. Here's how locals survived when the nation's main source of revenue dried up.
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: Solomon Islands leader says he won't bow down to 'the forces of evil' as no-confidence motion fails
06/12/2021.description: Opponents accused Mr Sogavare and his government of lying, looting and using Chinese money to cling to power during a debate over the no-confidence motion brought by opposition leader Matthew Wale.
06/12/2021.author: None found

06/12/2021.headline: The US has announced a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing
06/12/2021.description: The decision is in response to what the White House described as "China's 'ongoing genocide and crimes against humanity in Xinjiang".
06/12/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

06/12/2021.headline: 'Sham trial' condemned as Aung San Suu Kyi jailed for two years
06/12/2021.description: Other members of Suu Kyi's National League for Democracy have also received harsh sentences from the country's junta
06/12/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

06/12/2021.headline: Three-year-old with COVID-19 transferred to Royal Darwin Hospital
06/12/2021.description: It comes as New South Wales recorded 10 Omicron cases in a single day, while Victoria reported more than 1000 new infections.
06/12/2021.author: Hamish Hastie

06/12/2021.headline: Federal MPs are urging Australia to join a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics
06/12/2021.description: The federal government is considering a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics.
06/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

06/12/2021.headline: Investigation finds Victoria's border exemption system was 'unjust' and 'inhumane'
06/12/2021.description: An investigation into Victoria's border exemption scheme has found just eight per cent of applications were approved and many never made it to a decision-maker.
06/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

06/12/2021.headline: Australia calls for release of Aung San Suu Kyi after 'deeply concerning sentencing'
06/12/2021.description: Australia is deeply concerned about the conviction and sentence handed to Myanmar's deposed democratic leader Aung San Suu Kyi.
06/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.description: An Australian government boycott of the upcoming Winter Olympics in Beijing would put pressure on China over human rights abuses, Uyghur and Tibetan community members say.
07/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.description: The Coalition backbencher has been reprimanded by his own party for supporting comments likening Australia's COVID-19 measures to the Nazi concentration camp Auschwitz and the Tiananmen Square massacre.
07/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.headline: Burmese Australians condemn ‘unjust’ sentencing of Aung San Suu Kyi
07/12/2021.description: Burmese Australians have lambasted Myanmar's military regime for mercilessly suppressing pro-democracy protests and using the judicial system to strangulate its political opponents.
07/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.headline: As Australia looks to vaccinate more children, Fiji is leading the way in the Pacific
07/12/2021.description: Fiji is hoping to build on its high  COVID-19 vaccination rates among adults, with its sights now set on protecting more and more children.
07/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.headline: The Reserve Bank has left interest rates on hold. Here's when economists think they will rise
07/12/2021.description: Australia's central bank says record low interest rates won't be lifted for "some time", but many economists believe they could climb within the next two years.
07/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.headline: NSW records another six Omicron cases as parents urged to get their teens vaccinated
07/12/2021.description: NSW Chief Health Officer Kerry Chant is urging parents to get their teens vaccinated over the summer holidays as the state records six cases of the new Omicron variant.
07/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.headline: The US Justice Department is suing Texas, alleging the state discriminated against Black and Hispanic voters
07/12/2021.description: The US Justice Department sued Texas on Monday, accusing the Republican-led state of discriminating against Black and Hispanic voters with its redrawn electoral maps.
07/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.headline: Two Fijians test positive for Omicron COVID-19 variant
07/12/2021.description: The variant, dubbed Omicron, has now been found in about 40 countries around the world.
07/12/2021.author: Janine Perrett

07/12/2021.headline: How Australia became a flashpoint for the US far-right and anti-vax movement
07/12/2021.description: Far-right and anti-vaccine movements in the United States are bent on trying to 'save Australia', and experts fear their conspiratorial rhetoric may take hold here.
07/12/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

07/12/2021.headline: Suspect in case of murdered journalist Jamal Khashoggi detained in France
07/12/2021.description: The murder of the Washington Post journalist sparked international outrage.
07/12/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

07/12/2021.headline: Joe Biden warns Vladimir Putin of 'strong' Western response to any Ukraine attack
07/12/2021.description: US President Joe Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin have held two hours of virtual talks on Ukraine and other disputes.
07/12/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

07/12/2021.headline: Children as young as five will be able to get a COVID-19 jab 'before school returns'
07/12/2021.description: Every five to 11-year-old would be able to get their first COVID-19 vaccine dose before the start of the next school year, a Senate committee has been told.
07/12/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

07/12/2021.headline: Chile congress takes 'historic and decisive step' to approve same-sex marriage bill
07/12/2021.description: The vote culminates a process that began in 2017 when then-President Michelle Bachelet pushed congress to pass a same-sex marriage law.
07/12/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

07/12/2021.headline: 'Sobbing with frustration': Why NSW teachers are striking for the first time in a decade
07/12/2021.description: Thousands of teachers across NSW have rallied against the government for what strikers say is a failure to address shortages in the workforce and uncompetitive salaries.
07/12/2021.author: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon

07/12/2021.headline: Omicron variant doesn't seem to cause more severe disease, top WHO official says
07/12/2021.description: WHO emergencies director Mike Ryan said there was no sign that Omicron could fully sidestep protections provided by existing COVID-19 vaccines.
07/12/2021.author: Julie Sonnemann

08/12/2021.headline: Australia joins diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics
08/12/2021.description: China has hit back after Prime Minister Scott Morrison confirmed that Australian officials will not attend the 2022 Winter Olympic Games in Beijing.
08/12/2021.author: Julie Sonnemann

08/12/2021.headline: Australia to toughen regulations for cryptocurrency and 'buy-now-pay-later' providers
08/12/2021.description: Treasurer Josh Frydenberg says the planned reforms are the biggest in the payments sector of the financial system since EFTPOS replaced cheques.
08/12/2021.author: Julie Sonnemann

08/12/2021.headline: Victoria records first Omicron infection as health authorities investigate more cases
08/12/2021.description: An international traveller who landed in Melbourne has become Victoria's first Omicron COVID-19 case, as health authorities investigate two more cases who are likely infected with the new variant.
08/12/2021.author: Julie Sonnemann

08/12/2021.headline: PM slammed for online behaviour of MPs as he talks internet safety to teens
08/12/2021.description: While the prime minister attended a press conference discussing the impacts of social media trolling, a Labor Senator called into question three "dangerous" members of his backbench, urging the government to "stop them or remove them".
08/12/2021.author: Julie Sonnemann

08/12/2021.headline: Scott Morrison tells George Christensen to go 'quietly' into retirement
08/12/2021.description: The Coalition backbencher recently appeared on a US conspiracy theorist's web series and laughed at comments that compared Australia’s quarantine facilities to the Nazi death camp Auschwitz.
08/12/2021.author: Julie Sonnemann

08/12/2021.headline: Australia's medicines watchdog approves Moderna vaccine for COVID-19 booster shots
08/12/2021.description: The Therapeutic Goods Administration said Moderna would be able to be used as a booster regardless of what COVID-19 vaccine brand people received during their first two dose
08/12/2021.author: Julie Sonnemann

08/12/2021.headline: Olaf Scholz pledges 'new beginning' after succeeding Angela Merkel as German chancellor
08/12/2021.description: He will lead an unprecedented three-way ruling coalition on the federal level with the pro-spending, environmentalist Greens and the fiscally more conservative, libertarian Free Democrats
08/12/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/12/2021.headline: India Defence Chief General Bipin Rawat among 13 killed in helicopter crash
08/12/2021.description: The helicopter was en route from an air force base to a hillside military college in the southern state of Tamil Nadu when the Russian-made Mi-17 helicopter came down near the town of Coonoor.
08/12/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/12/2021.headline: Peter Dutton ordered to pay part of refugee activist’s legal bill
08/12/2021.description: Defence Minister Peter Dutton has not been awarded full legal costs against Shane Bazzi with a judge saying their case should have been in a lower court.
08/12/2021.author: Georgina Robinson

08/12/2021.headline: Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce tests positive for COVID-19 in the US
08/12/2021.description: Australia's deputy prime minister is currently in the United States, and chose to get tested for COVID-19 after experiencing symptoms.
08/12/2021.author: None found

08/12/2021.headline: Pfizer says booster shots offer promising signs against Omicron in laboratory tests
08/12/2021.description: Laboratory tests suggested that three shots of their vaccine were able to neutralise the new variant, while two doses could still be protective against severe disease, the companies said.
08/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: Why 'abandoned' refugees in Indonesia are sewing their lips together and self-immolating
09/12/2021.description: Thousands of Hazara refugees in Indonesia have sunk into desperation after waiting up to 10 years to be resettled in other countries. Now, they are camping outside UN offices demanding to be heard.
09/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: A diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics is growing. What will it achieve?
09/12/2021.description: The United States, Australia, the United Kingdom and Canada have all joined a diplomatic boycott of the upcoming Beijing Winter Olympics over human rights concerns in China, but what will it achieve?
09/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: Senate report calls for royal commission-like judicial inquiry into media diversity
09/12/2021.description: A parliamentary inquiry into media diversity has backed former prime minister Kevin Rudd’s calls for a broader probe into the Australian media industry.
09/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: Gladys Liu admits community divide over government’s handling of China relationship
09/12/2021.description: The Hong Kong-born MP says her constituents have raised the issue of the government’s aggressive stance towards Beijing, with some Liberals fearing a backlash at the next federal election.
09/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: Canada and the UK join Australia and the US in Olympic diplomatic boycott
09/12/2021.description: The diplomatic boycott of the Winter Olympic Games by the US and Australia has been joined by the UK and Canada - but China has warned of counter-measures.
09/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: Why thousands of Serbians have been rallying against Rio Tinto and the country's government
09/12/2021.description: Rio Tinto's plans to build Europe's largest lithium mine in the Jadar Valley and now-shelved government legislation that would have made it easier have angered thousands of Serbians.
09/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: Matildas star Sam Kerr goes viral after flooring a pitch invader
09/12/2021.description: This pitch invader wanted a selfie. Matildas star Sam Kerr gave him something else.
09/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: New Zealand unveils plan to ban young people from ever buying cigarettes
09/12/2021.description: A new law that aims to limit smokers to five per cent of New Zealand's population means people aged 14 or under will never be able to legally buy cigarettes when the legislation commences in 2025.
09/12/2021.author: None found

09/12/2021.headline: Can you mix and match your COVID-19 vaccine and booster shot brands?
09/12/2021.description: If you’ve had AstraZeneca for your first two COVID-19 vaccine doses, is it safe to have a Pfizer booster? And where does Moderna fit into things? Here’s the latest advice for people in Australia.
09/12/2021.author: Daniel Brettig

09/12/2021.headline: China says Australia, the UK and US will 'pay the price' for Olympic diplomatic boycott
09/12/2021.description: China says Australia, the UK and the US will pay the price for their "mistaken acts" after deciding not to send government delegations to the Winter Olympics.
09/12/2021.author: Daniel Brettig

09/12/2021.headline: The Solomon Islands' democracy has been downgraded to 'narrowed', placing it in line with Australia
09/12/2021.description: Restrictions to media freedoms, access to information and the right to protest have hurt Solomon Islanders' civil rights, according to a new report.
09/12/2021.author: Daniel Brettig

09/12/2021.headline: Australian children aged five to 11 can be vaccinated against COVID-19 from January
09/12/2021.description: Children aged between five and 11 can receive a Pfizer vaccine from 10 January following approval from Australia's leading vaccine advisory group.
09/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

09/12/2021.headline: Hanna told her church she was abused. Years later, her abuser was still working with children
09/12/2021.description: Exclusive: Members of Australia’s Coptic Orthodox Church across three states have come forward with allegations they were sexually abused as children by church teachers and a priest over the past decade. Some were told there would be an investigation, but they’re still seeking justice.
09/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

09/12/2021.headline: 'I'm going in a different direction': Gladys Berejiklian rejects federal politics bid
09/12/2021.description: After several weeks of speculation, former New South Wales premier Gladys Berejiklian has confirmed she will not be running for federal politics.
09/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

09/12/2021.headline: China is trolling Australia over its Olympics boycott. Experts say this has backfired
09/12/2021.description: Chinese state media have taunted Australia with political cartoons for joining a US-led diplomatic boycott of the upcoming Beijing Winter Olympics.
09/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

10/12/2021.headline: Afghan mothers forced to sell their children to survive as starvation threatens millions
10/12/2021.description: Aid groups say more children could die from malnutrition in Afghanistan over the next few months than the total number of people killed in the 20-year war.
10/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

10/12/2021.headline: Scott Morrison expects Australia's borders will reopen to visa holders by Christmas
10/12/2021.description: The prime minister expects Australia will reopen to visa holders before the year's end following a delay because of fears about the Omicron COVID-19 variant.
10/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

10/12/2021.headline: Daniel Andrews makes first pandemic declaration under Victoria's new public health laws
10/12/2021.description: The laws allow the Victorian premier to declare a pandemic and the health minister to enforce orders such as lockdowns, mask-wearing, vaccination mandates, and quarantine.
10/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

10/12/2021.headline: Taiwan loses another diplomatic ally after Nicaragua recognises China
10/12/2021.description: Taiwan expressed "heartfelt pain and regret" over the decision and the foreign ministry promptly removed Nicaragua from its dwindling list of diplomatic allies on its website.
10/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

10/12/2021.headline: Australia's coal-fired power plants closing earlier than expected
10/12/2021.description: Coal plants are being retired faster than anticipated and Australia's national energy market is expected to be operating without the fossil fuel by 204
10/12/2021.author: Jessica Yun

10/12/2021.description: A parliamentary committee has cautioned there remains a lack of evidence to justify the government’s push to bolster visa cancellation powers.

17/12/2021.description: One of the study's authors said Indigenous languages were silenced by colonisation but added schools had a role to play in their preservation.

This is what the data currently tells us about hospitalisations in each state and territory, how vaccination rates have had an impact, and what role Omicron could play in what happens next.

Unable to return to work and unsure of what financial support they'll qualify for in the future, they don't know how they'll cope.

31/12/2021.author: Sarah Danckert

31/12/2021.headline: Two jumping castle victims farewelled in Tasmania
31/12/2021.description: The coroner is investigating the circumstances around the accident in Devonport.
31/12/2021.author: Sarah Danckert

31/12/2021.author: Sarah Danckert

01/01/2022.headline: NSW reports 22,577 new COVID-19 cases as Queensland expands indoor mask mandate
