01/01/2022.headline: At least 12 people dead after stampede at Hindu shrine in Indian-controlled Kashmir
01/01/2022.description: The disaster happened at the Mata Vaishno Devi in Indian-administered Kashmir, one of the most revered Hindu shrines in northern India.
01/01/2022.author: Marta Pascual Juanola

01/01/2022.headline: Young boy dies after going missing in remote NT community southwest of Alice Springs
01/01/2022.description: Police have not named the community and would only say the boy was aged under 10.
01/01/2022.author: Marta Pascual Juanola

01/01/2022.headline: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen urges China to stop its 'military adventurism'
01/01/2022.description: Warplanes from China have made a historically high number of incursions into Taiwan's air defence zone over the past few months.
01/01/2022.author: Marta Pascual Juanola

01/01/2022.headline: France has brought in free contraception for women aged 18-25
01/01/2022.description: The scheme covers the pill, IUDs, contraceptive patches and other methods composed of steroid hormones.
01/01/2022.author: Marta Pascual Juanola

01/01/2022.headline: Thousands send messages to late Chinese COVID-19 whistleblower doctor two years on
01/01/2022.description: Dr Li's death led to an outpouring of grief on social media at a time when people were on edge about the virus and authorities were under fire over a perceived lack of transparency and a hardline approach taken to whistleblowers.
01/01/2022.author: Marta Pascual Juanola

01/01/2022.headline: The growing Sikh community looking for a permanent home on the NSW-Victoria border
01/01/2022.description: The Black Summer bushfires brought the charitable work of Australia’s Sikh communities into the spotlight. Now a Sikh community in Albury-Wodonga is hoping to establish a permanent home there
01/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

01/01/2022.headline: South Africa holds modest state funeral for 'spiritual father' Desmond Tutu
01/01/2022.description: Anglican Archbishop Emeritus Desmond Tutu has been farewelled in South Africa and remembered for his role in ending its apartheid regime.
01/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: NSW COVID-19 hospitalisations pass 1,000 as cases continue to balloon across Australia
02/01/2022.description: COVID-19 infections continue to climb rapidly across Australia. Here's all the latest news.
02/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: Labor pledges $500m for Sydney to Newcastle high-speed rail
02/01/2022.description: Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese says a fast-rail link between Sydney and Newcastle will be a Labor priority should it win the federal election.
02/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: Fire erupts at South African parliament building in Cape Town
02/01/2022.description: A fire has broken out at South Africa's parliament building in Cape Town, with the roof catching alight and smoke visible from miles away.
02/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: A South Korean has crossed over to the North in a rare defection
02/01/2022.description: South Korea's military has reported a rare defection to its northern neighbour, despite a hardened border due to COVID-19 restrictions.
02/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: Two days ago, Colorado was fighting catastrophic fires. Now it's blanketed by snow
02/01/2022.description: Snow and frigid temperatures have compounded the misery of Colorado residents returning to salvage what remains of their homes following a devastating wildfire.
02/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: Denmark wants to make all its domestic flights green by 2030
02/01/2022.description: The aviation industry is one of the biggest emitters of greenhouse gases.
02/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: Public sector in UK told to prepare for a quarter of workforce to be absent due to COVID-19
02/01/2022.description: The UK's public sector is being told to prepare for up to a quarter of the workforce being absent due to COVID-19 illness, or isolation.
02/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: Fears Omicron is fuelling a third COVID-19 wave in India as cases rise
02/01/2022.description: Officials and medical experts fear the Omicron COVID-19 variant might fuel a third wave of the disease.
02/01/2022.author: Mark Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: Man arrested over fire at South African parliament buildings in Cape Town
02/01/2022.description: A man in his 50s has been arrested in connection with a major fire that is still raging inside South Africa's parliament building in Cape Town.
02/01/2022.author: None found

02/01/2022.headline: Sudan Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok resigns amid deadly anti-coup protest
02/01/2022.description: The resignation of Abdalla Hamdok comes less than two months after he signed an agreement with the military to be reinstated as prime minister.
02/01/2022.author: None found

02/01/2022.headline: Omicron is causing an 'almost a vertical increase' in US COVID-19 infections
02/01/2022.description: The Unites States' top infectious diseases official Dr Anthony Fauci says while the country is experiencing an almost "vertical increase" in COVID-19 cases caused by the Omicron variant, the peak may be just weeks away.
02/01/2022.author: None found

02/01/2022.headline: Hong Kong independent news outlet shuts down to 'ensure safety'
02/01/2022.description: CitizenNews announced "with a heavy heart" that it would cease operations on Tuesday following the raid of another independent news outlet by Hong Kong's national security police
02/01/2022.author: None found

02/01/2022.headline: Israel offers over 60s, healthcare workers fourth COVID-19 vaccine dose as cases surge
02/01/2022.description: People over 60 and medical workers will be able to get a fourth shot of the COVID-19 vaccine in Israel.
02/01/2022.author: None found

03/01/2022.headline: Australia records more than 37,000 new COVID-19 cases in a single day as hospitalisations rise
03/01/2022.description: COVID-19 infections continue to climb rapidly across Australia. Here's all the latest new
03/01/2022.author: None found

03/01/2022.headline: 'You can't make everything free': PM rejects calls for free rapid antigen tests for everyone
03/01/2022.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says rapid antigen tests are not medicines and the federal government won't be heeding calls to make them free for all, adding that there are plans for concessional access.
03/01/2022.author: None found

03/01/2022.headline: Man charged with arson after Canberra's Old Parliament House fire
03/01/2022.description: Police have charged a 30-year-old Victorian man with arson and damaging Commonwealth property in relation to a fire at Canberra's Old Parliament House.
03/01/2022.author: None found

03/01/2022.headline: The program helping refugees learn to drive in regional Australia
03/01/2022.description: Two Congolese refugees living in Albury-Wodonga recognised their communities were isolated due to limited public transport - so they're setting up the region's first in-language driving program to help.
03/01/2022.author: None found

03/01/2022.headline: US Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene permanently banned from Twitter
03/01/2022.description: Twitter has permanently banned US republican Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene for violation of the social media platform's COVID-19 misinformation policy.
03/01/2022.author: None found

03/01/2022.headline: Joe Biden says US will 'respond decisively' if Russia further invades Ukraine
03/01/2022.description: US President Joe Biden has told Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy the United States will "respond decisively" if Russia further invades Ukraine.
03/01/2022.author: None found

03/01/2022.headline: Prince Andrew faces crunch week in United States sexual assault lawsuit
03/01/2022.description: The 61-year-old Prince Andrew, Queen Elizabeth II's second son, has not been criminally charged and has repeatedly and strenuously denied allegations of sexual assaul
03/01/2022.author: None found

03/01/2022.headline: Iran calls for Donald Trump to be tried over Qasem Soleimani killing
03/01/2022.description: Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi says if the former US president does not face justice for the assassination of General Soleimani, he will seek his own revenge.
03/01/2022.author: Mary Ward

03/01/2022.headline: Fears of another deadly outbreak at Sydney's Newmarch House after worker tests positive
03/01/2022.description: Families hold concerns for loved ones at Western Sydney aged care facility Newmarch House, as a new COVID-19 case is confirmed at the site of a deadly outbreak in 2020.
03/01/2022.author: Mary Ward

03/01/2022.headline: Israel's Jerusalem Post website hacked on Soleimani assassination anniversary
03/01/2022.description: The website of Israeli newspaper the Jerusalem Post and the Twitter account of the newspaper Maariv have been temporarily paralysed by pro-Iranian hackers..
03/01/2022.author: Mary Ward

04/01/2022.headline: Free tests and price caps: How other countries are handling the demand for rapid antigen tests
04/01/2022.description: As demand grows for rapid antigen tests, Australians are struggling with price-gouging and limited supply. Meanwhile, in some countries, the tests are being given out for free.
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: 'The system is absolutely not coping': Hospital staff struggle as COVID-19 admissions rise
04/01/2022.description: The situation is dire for frontline workers who are working up to 18 hours a day to keep up with the surging demand as COVID-19 infections continue to place pressure on healthcare systems.
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: Climate change is threatening the livelihoods of Fiji's fisherwomen
04/01/2022.description: Across remote, coastal areas of Fiji, women play a crucial role in sustaining both food and income security. But, they say, their livelihoods are now being threatened by the impacts of climate change.
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: Australia surges past COVID-19 milestone of more than 500,000 cases since pandemic began
04/01/2022.description: With NSW and Victoria again recording a one-day high for daily COVID-19 infections, Australia has passed the grim pandemic milestone of 500,000 cases.
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: Hong Kong activist Chow Hang-tung jailed in Tiananmen Square vigil case
04/01/2022.description: A former leader of the Hong Kong Alliance, Chow Hang-tung was convicted a second time for inciting people in Hong Kong to commemorate the deadly 1989 Beijing event.
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: Will working holidaymakers return to Australia in 2022?
04/01/2022.description: OPINION: Australia's working holidaymaker program has remained open to visa applications throughout the pandemic, but they declined by an astonishing 99.5 per cent in 2020.
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: Australia should target skilled workers heading for UK and Canada - expert
04/01/2022.description: Australia should do more to lure skilled migrants away from more popular destinations such as the United Kingdom and Canada, a leading economist say
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: Record COVID-19 hospitalisations in NSW as Victoria, Queensland infections surge
04/01/2022.description: Victoria, NSW and Queensland have all recorded big increases in COVID-19 infections, with Victoria's case numbers almost doubling.
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: Chilean police officers stung, hospitalised, after beekeepers hold protest with 10,000 bees
04/01/2022.description: Seven police officers have been taken to hospital in Chile after being stung during a protest by beekeepers concerned by a long-term drought.
04/01/2022.author: Clancy Yeates

04/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic to play in Australian Open after being granted COVID-19 vaccine exemption
04/01/2022.description: Tennis Australia says Djokovic's exemption "was granted following a rigorous review process involving two separate independent panels of medical experts".
04/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

04/01/2022.headline: Prince Andrew’s lawyers push New York judge to dismiss sex abuse case
04/01/2022.description: The Duke of York's lawyers argued he was protected by a previously confidential settlement that his accuser, Virginia Giuffre, signed in 2009.
04/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

04/01/2022.headline: Chinese city of Yuzhou plunged into lockdown after discovery of three COVID-19 cases
04/01/2022.description: It comes as Xi'an - a historic city of 13 million people in neighbouring Shaanxi province - approaches the end of its second week in lockdown.
04/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

04/01/2022.headline: Court rules Iran should pay $148 million in damages after shooting down passenger plane
04/01/2022.description: A court in Canada has ruled Iran should pay millions of dollars to families of six Canadian residents killed when Iran's military shot down a plane in 202
04/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

04/01/2022.headline: Advocacy group says government should deliver free rapid antigen tests to people with disability
04/01/2022.description: People with disability should receive free in-home testing, including PCR testing for those who cannot travel, says a key advocacy group, as the ACCC looks into skyrocketing rapid antigen test prices.
04/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

04/01/2022.headline: France vows to fight violence against women after three killings in 24 hours
04/01/2022.description: Feminist groups accuse the French government of having done too little to protect women from gendered violence after 113 died at the hands of men in 2021.
04/01/2022.author: Jordan Baker

04/01/2022.headline: Canada reaches $44 billion agreement to reform Indigenous child welfare system
04/01/2022.description: The government said last month it was setting aside the money for compensation and reform but announced the details on Tuesday.
04/01/2022.author: Jordan Baker

04/01/2022.headline: Indian police make arrest over fake 'auction' of Muslim women
04/01/2022.description: Several Indian Muslim women in recent days have said their pictures had been used without consent to create an open-source app.
04/01/2022.author: Jordan Baker

05/01/2022.headline: Free rapid antigen tests to be made available to concession card holders, Prime Minister says
05/01/2022.description: People who test positive on a rapid antigen test won't be required to take a PCR test and all states and territories, excluding Western Australia, won't require RATs for interstate travel.
05/01/2022.author: Jordan Baker

05/01/2022.headline: Australia's border rules apply to everyone, including tennis stars: Karen Andrews
05/01/2022.description: Men's tennis world No.1 Novak Djokovic is due to land in Australia on Wednesday with a vaccine exemption to play in the Australian Open, but the Home Affairs minister says rules will not be bent for anyone.
05/01/2022.author: Jordan Baker

05/01/2022.headline: Qantas pilots making errors after long periods spent grounded by COVID-19, report claims
05/01/2022.description: The airline said it had developed an enhanced return-to-work program 'fit for the unprecedented challenge facing our industry'.
05/01/2022.author: Jordan Baker

05/01/2022.headline: North Korea fires suspected ballistic missile into sea
05/01/2022.description: Japan announced its foreign and defence ministers will hold talks with their US counterparts following the presumed missile test.
05/01/2022.author: Jordan Baker

05/01/2022.headline: Donald Trump cancels news conference scheduled for one-year anniversary of Capitol riot
05/01/2022.description: Donald Trump has called off a news conference scheduled for the one-year anniversary of deadly rioting by his supporters at the US Capitol in Washington.
05/01/2022.author: Jordan Baker

05/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic reportedly stopped at Melbourne Airport after vaccine exemption drama
05/01/2022.description: There has been huge public backlash to news that Djokovic received a vaccination exemption allowing him to play in the Australian Open.
05/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

05/01/2022.headline: Free rapid antigen tests to be made available to concession card holders
05/01/2022.description: People who test positive on a rapid antigen test won't be required to take a PCR test and all states and territories, excluding Western Australia, won't require RATs for interstate travel.
05/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

05/01/2022.headline: Performers have been boycotting this month's Sydney Festival. Here's why
05/01/2022.description: More than 25 performers and organisations have withdrawn from the Sydney Festival over a $20,000 sponsorship deal with Australia's Israeli embassy.
05/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

05/01/2022.headline: Kazakhstan declares state of emergency after national protests over fuel price rise
05/01/2022.description: Authorities in Kazakhstan have promised a tough crackdown on protesters as mass unrest plunges the Central Asian country into its biggest crisis in decades.
05/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

05/01/2022.headline: Hong Kong bans flights from eight countries, including Australia, and all cruises
05/01/2022.description: The city will also ban indoor dining from 6pm on Friday and close swimming pools, sports centres, bars, clubs and museums for at least two weeks, in an effort to combat Omicron.
05/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

05/01/2022.headline: French President Emmanuel Macron says he wants to 'piss off' unvaccinated people
05/01/2022.description: The French leader said unvaccinated people were "irresponsible" and that he was planning to make their lives so complicated they would end up having a vaccine.
05/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

05/01/2022.headline: Elective surgery halted in Victoria due to fears over hospital pressure
05/01/2022.description: The change has been made to ensure hospitals can continue to meet demand.
05/01/2022.author: Scott Spits

05/01/2022.headline: Australia has gone from COVID control to chaos. So what now? Two paths lie before us
05/01/2022.description: OPINION: The public has been left to their own devices as all our previous safeguards collapse around us. We urgently need a “vaccines-plus” strategy to flatten the curve.
05/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

05/01/2022.headline: Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers seek new trial after juror tells media he was abused
05/01/2022.description: Lawyers for Ghislaine Maxwell say she will request a new trial after revelations by a juror in her case that he was abused himself.
05/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic's lawyers challenging tennis star's deportation after Australian visa cancelled
06/01/2022.description: There had been huge public backlash to news that Djokovic received a vaccination exemption allowing him to play in the Australian Open.
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: This man created the 'Find a RAT' website on his holiday to help Australians test for COVID
06/01/2022.description: As the search for rapid antigen tests (RATs) becomes difficult in parts of Australia, community initiatives are springing up to help people in Australia get tested for COVID-19.
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: Australia records its coolest year in nearly a decade
06/01/2022.description: The Bureau of Meteorology has revealed 2021 was Australia's coolest year since 2012 and the wettest since 2016.
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: So you've tested positive for COVID-19, what now?
06/01/2022.description: The number of COVID-19 patients in Australia is growing by the tens of thousands a day, so what should you do if you catch it?
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: Australia and Japan sign 'historic' security pact
06/01/2022.description: The new treaty has already drawn comment from Beijing.
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: Lockdown for unvaccinated in NT; COVID-19 hospitalisations jump in NSW
06/01/2022.description: Hospitals are under strain as Australia's states and territories battle large numbers of COVID-19 infections. Victoria has announced changes around testing and density limits and the Northern Territory has imposed a snap lockdown on unvaccinated residents.
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: Victorians asked to report COVID-19 rapid antigen test results to state government
06/01/2022.description: It comes as PCR testing demand across the country surges and as Prime Minister Scott Morrison defends the government's supply of RATs.
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: Tributes paid to Boy from Bourke Percy Hobson, Australia's first Indigenous gold medallist
06/01/2022.description: Hobson went on to win in 1962 with a Games record height of 2.11m.
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Danckert

06/01/2022.headline: 'Kept in captivity': Novak Djokovic's family takes aim at government as legal fight continues
06/01/2022.author: Fergus Hunter

06/01/2022.headline: Rebel commanders call for international intervention in Myanmar's civil war
06/01/2022.description: EXCLUSIVE: Myanmar's civil war, sparked by a military coup against the democratically-elected leader Aung San Suu Kyi in February last year, is intensifying
06/01/2022.author: Fergus Hunter

06/01/2022.headline: Immunocompromised patient exposed to COVID-19 at major Sydney hospital
06/01/2022.description: The patient had to wait for several hours in the Royal Prince Alfred Hospital's waiting area with other patients, one of whom ended up testing positive to COVID-19.
06/01/2022.author: Fergus Hunter

06/01/2022.headline: French vaccine pass gets initial nod from parliament after tumult
06/01/2022.description: The new bill, passed by the lower house of parliament in France, aims to further tighten the country's COVID-19 rules, making it obligatory for everyone to be fully vaccinated.
06/01/2022.author: Fergus Hunter

06/01/2022.headline: 'Web of lies': Joe Biden slams Donald Trump on first anniversary of Capitol riot
06/01/2022.description: United States President Joe Biden has used a speech on the first anniversary of the 6 January Capitol riot to attack his predecessor, saying Donald Trump and his supporters put a "dagger at the throat of democracy."
06/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

06/01/2022.headline: Russia sends troops to Kazakhstan amid eruption of deadly violence
06/01/2022.description: Russia has deployed soldiers to Kazakhstan to help put an end to days of deadly anti-government protests in the Central Asian former Soviet republic.
06/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: Omicron is not a ‘mild’ variant warn WHO, epidemiologists
07/01/2022.description: Experts all over the world have raised serious concerns over the Omicron variant being considered “mild”, saying the coronavirus infection hasn’t yet become the common cold.
07/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: Vaccine mandate for high-risk workers, singing and dancing in venues banned, in NSW
07/01/2022.description: The ban has been brought in as part of a bid to bring COVID-19 case numbers and hospitalisations under contro
07/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: More Australian Open arrivals probed as Novak Djokovic's family hits out over visa cancellation
07/01/2022.description: Border officials are investigating two other people linked to the Australian Open who may have entered the country without being vaccinated against COVID-19.
07/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: How Australia uses rapid COVID-19 tests is changing. Here's what your state is doing
07/01/2022.description: Some of Australia's states and territories are moving away from PCR COVID-19 tests. This is what each is doing and how you can access support payments if you return a positive rapid antigen result.
07/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: North Korea, already banned from 2022 Olympics, announces it will not send team
07/01/2022.description: The country says it will skip next month's Beijing Olympics because of the COVID-19 pandemic and 'hostile forces' moves'.
07/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic's visa debacle throws spotlight on plight of detained asylum seekers
07/01/2022.description: Djokovic has been taken to the Park Hotel in Carlton, an "alternative place of detention" where detainees have reported being given meals with maggots and mould to eat in recent times.
07/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: US and Japan look to collaborate more on defence to counter emerging threats
07/01/2022.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the two countries would sign a new defence collaboration deal following instability in the region.
07/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: Soldiers to help hospitals in the UK in face of Omicron spread
07/01/2022.description: The British government is calling in the military to help support the nation's COVID-19 response amid growing healthcare staff shortages caused by the virus.
07/01/2022.author: Rachel Eddie

07/01/2022.headline: Treasurer Josh Frydenberg tests positive for COVID-19
07/01/2022.description: The Treasurer and deputy leader of the Liberal Party announced his diagnosis on Twitter.
07/01/2022.author: Carrie Fellner

07/01/2022.headline: Kazakh president orders forces to open fire without warning
07/01/2022.description: Kazakh President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev's comments come after days of uprising in the Central Asian former Soviet republic.
07/01/2022.author: Carrie Fellner

07/01/2022.headline: Parents and carers are writing lullabies to help Indigenous children connect to Country
07/01/2022.description: A special project in Adelaide is helping Indigenous children connect to Country through personalised lullabies written and sung by their parents and carers.
07/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

07/01/2022.headline: Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull and Treasurer Josh Frydenberg test positive for COVID-19
07/01/2022.description: The former Liberal Party leader is experiencing "moderate" symptoms, while Josh Frydenberg said he is isolating with his family.
07/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

07/01/2022.headline: What will happen to all our COVID-19 data after the pandemic?
07/01/2022.description: OPINION: QR code check-ins have become normalised for many people in Australia during the COVID-19 pandemic, but questions remain about what will happen to all that data.
07/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

08/01/2022.headline: RATs to be accepted for COVID disaster payment claims as government tightens eligibility
08/01/2022.description: The federal government is making changes to the Pandemic Leave Disaster Payment, as states and territories move away from PCR COVID-19 tests to rapid antigen tests. Here's what you need to know.
08/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

08/01/2022.headline: Victoria sets national COVID-19 daily case record with 51,356 new infections, NSW has 45,098
08/01/2022.description: NSW has consistently recorded the highest daily number of COVID-19 cases of any jurisdiction nationally since the Omicron variant hit Australian shores, but this how now been surpassed by Victoria.
08/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

08/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic breaks his silence as a second Australian Open player is detained
08/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic has sent a message of thanks to his supporters, as Czech doubles player Renata Voracova joined him in a quarantine hotel after having her visa cancelled, despite arriving in Australia last month.
08/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

08/01/2022.headline: Kazakhstan detains former security chief on suspicion of treason amid violence
08/01/2022.description: The former head of Kazakhstan's national security committee is among several officials detained following violence and protests in the Central Asian country.
08/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

08/01/2022.headline: 'He opened doors for all of us': Tributes pour in for pioneering Black movie star Sidney Poitier
08/01/2022.description: Sidney Poitier, Hollywood's first major Black movie star who won mainstream popularity with a series of groundbreaking roles in the 1950s and 1960s, has died aged 94.
08/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

08/01/2022.headline: Three men sentenced to life in prison for murder of Black US jogger Ahmaud Arbery
08/01/2022.description: As he handed down the sentence, the judge called the murder of Black man Ahmaud Arbery "a tragedy on many, many levels.&quo
08/01/2022.author: Garry Maddox

08/01/2022.headline: Melbourne immigration detention hotel 'like prison', tennis player says, as protests continue
08/01/2022.description: Iranian asylum seeker Hossein Latifi feels “hopeful” that people are learning about his plight as a result of Novak Djokovic being detained at Melbourne's Park Hotel.
08/01/2022.author: None found

08/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic had COVID-19 before arrival in Australia, court papers reveal
08/01/2022.description: World No.1 tennis player Novak Djokovic contracted COVID-19 ahead of his trip to Melbourne for the Australian Open, court documents sho
08/01/2022.author: None found

08/01/2022.headline: South Australian premier isolating after daughter tests positive to COVID-19
08/01/2022.description: South Australian Premier Steven Marshall says he has no COVID-19 symptoms but will isolate for seven days after his daughter tested positiv
08/01/2022.author: None found

08/01/2022.headline: Australia urged to take action with global dementia cases set to triple by 2050
08/01/2022.description: The number of adults living with dementia worldwide is set to nearly triple by 2050 to 153 million, according to new researc
08/01/2022.author: Rachael Dexter

09/01/2022.headline: 'Beyond reckless': Unions call urgent talks with Scott Morrison over changes to isolation rules
09/01/2022.description: Unions wants urgent talks with the prime minister to discuss their concerns over NSW Health's decision to wind back isolation requirements for critical workers.
09/01/2022.author: Rachael Dexter

With more than 90 per cent of the country now vaccinated, there are hopes its approval will convince the remaining vaccine-hesitant few to finally get jabbed.

21/01/2022.description: The report has also called on the Australian government to match its coalition partners by committing to a "substantial intake" of Afghan refugees to meet the humanitarian need.

23/01/2022.headline: Another 58 people have died from COVID-19 across Australia
23/01/2022.description: A further 34 COVID-19-related deaths have been reported in New South Wales, with Victoria recording 14 new fatalities and Queensland reporting 10 further deaths.
23/01/2022.author: Robert Moran

23/01/2022.headline: Aerial skier Laura Peel leads Australia's team of Winter Olympians competing in Beijing
23/01/2022.description: Australia's Winter Olympians, headed by aerial world champion Laura Peel, have been in impressive form in the lead-up to the Beijing Games.
23/01/2022.author: Robert Moran

23/01/2022.headline: No security concerns for Australia's Olympic athletes in Beijing, chef de mission says
23/01/2022.description: Australian Winter Olympics chef de mission Geoff Lipshut says next month's Games in Beijing will be one of the safest places in the world for athletes.
23/01/2022.author: Robert Moran

23/01/2022.headline: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern cancels her wedding amid new COVID-19 rules
23/01/2022.description: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern's wedding, due for next weekend, won't be proceeding due to community spread of the COVID-19 variant Omicron.
23/01/2022.author: Robert Moran

23/01/2022.headline: 'Deeply concerning': Moscow accused of trying to install pro-Russia leader in Ukraine
23/01/2022.description: As tensions soar between Russia and Ukraine, the United Kingdom has issued a statement accusing the Kremlin of trying to install a pro-Russian leader in Ukraine.
23/01/2022.author: Robert Moran

23/01/2022.headline: Call made for COVID-19 pandemic royal commission
23/01/2022.description: The One Nation Leader says a royal commission is needed to prepare for 'another pandemic'.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Lynch

23/01/2022.headline: Muslimness a reason for my sacking, says former UK minister Nusrat Ghani
23/01/2022.description: Various scandals have drained public support from both Mr Johnson personally and his party.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Lynch

23/01/2022.headline: Italo-Australians watch from abroad as Italy gears up for presidential election
23/01/2022.description: Italian migrants in Australia share with SBS News their worries and hopes as the presidential election crystallises attention on the question of political stability.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Lynch

23/01/2022.headline: Tonga struggles with ash, psychological trauma after eruption and tsunami
23/01/2022.description: Aid workers say even as the relief effort is focused on the urgent provision of water and food, the psychological impact of waves rushing through and destroying villages will affect the lives of locals for some time.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Lynch

23/01/2022.headline: Stowaway survives in nose wheel of eleven-hour freight flight from Africa
23/01/2022.description: A man who hid in the wheel section in the nose of a freight plane has survived a long haul flight from Africa to Holland.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Lynch

23/01/2022.headline: Fears of a Russian invasion of Ukraine grow as UK alleges Russia plot to install new leader
23/01/2022.description: Britain has accused the Kremlin of seeking to install a pro-Russian leader in Ukraine, and a senior minister warns there will be harsh sanctions if that happens.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Lynch

23/01/2022.headline: Aerial skier Laura Peel leads Australia's Winter Olympic team heading to Beijing
23/01/2022.description: Australia's Winter Olympians, headed by aerial world champion Laura Peel, have been in impressive form in the lead-up to the Beijing Games.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Lynch
